loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a veteran in the market vending trade. She has been in business for fourteen years and has gained a wealth of experience serving her customers. She currently sells a selection of women’s clothing. To differentiate herself from her competitors, Svetlana offers higher quality clothing. She tries to keep a good variety on-hand for customers to choose from. 

Svetlana is married and has two children; a son and a daughter. Her business has helped her family afford new appliances for their apartment and do some remodeling work. It also will help provide necessary funds for the children to attend college.

Svetlana has requested a loan for $1000 to purchase new inventory for her business. She is grateful for the financial help she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” in the past. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Svetlana further as she works to provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling of porridge and cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beads in bulk

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 32. Her husband, Nhan, is 31. They have a daughter who is 6 years old. Loan makes sedge mats at home. Then she sells them  wholesaL. to a few sedge mat companies. Her husband sells lottery tickets daily. Their income is $12 per person/month. They want to get a loan of $75 to purchase materials for making sedge mats. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making sedge mats.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has a small kiosk at the Pervomaisky market in Nikopol, Ukraine where she sells a variety of women’s clothing. She has been in business for two years. The additional income from her business has been a real help to her and her husband, Yuri. It has enabled them to have some work done to improve their home and they have been able to save some money to help their 15 year old daughter when she enters college. Victoria has developed a reputation as a kind and honest entrepreneur. She has benefited from her relationship with “Nadiya Ukraine”, and we look forward to continuing to assist her with her business. 

Victoria has requested a loan for $500 to purchase new inventory for her kiosk. One of her goals is to broaden the assortment of products she has for sale. This loan will give her additional funds to pursue her goals and grow her business even further.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya has been able to combine her love of the outdoors with her small business where she sells hats and assorted outdoor clothing. An avid skier and mountain climber, she has enjoyed working for herself and having the flexibility to pursue her outdoor activities. She has developed a stable and profitable enterprise in the twelve years she has been in business. Currently, she has about $2000 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $400 each month.

In a typical month, Nataliya will buy new inventory twice a month. She has requested a loan to give her some extra capital to use for purchasing new supplies of hats and coats. She hopes to see a profitable summer season and would like to be prepared with an adequate amount of inventory to meet the demand.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent A. is a 25-year old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband. She has also trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. Milicent runs this small business of selling bananas adjacent to her home. She has been in this business for the last 4 years .She attributes her success due to hard work, determination, and two previous KMET  loans. Her business income is able to pay for household expenses. Millicent is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase additional stock of raw bananas in bulk and also to buy ripe bananas in small quantities.

loans.use: To increase the stock of bananas for her business

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a talented musician with extensive experience in choir leading. Due to life circumstances, she had to leave that pursuit in order to obtain a more stable income. Today, Tamara is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur selling women’s clothing and shoes. 
      
With certainty and hard-work, she has been able to grow her business and see it prosper over the last 10 years.  She has 20,000 Ukrainian Hrivna, or about $4000, invested in products and is able to replenish her inventory twice a month when she makes trips to Odessa. Her monthly income comes to around $800.

Today, Tamara is excited about the opportunity to replenish her stock with seasonal summer items and has requested a loan to give her some extra working capital. She believes this investment will help her meet the needs of her customers and will encourage them to return and shop with her again.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, trousers and tops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy charcoal, rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy five sacks of maize and vegetables

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi was born in 1974 and her husband was born in 1965. They have 3 daughters and a son between 10 and 20 years of age. Only the son attend school.They have 0.5 hectares of land for rice. Because of poor soil and spreading insects, their crop is only enough for them to eat. Their income is $12 per person/month. Now Chi operates a small tea shop at home to improve their income. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to supply for her tea shop. Chi will repay monthly.

loans.use: Supplying for the tea shop.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta A. is a 44-year old married mother of 10 living children. She has spent 23 years running her small vegetable kiosks business near Kisumu, Kenya. She has added charcoal to her stock to increase profits. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and many years in business coupled with a well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow despite competition. Benta has received and paid two previous loans from KMET, which she has used to scale up her business in response to increased demand for her goods. She is requesting a loan of $750, which she plans to use to purchase additional charcoal stock.

loans.use: To add charcoal to her inventory to supplement her current vegetable business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy extra vegetables

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina A. is a 65-year-old widow and mother of four children. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya. Dina started her business selling fish in 1961. With the profits, Dina set up four housing units (mud-walled houses), which she rents out at Kshs 500 (approximately US $15) a month. Her monthly income totals US $200. Dina's business is in a prime location on a busy street. Her years of experience and the friendly relationship she has with customers, plus three previous loans from KMET, have enabled her to establish a good clientele base. Dina plans to expand her business with her next loan of US $800.  She will use  the loan to invest in purchasing a stock of dry fish and to build more housing units.

loans.use: To increase the stock of dry fish.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna Agolla is a 59-year old widow who supports four children in her household. Her husband died in 1972. Despite the loss of husband Anna has raised and educated her four children. She started her charcoal selling business in 1972. Over the last 35 years she has seen her business grow. She purchases in bulk quantity and sells coal at wholesale to retailers. She also sells small quantities to consumers who cannot afford to buy in bulk.   With her small savings and two previous KMET loans, Anna was able to build 10 semi-permanent housing units, which she rents out at Kshs 500 (US $80) a month to supplement her coal business.  Her hard work, years of experience, and well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to succeed.  She plans to use the next loan of US $750 to purchase more coal stock.

loans.use: Purchase bulk charcoal stock

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen D. is married with one child and lives with her husband in Kisumu, Kenya. She started her charcoal-selling business in 1982. She buys the coal in bulk and sells to retailers. She has been in this business for the last 25 years. The prime location of her business, many years of experience, and her friendly interaction with customers has helped her increase her business greatly. Hellen is planning to expand her business with a loan of $600 to purchase more charcoal in bulk to meet the increased demand.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. is a 50-year-old widow who supports six children in her household.  She specializes in selling ready-made women’s dresses. Despite the stiff competition in her area, Margaret has always been able to attract old and new customers.  Her hard work, years of experience, good location of her business and well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to grow. She plans to use her next loan of  US $600 to purchase more clothing to meet the high demand of her customers.

loans.use: Increase the stock of ready-to-wear clothing in her business

loans.name: Ramon Ernesto

texts.en:
My name is Ramón Ernesto. I mainly work in the transport of people in my town. I have worked in this business for several years now, and it generates income for my family's expenses and other obligations. At the moment, I need to change the tires of my bus and I don't have enough money for this. Therefore, I am requesting your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ramón Ernesto, mi actividad principal es el transporte de pasajero en mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos, actualmente necesito cambiar las llantas del autobus y no cuento con el capital suficiente, razon por la cual solicito su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy tires for my bus

loans.name: Joel Ramon

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Joel Ramón. I am a merchant and I own a grocery store in the center of my neighborhood. This business generates the income necessary to pay for the expenses of my family. It's important to note that thanks to the income I receive from my business, I was able to improve my home.

At the moment I need to expand my inventory to offer a better variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Joel Ramon, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en el centro de mi colonia, actualmente este negocio es el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, es importante mensionar que gracias a los ingresos que persibo de este negocio he mejorado mi casa, actualmente necisto ampliar mis inventarios para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, margarine, flour, soap, refreshments, diary, and chicken

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.en: Hola mi nombre es Brenda Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación,  el que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que puedo atender a mis hijos, cosa que no podria hacer   si trabajara  en otro lugar, actualmente el volumen de ventas es mayor por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, logrando asi mayores ventas y de esa forma mejorar los ingresos y el nivlel de vida de mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de manteca, frijoles, arroz, manteca, lacteos, azucar, jabon, pollo, harina y dulces.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Brenda Patricia. I am a merchant and I own a small grocery store at my home. This allows me to have income and to take care of my family. This is important to me, and I've been involved in this for several years now.

At the moment, my sales volume has grown and I need to better stock my business so I can offer a better variety of products to my customers. This way, I can increase my sales and my income. This will allow me to create a better living standard for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Brenda Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, la que me permite obtener ingresos y cuidar de mi familia, situacion que para mi es muy importante. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, actualmente el volumen de venta es mayor y necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente y de esa forma mejorar las ventas y por ende los ingreos. logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: To buy margarine, sugar, beans, rice, bathroom tissue, diary, corn, bread, and vegetables.

loans.name: Donilia Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Donilia del Carmen. My business is to pack and sell condiments for food preparation. I have been in this business for several years now. It generates the income to cover the expenses of my family, because I'm a single mother and my children depend on the income generated from my business. It is important to mention that my children help me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Donilia del Carmen, mi actividad principal es el embado y venta de condimentos, para la preparación de los alimentos, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y mis hijos depende de los ingresos que genera este negocio, es importante mensionar que ellos me colaboran en su tiempo libres.

loans.use: To buy cinnamon, annatto, spices, anise, rosemary, linseed, pepper, oregano, cotton, and soup stock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Francisca. My main activity if selling home appliances door-to-door and by special order. I have dedicated myself to this type of work for several years, and it generates income for the expenses of my family and also commitments with the suppliers. Thanks to this business I have given an education to my children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Francisca, mi actividad principal es la venta de electrodomesticos de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he dado educación a mis hijos.

loans.use: To buy plates, soup bowls, spoons, vase sets, curtains, lamps, and silverware sets.

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.en:
My name is Iris Yolanda, and I am a businessperson. I have a small general store in my home, which is located in a strategic location within my neighborhood. I have several years of experience in this type of business, which generates income for my household expenses. It is important to mention that the volume of sales is greater each day and that's why I need to expand the variety of my business, I don't have the necessary capital to satisfy the demand.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Mi nombre es Iris Yolanda, soy comerciante tengo una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, ubicada en un lugar estrategico de mi colonia, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para mis gastos familiares, es importante mensionar que el volumente de veta cada dia es mayor por lo que necesito surtir mas mi negocio y no cuento con el capial suficiente para satisfacer la demanda.

loans.use: To buy lard, rice, sugar, ham, flour, and dairy products.

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Catalina del Carmen, and my principal activity is selling firewood and tortillas. I have several years of experience dedicating myself to this type of activity, which generates income to cover my expenses, since all my children are already married and I am on my own. At present I need to invest more in firewood since winter is coming and there is a shortage of this product, so I am asking for support from you.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Mi nombre es Catalina del Carmen, mi actividad principal es la venta de leña y torillas, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para mis gastos ya que todos mis hijos se casaron y quede sola, actualmente necesito inveritir mas en leña ya que se aproxima el invierno y este producto se vuelve escaso, razon por la cual solicito el apoyo de ustedes.

loans.use: To buy oak firewood and corn

loans.name: Ruth Esmeralda

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ruth Esmeralda, and I am a businessperson. My business is located on the plaza in my city. I have several years' experience dedicating myself to this type of activity, which generates income to pay for my family's expenses and also commitments with my suppliers. Thanks to this business, my children are getting ahead, since my husband died and I am on my own. My future plan is to have a more secure location.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Ruth Esmeralda, soy comerciante, tengo un negocio ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingreso para los gasts de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos, ya que mi esposo se murio y quede sola. mis planes futuros es poder tener un local mas seguro.

loans.use: To buy men's pants, boys' shirts, underclothes, mosquito nets, and ladies' blouses.

loans.name: Ada Betulia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ada Betulia, and my principal activity is the manufacture and sale of tortillas. My business is located in my home. I have several years of experience dedicating myself to this activity. Thanks to this business, I have helped my two daughters become professionals, and this motivates me to keep moving forward.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nobre es Ada Betulia, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ubicado en mi casa de habitación, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, gracias a este negocio he logrado hacer profesional a mis hijas (2), y eso me motiva a seguir adelante.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, and firewood

loans.name: Reina Cleotilde

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Reina Cleotilde, and my principal activity is the manufacture and sale of cookies and bread. I have several years' experience dedicating myself to this type of business, which generates income so that I can help with the expenses of my family. At present, I need to expand a part of my house in order to make a better place for my small business. Thanks to this business I can generate income and take care of my family at the same time.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Reina Cleotilde, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de turruones y pan, tengo varios años de de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actulamente necesito ampliar una parte de mi casa para poder instalar mejor la micro empresa, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos y atender a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, firewood, leavening, and baking powder.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia B. is a single mother who has raised her son, Dario Antonio (28), in their home of Teson in the northern peninsula of the Dominican Republic. To make a living, Sonia started her own business selling shoes, jeans, and china out of her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase new sandals and shoes to expand her business. Sonia says her goal is to one day rent out a space so she can have her own store separate from her house.

NOTE: Sonia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, who have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase new shoes and sandals for clothing store.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Gloria Cecilia, and I am a businessperson. I have a general store located in my home, a business which I started with my own effort, and thanks to God it was a good decision because, in addition to generating income, this business also permits me to take care of my family. I have been dedicating myself to this activity for several years. At present, I need to increase the variety of my business, because the customers are asking me for a greater variety of products.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es gloria cecilia, soy comerciante, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, negocio que inicie con esfuerzo propio y gracias a Dios ha sido una gran elección porque este negocio a parte que me genera ingresos tambien me permite antender a mi familia, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio en vista que los clientes me estan pidiendo mas variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, chicken, eggs, dairy products, flour, sardines, and sodas.

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.en:
Jossefa M., was born in 1950 in Catembe, Maputo Province. His father was a cook and his mother a teacher. Jossefa studied until the 3rd grade. Because Jossefa lost his parents at a young age, he started working as an assistant painter at the age of 17. He became a painter and worked for the Portuguese, who left Mozambique in 1974. After they left Jossefa used his savings to buy a boat, and started his fishing activities using a fishing rod. With his gains, Joseffa was able to buy fishing nets, and hire 9 workers with whom he worked with until the 2000 flood. Because of the flood Joseffa lost his nets and had to lay off the workers.

With government help he returned to fishing, with great difficultym, which led him to borrow from HLUVUKU in order to buy nets. He has taken 4 loans with which he has bought a boat and the engine. At this time Jossefa has 2 boats and 2 engines. He rents the second boat to friends. He has hired 6 full time workers and 2 part time helpers. He cares for 12 family members, including his children and grandchildren.

With the loan of 21.000,00MT Joseffa will buy new fishing nets, and maintain the engine and boats. Joseffa’s work has a great impact in his community because it creates jobs and provides fish, and other seafood products for the markets of the city of Maputo. In the future Joseffa plans on purchasing a bigger boat and more sophisticated nets, which will allow him to increase his income and create more jobs.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Guachene - Catembe Actividade: Pesca Valor Financiado: 21.000,00MT (840.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de redes de Pesca Início: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Jossefa M., nascido em 1950 na Catembe, Província de Maputo, Filho de Pai Cozinheiro e Mãe Professora estudou até 3ª Classe. Por ter perdido os seus pais cedo, aos dezassete anos começou a trabalhar como ajudante de pintor onde se tornou mestre e trabalhou para patrões Portugueses, os quais deixam Moçambique em 1974, facto que levou-o a usar o valor acumulado para compra de um barco, iniciando assim a actividade de pesca por anzóis. Com o rendimento conseguiu comprar redes e contratou 9 trabalhadores com os quais trabalhou até ao período das cheias de 2000 onde perdeu redes e teve que dispensa-los . Com ajuda do governo reactivou a sua actividade mas com ligeiras dificuldades o que–lhe levou a recorreu ao empréstimo na HLUVUKU para reforçar as redes e reparar o motor do barco. Conta com quatro empréstimos através dos quais conseguiu comprar o segundo barco e um motor. Neste momento conta com 2 barcos e 2 motores e que um dos barcos aluga aos amigos, emprega 6 trabalhadores efectivos e 5 eventuais, cuida de 12 pessoas entre filhos e netos. Com o empréstimo de 21.000,00MT pretende comprar novas redes de pesca e fazer a manutenção do motor de barco para melhor desenvolver a sua actividade. A sua actividade tem um impacto muito positivo na comunidade pois para alem de criar muitos postos de trabalho abastece o mercado local e cidade de Maputo com diversos mariscos. No futuro pretende adquirir um barco maior e redes sofisticadas o que lhe permitirá ter maior rendimento e criação de postos de trabalho na zona.

loans.use: To buy nets

payments.comment: Jossefa has successfully decided to repay this loan in advance.

loans.name: Santos Gabriel

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Gabriel, and my principal activity is the sale of dairy products door-to-door in my community. I have several years of experience in this type of business, which generates income to cover my family's expenses and other agreements. At present, I have a lot of customers and the product is not sufficient, so I need to invest more in order to satistfy the existing demand.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Gabriel, mi actividad princial es la venta de producto lacteos de manera ambulante en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos actualmente tengo bastante clientela y el producto no es suficiente por lo que necesito invertir mas para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: To buy cheese, butter, and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Noemi Amparo

texts.en:
My name is Noemi Amparo, and I am a businessperson. I have a business selling used clothing in my home, and I also distribute it door-to-door. I have several years of experience dedicating myself to this type of activity. Thanks to this business I am able to take care of my family and generate income to contribute to my family's expenses.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Mi nombre es Noemi Amparo, soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada en mi casa de habitacion y tambien distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo antender a mi familia y genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia.

loans.use: To buy men's shirts, children's clothes, women's clothes, and pants.

loans.name: Isabel Cristovão

texts.en:
Isabel Cristovão is 36 years old, born and raised by her parents in the Jangamo Province in Inhambane. She studied until 9th grade. In 1991 she worked in a textile factory, she sewed from her parents’ home and was not able to continue her studying because of the work shifts. Isabel has a son. In 1998 she built a house where she lives with her son and brother. In 2002, the textile factory closed and Isabel had her second son.

When the textile factory closed, Isabel was laid off and received benefits with which she bought a chicken coup and 1000 chicks. Isabel’s cousin referred her to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA where she learned about the possibility of acquiring credit. With her business Isabel supports her family and pys for the education of her sons.

With the loan of 10.000,00MT Isabel plans on expanding her business. Her business has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Isabel and her son, as well as providing chicken meat to her clients especially in the neighborhood of Campoane.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Campoene - Boane Cliente: Isabel Cristovão P. Sector de actividade: Avicultura Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT (400.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de Pintos e Ração Inicio: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Isabel Cristovão de 36 anos de idade, natural de Jangamo Provincia de Inhambane, cresceu sub a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. Estudou apenas até 9ª classe. Em 1991 começou a trabalhar na fábrica de processamento têxtil e fazia trabalhos de costura em casa dos seus Pais e não podia continuar com os seus estudos porque trabalhava por turnos. Teve um parceiro com o qual tem um filho. Em 1998 construiu sua própria casa onde passou a viver com o filho e seu irmão. No ano de 2002 deu-se a falência da texlom e por coincidência teve o seu segundo filho. Com a falência da Empresa onde ela trabalhava teve a sua indemnização que serviu para concluir com a sua obra e construiu um aviário com capacidade de 1.000 pintos.

A partir do ano em curso por indicação da sua prima que é cliente teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo aproximado e solicitado empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Com o rendimento do seu negocio suporta os encargos familiares e as despezas escolares dos seus filhos. Com o emprestimo de 10.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio, visto que a sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a ela e o seu filho, coloca frangos perto dos clientes e em particular destaque para todos residentes do bairro de campoane.

loans.use: To produce chickens

loans.name: Armando Amade

texts.en:
Armindo Amade W. is 43 years old, he was born and raised in Inhassunge, a Zambezia Province. He studied until the 6th grade. In 1981, Armindo was recruited to the military service and was discharged in 1986. He had 5 children with his wife who passed away in 2003 from an illness.

Since 1999 he has been providing for his family through his small commercial establishment in the Boane Market. In 2006 he was referred to HLUVUKU—ADSEMA by a friend. Armindo’s business is in good condition. It provides employment for Armindo and one of his sons, as well as supporting the family.

With the 19.000,00 MT loan Armindo will expand his business in order to keep a flowing stock to meet his clients needs. Armindo’s store has a positive impact in his community because it makes basic products available to his clients, especially in the Neghborhood 6. With his savings Armindo has been investing in improving his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 6 - Boane Cliente: Armindo Amade W. Sector de actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 19.000,00 MT (760.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de produtos . Inicio: 09/05/2007 Final: 30/04/2008 Armindo Amade W., de 43 anos de idade, natural de Inhassunge, Província de Zambezia, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. Estudou até 6ª classe. Em 1981 foi recrutado para o serviço militar e teve a sua desmobilização em 1986 e conheceu a sua parceira pelo qual teve 5 cinco filhos e depois ela veio a falecer em 2003 por motivo de doença.

Desde 1999 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial nas redondezas do mercado do Boane. No ano 2006 por indicação de um amigo que foi cliente da Hluvuku teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU—ADSEMA.

Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego a um dos filhos e com o rendimento do negocio suporta encargos familiares. Com o empréstimo de 19.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a evitar ruptura do stock. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque coloca o produto mas perto do cliente com particular destaque para todos residentes do Bairro 6 e com as poupanças tem investido na ampliação da sua residência.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia M. is a single mother who raised 10 children on her own and is the proud grandmother of 22 grandchildren who all still reside close together in Samana. One of her oldest sons helps her run a store selling food staples. Her store features her renowned chicken that Julia claims is the freshest around. She purchases live chickens from local markets, then plucks and prepares them for resale from her store. Her neighbors in the community of Teson purchase chicken thighs, breasts, and legs to cook in their homes for their families. Julia also cooks chicken with rice and beans that she serves to people for lunch. She is very proud of her products and she looks forward to continuing the growth of her business. With the help of this loan, she will buy more chicken, as well as rice and beans in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans and live chickens to prepare, cook, and sell.

loans.name: Moisés Leite

texts.en:
Moisés Leite T. is 30 years old, he was born in Chibuto, a Gaza province. He was raised by his uncle and had few opportunities to study. Since 2000 he has been supporting his family by operating his grocery shop. Moisés’s business is doing well, with the exception of the lack of some products because of the lack of capital to invest in the stock.

With the 10.500,00MT he intends to increase the volume of his stock which will enable him to increase profit and invest in the building of his home. Moisés’ business has a positive impact in the community because it provides Moises and his wife with employment, as well as placing basic needs products near his clients and the Marcone community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Marcone - Boane Cliente: Moises Leite T. Sector de actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 10.500,00MT (420.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade. Inicio: 09/05/2007 Final: 30/04/2008 Moisés Leite T., de 30 anos de idade, natural de Chibuto provincia de Gaza, cresceu sub a responsabilidade dos seus Tios e teve poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde o ano 2000, vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo, apesar de ter falta de alguns produtos essenciais por falta de capital suficiente. Com o empréstimo de 10.500,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria de o que vai lhe permitir ter mais receitas para terminar as obras de construção da sua residência. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio e sua esposa coloca o produto mas perto dos cliente e a toda comunidade de Marcone.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando José Chalimbais is 52 years old. He was born and raised in Barue, in the province of Manica. Fernando was raised by his maternal grandparents, who enabled him to work until the 6th grade in Zimbabwe. Fernando joined the military when he was 18 years old and served for 13 years. In 1986, in a mission he suffered an accident and was hospitalized for 1 year, following his release from the hospital he was unable to return to his original position. In 1990, Fernando started buying and selling fire wood, in which he was not very successful.

In 1995, he started raising and breeding chickens. Now he has an aviculture business with, 2 chicken coups, through which he supports his family. In 2006, Fernando was referred by friends to Hluvuku-Adsema, where he learned about the possibility of acquiring loans in order to enlarge his business. Since then Fernando’s business has grown as he took out several loans to invest in his business. Now his business is doing well. It provides employment for 3 full time workers. With revenue from his business Fernando supports his family, including the schooling of his children.

With the loan of 16.500,00 MT Fernando plans on expanding the volume of his business. Fernando’s business has a positive impact in his community because it provides employment for Fernando, his sons and wife, as well as providing the community, especially in Boane, with fresh chicken.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 07 - Boane Cliente : Fernando José C. Sector de actividade : Agro – pecuária Valor de empréstimo: 16.500,00 MT (660.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Criação de pintos (Avicultura). Inicio : 09/05/2007 Fim : 30/04/2008 Fernando José C. de 51 anos de idade, natural de Barue, província de Manica, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos avos na parte da mãe, a situação financeira da família criou lhe oportunidades para estudar ate sexta classe em Zimbabwe. Foi ao serviço militar com 18 anos tendo ficando no exercito 13 anos. Em 1986 em missão de serviço sofreu um acidente e ficou de baixa no hospital durante 1 ano, a sua saída do hospital já estava sem condições de voltar a exercer a sua função. Em 1990 começou com actividade de compra e venda de lenha, no qual não teve bastante sucesso.

Em 1995 optou por abraçar actividade de avicultura da qual garante a sobrevivência da família até hoje e possui dois aviários. A partir do 2006 por indicação de amigos e vizinhos teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo aproximado e solicitado o primeiro empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Desde então, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinâmica tendo solicitado vários outros empréstimo. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego 3 pessoas, com os rendimentos da sua actividade suporta os encargos familiares, incluindo despesas escolares.

Com o empréstimo de 16.500,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume de seu negocio. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais os filhos e a esposa, coloca o produto mais perto do cliente, com particular destaque para população de Boane.

loans.use: To produce chickens

loans.name: Edis Oneyda

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Edis Oneyda, and my principal activity is selling dairy products and treats. I have a business in my home, and two years of experience in this type of activity, which generates income to cover the expenses of my family since I am a single mother. At present, my greatest necessity is to buy chairs and tables in order to offer better service to my customers, because now I don't have the furniture to make them comfortable.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Edis Oneyda, mi actividad principal es la venta de productos lactos y golosinas, cuento con un negocio en mi casa de habitación, con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera. Actualmente mi mayor necesidad es la compra de sillas y mesas para poder ofrecer un merjor servicio al cliente ya que no cuento con el mobiliario para mayor comodidad.

loans.use: To buy 4 sets of plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Valentina Da Conceiç

texts.en:
Valentina da Conceição D. M. is 41 years old, born and raised in the city of Maputo. She was raised by her parents, who enabled her to study until the 9th graD., when Valentina interrupted her studies due to a pregnancy.

Following her divorce in 2000, Valentina has provided for her family through her small commercial business. In 2006 she was referred by the women from Market K 16 to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, where she learned about the possibility of taking loans to expand her business. Since then the business has grown. Now Valetina’s business is doing well and provides employment for Valentina and her sister. With the revenue from the store she supports her family, and pays for the schooling of her daughter. She was also able to open a bank account.

With the loan for 15,000.00 MT, Valentina will increase the volume of her stock to respond to the demands of her clientele. Valentina’s business has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment Valentina and her sister, as well as providing the community of the Thanda Vanto with products and quality service.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Thanda – Vanto - Boane Cliente: Valentina da Conceição D. M. Sector D. ActividaD.: Comercio Valor D. empréstimo: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação D. empréstimo: Compra e venda D. produtos Inicio: 9/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Valentina da Conceição D. M. D. 41 anos D. idaD. Natural D. Maputo CidaD., Provincia D. Maputo, cresceu sub a responsabilidaD. dos seus Pais, a situação financeira da familia lhe criou oportunidades para estudar ate a 9ªClasse tendo deixado D. estudar por motivo D. gravidez com 19 anos D. idaD..

Depois da separação com seu marido no ano 2000, vem assumindo na integra a gestão do negocio para sobrevivência da família, e, possui um estabelecimento Comercial. A partir do ano 2006 por indicação D. algumas senhoras D. Mercado K16 teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA tendo aproximado e solicitado um empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. DesD. então, a sua actividaD. conheceu outra dinâmica. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia Emprego a uma Irmã. Com o rendimento do seu negocio suporta as despesas escolares da sua filha e conseguiu abrir uma conta bancária.

Com o empréstimo D. 15000 MT pretenD. aumentar o volume D. venda das mercadorias D. forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes . A sua actividaD. tem um impacto maior na comunidaD. porque alem D. providenciar emprego para ela própria, emprega mais uma senhora que por coincidência é sua irmã e também providencia um serviço D. qualidaD. para a comunidaD. do bairrro Thanda Vanto.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en: Ana Maria R. has four grown children and 5 grandchildren. She lives with her husband, Thomas Ismael, in the small town of Rincon located along the beach on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. She sells shoes, children’s clothing, women’s clothing and hair accessories like barrettes, combs, clips, and brushes. She has received and successfully paid back three loans. This loan of $450 will allow her to buy sheets wholesale from the capital of the Samana Province. Ana Maria looks forward to adding bedding to her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase bedding for her retail store.

loans.name: Samuel Joaquim

texts.en:
Samuel Joaquim S. is 48 years old. He was born and raised in Maputo. He was raised by his parents. Due to his family’s financial situation, Samuel did not have many opportunities to study. He started working when he was 15 as an attendant.

Since 1998, Samuel has supported his family through his store. In 2007, he was introduced to HLUVUKU- ADSEMA by acquaintances. Currently, his business is doing well, but Samuel needs to increase stock of products in order to serve the demands of his clientele.

With the loan of 11.000,00 MT he plans on increasing the stock of his business and hire additional help. Samuel’s business has a positive impact in his community because it provides employment for Samuel, as well as putting basic products within the reach of his community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Campoane - Boane Cliente: Samuel Joaquim S. Sector de actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 11.000,00 (440.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de produtos Inicio: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Samuel Joaquim S. de 48 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, província de Maputo, cresceu na responsabilidade dos seus pais, a situação financeira da família criou-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar e teve que começar a trabalhar com os seus 15 anos como servente.

Desde 1998 veio assumindo na integra a gestão do negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial. A partir deste ano de 2007 teve o conhecimento de existência da HLUVUKU- ADSEMA por indicações de colegas. Actualmente a sua actividade esta num ritmo razoável, mas precisa de reforçar o stock em produtos de modo a providencia cada vez melhor qualidade de serviços para sua clientela.

Com o empréstimo de 11.000,00MT, pretende aumentar stock e tenciona admitir uma empregada de forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio, coloca produtos mais perto do cliente.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and has 2 small children. She and her mother run a restaurant that is very popular in their neighborhood. Maria has been around restaurants since she was very young because her mother always ran similar businesses. Now they are business partners and are having great success. Maria also sells shoes, clothes, and home products to many of the clients at her restaurant, and she also travels into large markets in the city to make her sales.

Maria is a single mother. The father of the first left her shortly after finding out she was pregnant, and the father of the second passed away two months after the child was born. Even so, she is hardworking and optimistic.

Maria is taking out her second loan with the Kiva and Mifex program. With the first loan she concentrated on her retail business. She invested in electrical domestic appliances and resold them in her neighborhood and in some rural communities. Selling appliances has been very profitable and successful for Maria. She hopes that the Kiva community will continue supporting her and her family.

loans.use: Invest in domestic appliances

loans.name: Carlos Alexandre

texts.en:
Carlos Alexandre M. is 41 years old. He is a native of Maputo. Carlos was raised by his uncles. In 1978, his schooling was interrupted because of the lack of spaces in the local school.

When Carlos started the 5th grade, his grandfather decided to teach him fishing instead. Four years later, Carlos emigrated to South Africa seeking better living conditions. There he worked for 10 years, and he married in 1985. Due to social problems he returned to Mozambique where he started fishing in the Umbeluzi River in 1993. Carlos was introduced to Hluvuku by his neighbors. He requested a loan for fixing his boat which fishes in the Barragem de Pequenos Libombos. With the revenue he pays for the maintenance of 2 boats, pays for the building of his home, and supports his sons and 3 wives.

With the loan of 21.000,00 MT, Carlos plans on buying fishing nets to fish in the Barragem de Corrumane in the neighboring district of Moamba. Carlos hopes that this investment will increase his earnings, and provide employment for 4 more people. Carlos’s business has a positive impact in his community because it provides the Boane community with fresh fish, as well as providing employment for Carlos and 6 other workers (all of whom are the primary bread winners for their families).

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Campoane - Boane Nome: Carlos Alexandre M. Sector de Actividade: Pesca Valor de empréstimo: 21.000,00 MT ( 840.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de material de pesca Inicio: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2007 Carlos Alexandre M. de 44 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos tios a pastar gado caprino, em 1978 viu os seus estudos interrompidos devido a falta de vagas, quando transitou de quarta para quinta classe foi nessa altura em que o avô preferiu ensinar-lhe a pesca em 1980 quando 4 anos depois emigrou para África do Sul a Procura de melhores condições de vida onde trabalhou 10 anos, casou em 1985 e por problemas sociais viu-se obrigado a regressar para Moçambique onde iniciou a pesca no Rio Umbeluzi em 1993.

Através de alguns vizinhos soube da existência da Hluvuku onde foi solicitar um crédito para a recuperação de um dos seus barcos que se encontra em actividade na Barragem de Pequenos Libombos com os rendimentos dos negócios suporta as despesas de manutenção dos seus 2 barcos, a conclusão da sua casa, as despesas de alimentação dos seus filhos e suas 3 Mulheres.

Com o empréstimo de 21.000,00( Vinte e um mil meticais) pretende comprar redes de pesca para trabalhar na Barragem de Corrumane no distrito vizinho de Moamba e espera com este investimento aumentar suas receitas, para alem de providenciar emprego para mais 4 pessoas. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque além de providenciar peixe fresco para comunidade de Boane e emprego para ele próprio e outras 6 pessoas chefes de famílias.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has been running this business for about 20 years. She started with the help of a family member living abroad who sent her $2 (50,000 sucres), which at the time went a long way in Ecuador. Her husband passed away 32 years ago, and she was left to raise her 6 children on her own. For a long time she was a seamstress and often worked all night in order to support her family. Today her children are all grown and two still live with her.

She runs this business because her children do not earn enough to support her. She feels proud to be independent and to be able to help her children. She is seeking her second loan with Kiva and Mifex, which she will use to invest in cosmetics. With the first she also expanded her inventory, offering items such as ice cream and fresh bread. The extra profits she realized have mostly gone into savings. The whole family is grateful for the first loan and look forward to continued success.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics

loans.name: Dante  Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel V. has 20 years of experience making and selling sandals. He inherited his shop from his father and remembers working in the shop as a boy. Over time he had a family of his own and started a business in masonry with the help of his wife and children. Unfortunately, Daniel’s father passed away, and he is now responsible for managing both businesses. Mr. V. reports that he has been able to earn enough to feed, clothe, and educate his family, but he has grander visions for expanding his two businesses. This hard-working entrepreneur opens up shop every day a 8 am and closes at 8 pm.

Daniel is a 38-year-old married man from Guayaquil, Ecuador with three beautiful children. Daniel’s wife mainly takes care of the children and the house, but she does a fair share of the work at “Sandalias Daniel.” Daniel’s goal is to become a large distributor of sandals in Ecuador by consistently expanding his business and advertising his products by word of mouth.

Daniel is looking to take out his second loan with Kiva and Mifex. His operation has grown bigger since he received his first loan. He now has a workshop where he, his wife, and two of his brothers manufacture sandals. His investments in raw materials proved worthwhile, as he was able to increase his production and profits. He has been saving some extra money with the thought of renovating his home, but he has been focused on investing in the business and continuing to expand it. He will continue to buy raw materials and tools for his shop.

loans.use: Invest in raw materials and tools

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is in the business of selling clothes and other items. He travels around the community and also to the rural sector, specifically targeting friends, family, and acquaintances. Macario has been selling clothes for about 6 years. Although his business is somewhat profitable, it does not always provide enough for him and his family. Therefore, Macario also buys and sells rice. He travels in his truck to rural Ecuador where he buys directly from the rice farmers. He sells the rice to many small stores around Guayaquil. He is on his second loan with Kiva and Mifex and hopes he can expand his inventory to include domestic appliances.

Macario is 53 years old and has 2 kids, only one of which is still living at home. His wife works as a housecleaner and sometimes gets jobs taking care of the elderly.

loans.use: Invest in appliances

loans.name: Lourden

texts.en:
Lourden P. buys coconuts from her neighbors and sells them to the large trucks that come to her house twice per week. The trucks then take the coconuts into the capital city of Samana for distribution. Her business supports her four children: Yoham (17), Carolina (15), Yani (14), and Chicho (13). Lourden has repaid her first loan and is applying for this loan to purchase a larger quantity of coconuts to meet the high demand that the trucking shipments provide, and save up to fix the electricity in her home. She lives in the community near Playa Rincon on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, about 800 miles from Miami.

NOTE: Lourden is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, who have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $800 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of coconuts.

loans.name: Inés

texts.en:
Ines has owned her clothing store for twenty years. When she first began at the age of 18, she was looking to support herself when her husband left her. She sold fast food, household items, clothes, and women’s accessories, so now she is mature enough to be considered a seasoned salesperson. Ines wanted to sell clothes because they were her favorite products to sell, and she thought she could make a decent living selling quality products door-to-door. She did that for a period of time, marketing her items mainly to friends and family, as well as local neighborhoods where she knew most of the people.

This 37 year-old entrepreneur has four children, all of whom still live with her. Two of the children are working and help Ines financially with necessities for the house. Her husband has been working in a factory for the last 15 years, and whenever Ines has to attend to her children or visit her distributors, her husband is able to watch over the business which is open from 8am until 11pm every day.

Ines has borrowed from Kiva and Mifex before. She was able to successfully invest her first loan. She saved her extra profits after purchasing a wide variety of products to sell. Shortly afterwards, she opened a new point of sale that is being run by her children. She is very happy about this because it is bringing in extra income for herself and also providing for her children. The new loan she will take out will be invested in new inventory for her two stores.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Ginger

texts.en:
Ginger has one year's experience. Her father helped her in her business by giving her the 80 gas cylinders with which to start her business. She has done very well and has been able to keep and increase her business. At the present time she has 125 cylinders. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. at which time another person is paid to fill in for her until the next day. She rents the business premises where she works.

Ginger will invest her credit in buying more cylinders since there is great demand. Her clients have recommended her because of the great service she provides.

Ginger is single and lives with her mother and siblings. She has been working with her family since she was a little girl. At present, she is studying to teach children and hopes to graduate and start her teaching career.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Ginger tiene una experiencia de 1 año con su actividad. Su papa fue la persona que le ayudo en su negocio. Le dio 80 cilindros de gas con los que inicio. Le ha ido muy bien en este tiempo ya que mantiene su negocio y lo ha logrado incrementar con más cilindros. Actualmente posee 125 cilindros. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. A partir de las 8 p.m. hasta el siguiente día atiende el negocio otra persona. A la cual le paga por su servicio. El local donde tiene el negocio es alquilado.

Ginger el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas cilindros ya que su demanda va en aumento. Sus clientes le han referido por la atención con la brinda su servicio.

Ginger es soltera. Vive con su mama y hermanos. Desde muy pequeña ella conoció la actividad ya que trabajaba junto a su familia. Ella esta estudiando para profesora de niños. Esperando algún día graduarse y comenzar a ejercer su profesión.

loans.use: Purchasing gas cylinders

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has been working with her mother selling gas since she was ten years old. Her mother's separation from her father was Karen's main motive in helping her mother. She received help from her father to begin her business a year ago. She keeps her business open for 24 hours a day if there is demand for her product. She rents the locale where she has both her business and her home.

Karen will invest her credit in buying more cylinders, and she will take advantage of the low price she is being offered so that she will make a larger profit.

Karen is a 20 year old single mother. She has a daughter who is in school. Thanks to her job, her daughter is getting an education. Her mother helps her when she needs it. She hopes to save money to buy herself a plot of land and little by little build her home.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Karen desde la edad de 10 años ya trabaja junto a su mama en la venta de gas. Su mama se separo de su papa motivo que la hizo pensar en ayudar a su mama. Recibe la ayuda de su padre con la que inicia su actividad hace 1 año. Lo mantiene trabajando todos los días de la semana las 24 horas si la demanda lo amerita. Ella arrienda en este momento el local donde tiene su negocio y en el cual vive.

Karen el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas cilindros. Aprovechando que le están dejando cilindros a bajo precio. Con estos ella obtendrá una mejor ganancia.

Karen es madre soltera. Tiene 20 años. Una hija la cual estudia. Ella gracia ha su trabajo ha logrado darle educación. Recibe la ayuda de su mama cuando lo necesita. Su deseo es poder ahorrar y con ese dinero comprarse un solar. Donde poco a poco ir construyendo su casita.

loans.use: Invest in Gas cylinders

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza, has twelve years experience working in a obstretician's office. After three years working in an office in her area, she has been entrusted with the mission of opening up her own office where she has been working for the past nine years. She began working by herself and thanks to her effort and perseverance, she has been able to maintain herself because of her constant dedication.

Esperanza is requesting a credit to increase her business which has grown because of the excellent attention she gives her patients. With this loan, Esperanza will buy medicines for prenatal care and instruments to carry out pap smears and other tests.

Esperanza is a 41 year old single mother of a 13 year old son who is in school. Esperanza hopes that this credit will help her better her business and the attention she gives her patients since she is located in a marginal area with limited resources and services. She needs the credit to buy medicines at a lower cost and in this manner better serve her patients in the most economical and efficient manner.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Esperanza con su experiencia de 12 años y 3 años trabajando en un consultorio del sector, le han dado la confianza para poner su propio consultorio el cual lo viene desempeñando desde hace 9 años. Se inicio individualmente gracias al esfuerzo y continuidad, de esa manera ha logrado mantenerse gracias a la constante dedicación que Esperanza posee.

Esperanza pide un crédito para incrementar su negocio. Debido a que su demanda aumentado gracias a su buena atención. Con este préstamo Esperanza comprara medicamentos para el control Prenatal y espátulas para realizar exámenes de papanicolao y otros.

Esperanza tiene 41 años es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 13 años que esta estudiando. Esperanza tiene la confianza que con el crédito aspira mejorar su negocio y su atención a sus clientes, por estar en un sitio marginal de escasos recursos y servicios. Esperanza necesita el crédito para comprar medicinas a menor costo y de esta manera poder servir a sus clientes de la manera más económica y eficiente.

loans.use: Purchasing medicine

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
I have been involved in the sale of blends and fruit drinks for three years. My business is in my house and serves as a pastime since I cannot work outside the home because of my failing health. I am requesting help since I use the profits from my business to buy medicines and help my family with their home expenses.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hace 3 años que me dedico a la venta de licuados y frefrescos naturales. Este negocio lo tengo en mi casa, Lo cual me entretengo ya que no pudeo trabajar por por que no estoy muy bien de salud, me gustaria que ayudaran ya que con las ventas que hago compro medicamentos y ayudo a mi familia con gastos de la casa.

loans.use: Purchasing fruits, glasses, straws and other items

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin S., a 34-year old mother of 3 children who are in school, lives with her husband in Cambodia. S. sells fresh vegetables at a busy market and typically makes around US$6 per day in revenue, while her husband can make a moderate salary from operating a motor-taxi business. S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more vegetables in order to respond to the large demand.  One day, she hopes to own another stand in a market to make additional income from this business.

loans.use: To purchase extra vegetables for sale

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Mrs. Thom L. is 40 years old and is married with 5 children. She makes her living by growing rice crops and some kinds of vegetables in her field which scarcely makes enough money to support her five children 
(one of whom sells live pigs in and to a nearby village, while the rest are in school). To service all the family needs, her husband (pictured here with his business) helps to make additional income by selling live pigs from one village to another. Thom L. is asking for $1000 loan to invest in her husband's business by purchasing more pigs and a motor-bike to transport them for outdoor selling. With this business activity, Thom L. thinks it is possible for her and her family to meet their needs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a motor-bike to run  a business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok R., 49 years old, is a mother of 8 children (two of whom are pictured here) and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband who is 62 years old operate a mat-making business and sell mats to retail stores and a nearby market. In order to expand their business, the couple is asking for US$1200 to purchase more raw materials to make additional mats in response to the growing demand.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her mat-making business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey H., 48 years old, is a mother of 4 children and a farmer. She sells crops and raises animals in her farm which brings some money to support her family. Her husband (pictured here, because Srey H. is unavailable) is a farmer and a traditional musician. He is a big help to the household with the US$10 he makes per day. One of their sons works at the construction, and a part of his salary helps in financing the family. The couple's other children are all students. Srey H. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase more animals to raise in her field. 
One day, she also hopes to own another piece of land for her inventory expansion.

loans.use: To purchse more seeds and animals

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou S., 33 years old, is married with 3 children. She is a housewife and barely makes any money from growing very little crops in her small land behind her house. In order to supplement the family, her husband (picture here) works very hard in the construction and typically makes around $5/day for his entire household. S. is asking for $500 loan to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to travel from and to work so that he no longer spend for a daily service on a motor-taxi. Another part of the money is spend for the construction tools. S.'s husband hopes sooner or later, he would become a construction foreman, then he is able to create more additional money for his household.

loans.use: To purchase some construction tools and a motor-bike in order to transport  them from and to work.

loans.name: Rip

texts.en: Mrs. Rip P. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She  looks after children and cooks meal for the family, while her husband is a construction worker and makes around $3/day, which is hardly enough to service the family's expenses. To supplement their income, three of her children help by working at construction like their farther does. Rip P. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase construction tools for her sons and her husband's business and the rest is to repair house in order to protect it from the leaking in the coming rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and to repair house

loans.name: Luon

texts.en: Mrs. Luon S. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers, growing rice crops and some kinds of vegetables, and typically make around $3/day in revenue. Two of her children are construction workers who give a big share of their earnings to their family savings and the other two are enrolled school. S. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a cow to help in plowing soils for the next rice and vegetable crops.

loans.use: To buy  a cow to help in plowing soils to grow the next crops.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Luon Sarom for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch R. is 51 years old and is a mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To supplement the family's income, she and her husband raise pigs and other domestic animals. Pig raising is a main business of this couple and it typically contributes around $4/day in revenue. Three of their children are construction workers, while another one (pictured here because Uch R. is unavailable) is a student and cooks meal for her family.

Uch R. is asking for $1200 to increase the number of her pigs and to buy a simple motor-bike to transport pigs from and to market. With the increased number of pigs, this couple hopes to have enough money to improve her family's quality of life one day.

loans.use: To  purchase some more pigs to raise and a motor-bike to transport pigs to sell at the market

loans.name: Larn

texts.en:
A19-year-old ambitious man, Larn R., lives with his wife (pictured here) and ailing mother in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is a struggling husband and grateful son who works very hard at construction in order to support his entire family. He is the one who handles all the family's expenses with a meager wage from construction.

Larn R., who has two little children, is humbly requesting a $700 loan to help him in purchasing some construction tools to facilitate his job and to buy a simple motor-bike to travel from and to work so that he no longer spends so much for his daily transportation. Larn R. hopes sooner or later he would become a construction foreman, so that he would make additional income for his family, especially for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for his business

payments.comment: Larn Rean has successfully repaid his loan early! Thanks to you, he was able to expand his business and improve the life of his family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Houy

texts.en:
Mrs. Houy S., a 36-year-old mother of 4 children who are in school, lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a housewife looking after her school children and cooking meals for a family, while her husband (pictured here) works in the field, where he grows rice crops and some kinds of vegetable such as tomato, salad, chili, onion, and potato to sell to the market. With this business activity, her husband typically makes around $4/day which is a big help to his family's budget.

This couple is asking for a $400 loan to purchase more seeds to grow and to buy a motor-bike to transport their rice crops and other types of vegetables to the market. Due to the expansion and increasing number of their clients, this couple would like to own another piece of land to grow a greater amount of crops in order to satisfy their clients as well as giving their family a better quality of life one day.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and a motor-bike in order to transport their rice crops to the market.

payments.comment: Houy Sathum has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is an elderly widow born in 1950. She has a daughter and two sons who have given her nine grandchildren, as well as a younger son who is in secondary school in the nearby city of Kakamega. Sarah started her business in 2002, which includes selling cereals, fruits and vegetables. She does her business in the community’s local trading center on the market days of Sunday and Thursday and out of her home the rest of the time.

She is an active member of PEMCI and she has completed her first loan successfully. This first loan enabled her to increase her stock so that whereas she was selling cereals only, now she has been able to include fruits and vegetables in her stock. She was able to pay her loan promptly and she wishes to get a second loan from PEMCI. With the proposed loan, Sarah plans to not only increase her stock of cereals during this coming harvesting season, but to possibly open and cook for a small food stall on a busy junction road. One day she hopes to even build small houses to rent. She has been able to bring services to the community through her business, and hopes to be able to make a greater profit to help her pay school fees for her youngest son and grandchildren.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is an active member of PEMCI. He has finished his first loan successfully. The first loan enabled him to purchase equipment for his video shop. He started his business two years ago. He is not married and he has not had any formal training.  With the proposed second loan from PEMCI Martin wishes to open another video shop. Through his business, Martin has been able to pay school fees for his siblings and attend to his personal needs. He has brought entertainment services and the world closer to his community through his video shows.

loans.use: To Buy Equipment for a Video Shop

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Mrs. Morm R., 35-year-old mother of 2 children who are enrolled in school, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement the family revenue, she runs a grocery store on the roadside of this village and typically makes in average $11/day, while her husband earns around $3/day from his work at a local clinic. Morm R. is asking for $1000 loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory as well as to satisfy an increase in the number of her clients. The  sustainable development of this business motivates her to go ahead and be able to provide a high level of her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a mother of four who started her business in 2002. It includes buying cereals, especially maize, from the farmers during harvest seasons and selling in retail at the local trading centre. She is a trained tailor and dress maker. At first she used to make dresses to sell at the trading centre, but quit when she saw there was stiff competition and turned to selling cereals.  She says the business is doing well.  She also molds bricks and sells them at construction sites. Through her businesses, she has been able to educate her children and support her family. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase on her cereals stock and also purchase some more brick molding tools.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals and buy brick-molding tools

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mr. Ven V., who is 41 years old and is a father of 1 child, lives in another part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a head of the family and is the one who controls all the family expense, while his wife stays at home cooking meals and looking after her child. V. drives a car to transport the garment workers from and to their jobs. With this business activity, he can typically makes around $9/ day in revenue. To do this, V. is asking for $600 to afford to purchase a car in order to operate this business. With this car, V. would like to use it not only to transport garment workers, but also to carry other's market products in order to make additional income. In the future, V. is still thinking about how to make additional money for his family and for a high level of his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a car to transport the garment workers from and to work.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a single mother of four, all in school. She trained at Joy Medical Centre and afterwards opened a chemist shop where she works to date. She started her business in 2002 when she saw there was an unmet demand for the service in her community. There are only two chemists in the trading centre, hers included, so she has a good number of customers.

Her existing stock right now can be estimated at Kshs. 7,000/= in drugs form. She gets her stock of drugs from Bungoma town. Apart from her business, Evalyne is also a small-scale farmer specializing in planting maize and beans. Through her business, she has been able to educate her children, develop her farm and sustain her family. She has also brought services near to the community. With the proposed loan of $150 from PEMCI, she wishes to increase her stock of drugs and buy fertilizer for her maize farm. We recommend her loan for support by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Stock her chemist shop and buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne W. is a graduate of a Swiss hotel management school in Mountreaux, and Daniel Mbugua is trained in accounting and has developed excellent skills in graphic design. The two have joined hands with friends locally and abroad to establish a tour & travel company, Zindua Africa Safaris, that will market numerous related services. They have established the business in Tigoni, Limuru with a small liaison office in downtown Nairobi. Their objective is to take advantage and benefits from the booming tourist sector of the economy.

Both Dan & Carolyne, being young people, are full of plans on how to grow their business working with partners all over Africa, the USA, Europe and Asia. They hope to franchise their concept and one day have Zindua Africa Safaris representatives all over the world.

The business is now 2 months old and they are constrained for capital to buy the items that they require. With the loan of $1200 they plan to hire an expert to help them launch their website, develop some advertising materials and buy a computer & printer. As a way of tackling the unemployment crisis prevailing in the country, PEMCI has been considering providing venture capital to support innovative business ideas, especially among the youth. Zindua Africa Safaris plans to recruit many Kenyan youth and others from all over the world in promoting their business idea. We see promise and we recommend support for this endeavour in anticipation of the great impact that it can have on the youth in this country and in the wider economy and its people.

loans.use: To buy communication equipment, set-up website, produce advertising materials and purchase a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ice box

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase flour and oil, preparing and selling cakes

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Mr. Trang is 58 years old and his wife is 2 years younger. They have 2 daughters whose ages are 7 and 9. His first daughter has cerebral palsy. His second daughter is a student at local primary school. They have 0.1 hectare of land for growing vegetablew. The family income is $9 per person/month. Trang hopes to get a loan of $75 so that he can invest in his field in order to save money to support his family. He is confident that he can repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Investing in the vegetable field.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is 40 years old. Her husband, a day laborer, is 45 years old. They have 2 sons and a daughter who stopped going to school to earn money. Nga is a cook at the local committee office daily. Now she wants to grow vegetables on the land next to her home and use by-products from cooking to raise pigs. Her family income is $12 per person/month. Nga hopes to get a loan of $75 to do her plan. She is going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To improve the family income by growing vegetables and raising pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda is married and has a 17 year old daughter and a 10 year old son. Her husband, Juan, works in a factory to help with the costs of their home. 11 years ago, Rosy decided to open her own store selling groceries from her home in Santa Catarina, from where she was raised. Her good work allowed her to remain in business for so long.

Rosy has always enjoyed working in sales and wanted to offer a better quality of life for her children. Today she is asking for a loan of $925 that she would use to purchase merchandise to have more supplies in her store and increase her sales. She is promising to return this loan in 4 to 8 months. Your help would be of great use to Rosalinda and her family, they really appreciate your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalinda es casada y tiene una hija de 17 años de edad y un hijo de 10, Juan, su esposo, trabaja como empleado en una empresa, para ayudarle en los gastos del hogar Rosy decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, desde hace 11 años en la localidad de Santa Catarina, de donde son originarios. Su buen trabajo le ha permitido permanecer en el negocio por tanto tiempo.

A Rosy siempre le han gustado las ventas y desea ofrecerle una mejor calida de vida a sus hijos. En este momento ella solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener un mejor surtido en su tienda e incrementar sus ventas, se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para Rosalinda y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Petra

texts.en:
