Blanca Petra began her own business selling groceries 10 years ago. When her son was born, she saw the need to work to in something that would allow her enough time to take care of him. That is why she opened her store, and fortunately things have gone well for her. This is the only source of income for herself and her son. It hasn't been easy for Blanca to sustain her household, but she hopes to improve her living conditions and works hard to get ahead with her business.

Blanca is very hardworking and responsible. She needs a loan of $925.00. It will be used to buy merchandise, in order to have a good inventory in her store, and to improve the service she offers to her clients. She is committed to paying back the loan amount in 4 to 8 months. Blanca needs your help and is sincerely thankful for any support you are able to give.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca Petra inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace 10 años, al nacer su hijo se vio en la necesidad empezar a trabaja en algo que le permitiera tener el tiempo suficiente para cuidar a su hijo, por lo que abrió su tienda y afortunadamente le ha ido bien, esta es la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su hijo. No ha fácil para Blanca ser el único sosote de su hogar, pero desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida se esfuerza mucho por sacar adelante su negocio.

Blanca es muy trabajadora y responsable, ahora necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Blanca necesita de tu ayuda y agradece sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of a hair dryer and other utensils such as scissors, tweezers, etc. Part of it will also be invested in the maintenance and expansion of the location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of products for stocking the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of school supplies such as textbooks, notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the maintenance and repair of one of his printing presses that is in poor condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts and materials necessary for conducting repairs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F. J. is a single mother who raises her daughter Elizabeth (7) and provides for her by selling traditional Dominican snacks from her store in Teson, Samana. She sells popular items like empanadas, sandwiches, fried plantains, juices and soda. Elizabeth F.’s store is right next to a discoteca one of many typical dancing clubs throughout the Dominican Republic that feature cultural music like Merengue and Bachata. Weekend nights are her peak hours for sales as locals flood the discoteca next door. With this loan she will be able to buy bread, meats, cheese, flour and fruit. Elizabeth has named her store Cafeteria de Amistad but is saving up for the paint and wood for a sign to make it official.

NOTE: Elizabeth is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group. She and her business represent four other microentrepreneurs who are members of the same solidarity group who will all receive a share of this $750 loan to develop their respective businesses. Elizabeth and the other members are accountable to each other to repay this loan together.

loans.use: Purchase fruit, bread, meats, cheese and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the repair of his mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the maintenance and repair of her shop.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria D. is a single mother raising her three children: Evelina Rosario (26), Mabel (23), and Patricia (20). Her best-selling products are women’s shoes, but she also sells clothing, wallets and purses. Through word of mouth and a loyal client base, Patria runs the store out of her home but occasionally sells her merchandise on the street to reach new customers. She is requesting this loan to expand her inventory and give her customers a wider selection so that her sales will increase. Patria and her children live in the town of Sanchez on the western part of Samana.

NOTE: Patria is one of five microentrepreneurs in in Sanchez who have come together to form a solidarity group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, wallets and purses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the reconstruction of her oven and the purchase of firewood to make her oven work.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna M. A. is married to Secundario de Jesús and together they raise their three children, Jose Julian (2), Jose Enaro (5) and Joanni M. (8). She sells women’s clothing, inexpensive jewelry, and beer from her house and along the roads in her town of Sanchez. She has always sold clothing and this loan will help her buy more clothing to add to her inventory. She says her goal is to continue to grow her business for the wellbeing of her family.

NOTE: Joanna is one of five micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $750 loan together. If a member is unable to pay in full and on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase new women's clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and corn.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia C. has raised seven children, who then gave her 20 grandchildren who in turn have given her 17 great-grandchildren. She carries on her experience with children by selling empanadas (baked or fried pastries wrapped around fruit or meat and cheese) outside the local school yard every day. She buys the empanadas pre-made from the city of Nagua, about a 30 minute trip. This is her first time running her own business but she has plenty of experience with her target clientèle.

NOTE: Felicia is one of five micro-entrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their shares of this $750 loan together. If a member is unable to pay in full and on time, the group is responsible for making up the deficit before a payment can be made. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase empanadas for resale

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia L. is the mother of Miguel 20, Francisco (23) pictured at left, and Ereli (25). She also has four grandchildren who she is helping to raise not only as a grandmother but also through her business. She runs a motor taxi service, which employs her two sons who drive fares around their hometown of Sanchez and outlying communities. Emilia is the one who takes care of the finances. This is her first loan with Esperanza and it will allow her to buy another motor taxi so that both her sons could drive at the same time, thereby increasing profits dramatically.

Motor taxis are an essential element to every town in the Dominican Republic and the public transportation system. For the equivalent of less than $1-$2 in most cases, Dominicans can be transported on these motorcycle taxi’s that the locals have deemed “motoconchos” to any address in their city. Motoconchos are particularly beneficial for commuting to and from rural communities where most cars and buses do not go. Emilia says that most of the time her business is pretty good, but it is difficult during the rainy season because people do not want to ride as much in the rain.

NOTE: Emilia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for her taxi service

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia C. has four boys and two girls. After one of her daughters passed away, Altagracia raised her five children that were left behind as well. Her husband passed away some years ago, but she has three great grandchildren that live with her.

She sells seafood such as clams, shrimp and crabs to the large resort hotels in Puerto Plata. She buys the seafood from the fisherman in her village and then each Saturday rides public transportation with the food packaged in her cooler to Puerto Plata, which is about 5 hours away. She is requesting this loan to purchase more seafood so she can focus on saving money for her grandson’s tuition to law school.

NOTE: This $750 loan will fund Altagracia's business plus four others in her community. She and four additional entrepreneurs have formed a solidarity group that received business training from Esperanza and will be responsible for paying back this loan together as they develop their respective businesses. This group-lending methodology fosters accountability among the members because they all must pay in full and on time.

loans.use: Purchase crab, clams and shrimp for resale

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Mrs Hoang is 45 years old. She is supporting two children between the ages of 4 and 23. An, her first son is going to the university. Mrs Hoang must support her mother and her sister who are often sick. Her mother is 77 of age, and her sister suffers from arthritis, so Mrs Hoang must spend about $13 per month for their medical treatment. The family has only 3000 square meters to plant rice and their rice production is only enough for them to eat. Mrs Hoang sells fish at a small market but she doesn’t have capital so she can’t buy large fish quantities. Mrs Hoang hopes she can borrow a loan of $50 with no interest so that she can improve for her fish business. Average income is low at about $7/person/month.

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Miss Phuong is 41 and her husband is 51 years old. They have 4 children between the ages of 16 and 9. Their 2 daughters had to stop going to school because they don’t have money to pay tuition for their children. Their family does not have any land for cultivation. Her husband, Mr. Duong, works as a daily laborer, but only has work for 6 months in the dry season. Miss Phuong sells bread and rice spaghetti at the local market. Average income is at low $8/person/month. She wants to borrow a loan of $50 for her selling and she will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase her business

loans.name: Kiem

texts.en: Mrs. Kiem and her husband are both 42 years old. They have 3 children who are between the ages of 9 and 17. They have to support two children who are going to school. They have about 5500 square meters for growing rice and cassava. Mr. Khuong, her husband works as a daily laborer, but this work is only for 6 months in the dry season. Mrs. Kiem and the first son work on their land. A loan from the project helped their family to buy fertilizer for rice and cassava, and their income increased by $1.5/person/month, which averages out to $12/person/month. They are requesting a loan of $100 to improve their rice field and cassava land. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for rice and cassava

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Mrs. Thoa is 49 years old, and her husband has left her for another woman. She is supporting two children by herself. Mrs. Thoa's second child, Cuong, is going to the university. Mrs. Thoa doesn’t have any land, so selling folded rice pancakes is important for her family as additional income. She earns a profit from this of about $1.5/person/month, which makes their average income $12/person/month. Now Mrs. Thoa is asking to borrow a loan of $75 for her rice pancake business.

loans.use: Increase her rice pancake business

loans.name: Linh

texts.en: Mrs. Linh is 48 years old. Her husband died a long time ago. She has 4 children between the ages of 14 and 27. Her first son works at the commune, but he only earns enough money for his own living. The second son works as a farmer for their family. Mrs. Linh is supporting two children who are going to school. The family has 8000 square meters to plant cashew nut trees and cassavas. However, she does not have enough capital to buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees and cassavas. Mrs. Linh sells folded rice pancakes at the small local market. This earns about $1/person/month, and their average income is $14.5/person/month. Now, Mrs. Linh is asking to borrow a loan of $75 for her folded rice pancake business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees and cassavas, and increase her folded rice pancake business.

loans.name: Ngot

texts.en: Mrs. Ngot and her husband are of the same of age, 42. They have 4 children between the ages of 8 and 22. Mr. Toan, her husband had cancer, so the family sold all their land to pay $3125 for his medical treatment. Now, Mr. Toan has to have a follow up examination at the hospital every two months. The family expenses are about $50 for this. Mrs. Ngot‘s eldest child works as a daily laborer, and her second helps Mrs. Ngot to sell meat at the local market. Her third and four children are going to school in grades 9 and 3. Roast pork selling is important to increase her income by about $0.75/person/month. Their average income is low at about $8/person/month. Mrs. Ngot repaid a loan of $32 in time. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $50 again for her selling business.

loans.use: Increase her business of selling roast pork.

loans.name: No

texts.en: Miss K. No is 27, and her husband is 37 years old. They have two children between the ages of 11 and 5 who are going to school. They have only a hut, and they don’t have any land for cultivation. Miss K. No suffers from stomach ache, sinusitis, kidney stones, and a femaL. disease. In addition, she suffers from nebula, so she only does housework. Mr. Giang, her husband, is a sculptor. Before, they had to borrow a loan with 6% interest/month from money lenders. Their income increased by about $2/person/month from a loan from the project. Average income is now about $8.5/person/month. Now, he wants to borrow a loan of $75 so that he can buy a larger amount of wood by cash, which is cheaper.

loans.use: Buy a larger amount of wood

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Miss Anh is 35, and her husband 42 years old. They have two children ages 17 and 12. Her daughter (the eldest) stopped going to school, and her son is going to school in grade 6. They don’t have any land for cultivation. In addition, Mr. Ngoc, her husband, is weak, so making brooms and then selling them to the grocery stores in the community is important to increase their income by about $2/person/month. Their income is now $9 per person/month. They need a loan of $50 so that they can buy a larger amount of broom-making materials with cash, which is cheaper.

loans.use: Buy a larger amount of material for broom making.

loans.name: Tati

texts.en: Tati  is 43 years old, and is married with one daughter. To supplement her husband’s income, Tati sells various snacks in her small store at the front of her house. She also sells clothes on credit by going around her village. In a day Tati can earn $5 and eventually she can earn about $100 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more goods to sell and thus approximately double her income so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Rusmini

texts.en: Rusmini  is 45 years old and married with four sons.  Rusmini supplements her husband’s income by going around her village on foot, selling sheets and bed covers on credit. In a week, total payments collected from her customers comes to about $20, of which approximately $7 is profit. Thus, this yields about $28 profit per month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more sheets and bed covers to sell and thus approximately double her income. Rusmini very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than the one she had as a child.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Hasnawati

texts.en: Hasnawati  is 38 years old and married with two children. To supplement her husband’s income, Hasnawati  runs a PlayStation rental in her house. In a day Hasnawati can earn about $4, yielding roughly $80 a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more PlayStation DVDs. With this loan, she hopes to double her income and have a better life for herself and her family. She is willing to repay the loan within a one year period.

loans.use: To buy PlayStation DVDs

loans.name: Aswiyah

texts.en: Aswiyah  is 34 years old, and is married with 6 children. 5 of them are girls while the other is a boy. To supplement her husband's income, Aswiyah sells meatball soup in front of her house.  In a day they can earn $10 with net profit of $3 or $60 in a month. Aswiyah needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more materials to make more food and thus more or less double her income. Aswiyah very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 1 year.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Erum

texts.en: Erum  is 40 years old, and is married with one boy. To supplement her husband’s income, Erum sells various snacks in front of her house at her small store. In a day Erum can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $38 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ecih

texts.en: Ecih  is 39 years old, and is married with four children. They are all boys. To supplement her husband’s income, Ecih  sells porridge from mung beans in front of her house at her small store. In a day Ecih can earn  about  $3 and eventually she can earn around $60 in a month. She needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more materials and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can give her children a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Desy

texts.en: Desy  is 18 years old, and is married with one boy. To supplement her husband’s income, Desy sells various snacks and runs a playstation rental in front of her house at her small store. In a day Desy can earn  of $4 and eventually she can earn around $80 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods and dvds

loans.name: Tiarawati

texts.en: Tiarawati  is 29 years old, and is married with one boy. To supplement her husband’s income, Tiarawati sells various snacks and instant noodles in front of her house at her small store. In a day Tiarawati can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $38 in a month. She needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en: Yayah  is 34 years old, and is married with four children. 2 of them are boys while the others are girls. To supplement her husband’s income, Yayah sells various decorated flower plants in front of her house. In a week Yayah can earn  of $5 and eventually she can earn around $20 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more plants and with this loan, she can increase her working capital and thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education and to give  them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more plants

loans.name: Uum

texts.en: Uum is 30 years old, and is married with six children, three of them are girls while the others are boys. Uum and her husband, Mamun buy waste material like plastic cups, plastic bottles, cardboard and paper from her neighbors and other houses in the village. Her husband uses a cart to collect scrap metal and other waste material. Households do not just give away waste material, because there is demand and therefore economic value in recycling. So the more working capital they have, the more scrap they can collect and recycle. Uum and her husband are the first link in this chain, buying waste and scrap materials from households, sorting and cleaning them, before selling them to an intermediate dealer. This dealer comes around in a small truck, collects the sorted-out material and takes it to the warehouses dealer. There, the different materials are weighed in front of Uum’s husband, who then gets paid by the intermediate dealer. The warehouse dealer in turn sends the waste materials to various processing factories, which turn produce clean and reusable recycled paper, cardboard and plastic recycled raw materials. Waste recycling undertaken by Uum and her husband thus helps clean the environment by reusing waste material which otherwise would go to the landfills. In a week Uum can earn $6. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell , and thus more or less double her income. Uum very much wants to earn more money for her children’s education and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti is 45 years old, and is married with three children. Two of them are boys while the other is a girl. To supplement her family's income, Siti makes riced crackers and then sells it by going around her village on foot. In a week Siti can earn  of $10 and eventually she can earn around $40 in a month. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more materials and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Enah

texts.en: Enah  is 45 years old, and is married with one boy.  Enah and her husband  Alam sell basic household goods such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc  in front of her house at her small store. In a day Enah can earn  of $3 and eventually she can earn around $75 in a month. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income, therefore she can have a better life.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Aam

texts.en: Aam  is 30 years old, and is married with four children. Three of them are girls while the other is a boy. To supplement her family's income, Aam  and her husband  Rojak, raise chickens as their main business. In a day Aam  can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $50 in a month. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more baby chickens and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more baby chickens

loans.name: Murni

texts.en: Murni  is 49 years old, and is married with four children. Three of them are boys while the other is a girl. To supplement her husband’s income, Murni sells various snacks and spices in front of her house at her small store. In a day Murni  can earn  of $3 and eventually she can earn around $63 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Sanimah

texts.en: Sanimah  is 48 years old, and is married with four children. Three of them are boys while the other is a girl. To supplement her husband' s income, Sanimah raise goats as the main business. In a day Sanimah  can earn  of $2 and eventually she can earn around $50 in a month. She needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more baby goats and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more baby goats

loans.name: Maryani

texts.en: Maryani  is 40 years old, and is married with three children. Two of them are boys while the other is a girl.  To supplement her husband’s income, Maryani sells clothes on credit by going around her village on foot. In a week when she collects payment from her customers, she can earn around $10 as an income and eventually she earns around $3 as a profit or around $12 in a month. She needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more clothes to sell and thus more or less double her income. Maryani very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Rosmiati

texts.en: Rosmiati is 28 years old and married with two children. To supplement her husband’s income, Rosmiati sells various snacks from her small store in front of her house. Rosmiati can earn about $1 a day, reaching around $25 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more goods to sell at her store. Thus, she hopes to approximately double her income and create a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Saroh

texts.en: Saroh  is 32 years old and married with two children. Saroh and her husband Embang grow rice on a farm. They harvest their crop once every 4 months, earning about $120. Saroh needs a loan of $50 to buy more seeds and fertilizer to raise her family's income. She really wants to have more income to pay for her children's education and to give them a better life than the one she had growing up.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruinah

texts.en: Ruinah  is 48 years old and married with two children. To supplement her husband's income, Ruinah  runs a sewing business in her house. In a day, Ruinah can earn about $3, coming to about $45 a month. She needs a loan of $50 to buy more fabric and thread, so she can boost her tailoring business and her income. She particularly would like to raise her income so she can pay for her children's education and to give them a better life than  the one she had while growing up.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This borrower is 35 years old and lives in the very poor area in Kirkuk. He is responsible for a big family. He lives with his mother and his sister and his wife and one child. He has a small minimarket in the south of Kirkuk, which he got from his father. This is his first loan from Al-Aman. He wants to purchase an ice box to sell ice cream. He wants to earn money to allow his sister to continue to study and get her high school diploma.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase ice box

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This borrower is 25 years old and has a computer shop in the south of Kirkuk. He married one year ago and is expecting his first child next month. He wants to get the his first loan from AL-Aman to purchase two computers and a digital camera to make videos for family events. This borrower is young and active and is looking for a good future and to develop himself. He wants to earn money to enhance his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase two computers and digital camera

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This borrower is 31 years old and lives with his family in Kirkuk. He has a small shop inside Kirkuk market to sell and repair watches. He is young and active and works hard to earn money to develop himself and improve his family life. This borrower is applying for his first loan from AL-Aman to paint his shop and purchase more goods.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and purchase more goods

loans.name: Nha

texts.en:
Mrs. Nha is 45 years old. Her husband died and Mrs. Nha must now support 6 children between the ages of 24 and 11 by herself. Five of her children are going to school. Her son, Vinh, has had to stop going to school and he now works as a daily laborer to help the family.

Mrs. Nha doesn’t have any land. She sells duck eggs in the village but she doesn’t have enough capital, so she had to borrow a loan with 12% interest/month from money lenders. Average income is about $10/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $50 for selling duck eggs.

loans.use: Increase her stock of duck eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase food and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of toolkits

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis  is 35 years old and married with three children: 2 daughters and a son. Lilis and her husband Dadang work together to run their kerosene-selling business in their house. From this business, they can earn $2 in a day, coming to about $50 a month. Lilis needs a loan of $100 to buy more kerosene and hopefully boost her business and income. Lilis very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than the one she had growing up.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married and she has a11-year-old son and a 17-year-old daughter. Four years ago, her husband was dismissed due to personnel cuts, he found another job but he was earning a lower salary and it wasn’t enough to clear all the family expenses. Due to this situation, Maria was forced to start her own business of selling jewelry. She has done well, now her husband and her older daughter help her and thanks to the quality of the products, she has gained a lot of clients.

Maria is requesting for a loan of $250 to buy more merchandise, like this she will to be able to cover the demand and to continue to grow like she has done up until now. She commits to repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. You ca help to improve the well-bieng of this family, don’t hesitate and help them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de los Ángeles es casada y tiene un hijo de 11 años y una hija de 17. Hace cuatro años su esposo fue despedido por recorte de personal, después encontró otro empleo pero en este recibía un menor salario y era insuficiente para la solventar los gastos de su hogar, ante esta situación Maria se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio con la venta de joyería, en el que le ha ido bien, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y su hija mayor y gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha estado ganando muchos clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora lo ha hecho, Maria solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que atizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.en:
Maria Concepción is a hard-working woman who makes an effort day after day to provide the best for her three children. She is married and her husband works for a slaughterhouse, but his salary is quite low, so she decided to start her own business of selling meat 12 years ago. She started selling among her neighbors and since she has gained a lot of clients. She has worked hard to make her business grow and now she has the opportunity to supply big orders for banquets.

Mary is requesting for a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to be able to cover her clients’ demand and to offer a good service. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. With your help Mary can continue to make her business grow. Mary and her family are sincerely grateful of your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza día a día para darle lo mejor a sus tres hijos, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja para una empresa donde matan los animales para comercializar su carne, pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, por lo que ella se decidió a emprender su negocio con la venta de carne desde hace 12 años, se ha dado a conocer entre sus vecinas y ha estado ganando muchos clientes, ella se ha esforzado mucho por hacer crecer su negocio y ahora tiene la oportunidad de surtir grandes pedidos que le solicitan en banquetes.

En estos momentos Mary solicita un crédito por $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella ofrece retornar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mary puede continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is married and has three children, who are 18, 15 and 10 years old. They all go to school, and as they continue to go through school, the expenses are increasing. Since her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover all the family needs, Lourdes was forced to start her own business of selling used electronics five years ago. Fortunately, she has done well and she has more clients.

In order to provide a bigger variety of products, Lourdes is requesting a loan of $250, that she will use to buy merchandise that her clients have already ordered. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can be an important part in the life of this family, help them!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de Lourdes es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 10, 15 y 18 años de edad, sus tres hijos están estudiando y al incrementar su nivel escolar también los gastos se incrementan, pero el salario de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta necesidad Lourdes, desde hace cinco años, inició su propio negocio con la venta aparatos electrónicos usados, afortunadamente le ha ido bien y se han incrementado sus clientes.

Para poder ofrecer más variedad de productos, Lourdes requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía que sus clientes ya le han solicitado, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en un lapso e 3 a 6 meses. Tu puedes ser arte importante en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Carmen Janeth

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a driver in a transportation company, but his salary is not enough to cover all the family expenses; due to this situation Carmen started her business of selling footwear two years ago. Thanks to her taste for sales and character, it is easy for her to relate to others and like this increase the number of clients. >

Carmen wishes her business grow; now she is requesting for a loan of $250, that she will use to purchase merchandise. She promises to repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. Be an important part of Carmen’s dreams and help her family to improve their conditions of life. They are very grateful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer en un empresa de transporte, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ante esta situación Carmen emprendió su negocio con la venta de calzado desde hace dos años, en la que gracias a su gusto por las ventas y carácter, se le facilita relacionarse con los demás y de esta manera incrementar sus clientes. Carmen desea que su negocio pueda creer, en estos momentos solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en los sueños de Carmen y ayuda a su familia a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.en:
Maria Estela is married with four children, two of whom are married, and the other two live with her. Ten years ago, Estela began her business in cheese sales, because at the time, her children were in school and her husband's salary was not enough to cover expenses. Little by little, she has grown her business and now she is a direct client of a cheese distributor because of her great sales.

Honesty, responsiblity and hard work are some of Estela's personal qualities. Now she needs a $475 loan which she will use to buy merchanside to meet the demand of her clients and continue growing her business. She is committed to repaying her loan in 6-12 months. Estela needs your collaboration, and she thanks you for whatever support you can offer. Choose to participate.

Translated by Bianca V., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Estela es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos están casados y los otros dos viven con ella, hace diez años Estela inició su propio negocio con la venta de quesos, ya que es aquel tiempo sus hijos se encontraban estudiando y el salario de su esposo resultaba insuficiente para todos los gastos. Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora ya es cliente directa de la distribuidora de quesos, por lo que obtiene una mejor ganancia.

Honestidad, responsabilidad y mucho trabajo son algunas de las características de Estela, ahora requiere un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora con su negocio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Estela necesita de tu colaboración, y agradece cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarle, decídete a .ayudarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cesar Heriberto

texts.en:
Cesar is married and has two young children of 2 and 4 years old. He lost his job five years ago and due to the lack of employment in the country, it was very hard to find work. In need to support his family, he decided to start his own business of selling fruit and vegetables at the market. Soon after he started selling fruit cocktails and they were quite successful with his clients, now he sells seasonal fruits, fortunately he has done well with the sale of his products.

Now, Carlos needs a loan of $1200.00 that he will use to buy wholesale seasonal fruit, which will allow him to have a good selection and to obtain better profits. He promises to repay over a period of 6 to 12 months. Cesar wants his business to grow in order to provide a better quality of life for his family. You can help to his dream come true. Support him!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, hace cinco años quedó desempleado y ante la falta de empleo del país le fue muy difícil encontrar un trabajo, así que ante la necesidad de obtener el sustento para su familia, decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de fruta y verduras en el mercado, poco después también ofreció también cóctel de frutas y contó con la aceptación y gusto sus cliente, ahora se dedica a la neta de frutas de temporada y afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien con las ventas de sus productos.

En estos momentos, César necesita de un préstamo por $1,200 dólares que destinará a la compra de fruta de temporada por mayoreo, esto le permitirá tener mejor surtido su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. César desea hacer crecer su negocio para ofrecerle a su familia una mejora calidad de vida, tú puedes contribuir a la realización de este sueño, decídete y apóyalo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married and has three young children, ages 5, 7 and 10. Forty years ago, Francisco's father founded a business selling fruits and vegetables which as a boy Francisco lent a hand in running so that his brothers and sisters could continue their studies. Later, when his father fell ill, Francisco headed up the business and saw it grow. He has recently acquired a van and now delivers his produce to outer neighborhoods where there is good demand. At this time, Francisco is asking for a loan of $375 to grow his business. He will use it to buy the produce his customers demand. He promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. Francisco could use your help and appreciates your support and confidence.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos, de 5, 7 y 10 años de edad, su padre inició el negocio de venta de fruta y verdura desde hace 40 años, y desde muy pequeño le ayuda en el negocio para poder que sus hermanos continuaran estudiando, después su padre enfermó y no pudo continuar trabajando, es así como Francisco quedó el frente del negocio y afortunadamente lo ha hecho crecer, recientemente ha adquirido una camioneta para llevar sus productos hasta las colonias más retiradas y ha tenido gran demanda de estos clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, Francisco solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad para Francisco, él te agradece sinceramente tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia lives in Santa Catarina in the state of Nuevo León. She is married and has three small children. In the need to support and to improve the economic situation of her family, she started her own business of selling novelties and gifts. At the beginning she had very little merchandise, but little by little the business is growing and sales are increasing.

Alicia is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy seasonal merchandise, that will help her make her business grow and to stay in the preference of her clients by offering a better variety of products. She promises to repay over a period of 6 to 12 months. Alicia only wishes the best for her family and she is ready to work very hard to achieve it, now she needs from your help and she is very grateful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alicia vive en la localidad de Santa Catarina en el estado de Nuevo León, es casada y tiene tres pequeños hijos, ella se inició su propio negocio con la venta de novedades y regalos ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo y mejorar las condiciones económicas en las que se encontraban, empezó este negocio con muy poca mercancía pero poco a poco ha estado creciendo y mejorando sus ventas.

Para la compra de mercancía de temporada, Alicia requiere de un crédito por $ 1,200, esto le será de gran utilidad para hacer creer su negocio y permanecer en la preferencia de sus clientes al ofrecer una mejor variedad, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Alicia sólo desea lo mejor para su familia y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo, ahora necesita de tu ayuda y agradece mucho tu generosidad. .

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.en:
Maria Virginia has been in the business of baking and pastrymaking for 12 years, she learned the profession from her mother. She had always wanted to have her own business in order to help with the family’s expenses. She began with this work that he knows perfectly, thanks to the quality of her products, the sales have increased and now she also supplies several businesses that are in the area of her home. Virginia is married and has two daughters who at present are studying and during their free time help her.

Virginia wants to make her business grow and to offer her products in a bigger number of establishments, for this reason she is requesting for a loan of $1,200, that she will use to buy the supplies needed in the elaboration of her products. She promises repay it over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can be a part in the development and success of her business, and therefore improve the quality of life of this family. Don’t hesitate and support her!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Maria Virginia se dedica a la venta de repostería y panadería, oficio que aprendió de su madre y como siempre había querido tener su propio negocio para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, lo empezó con esta labor que conoce perfectamente, gracias a la calidad de sus productos, las ventas se han incrementado y ahora surte también varios negocios que están cerca de su domicilio. Virginia es casada y tiene dos hijas que actualmente están estudiando y en sus ratos libres le ayudan en el negocio.

Virginia desea hacer creer su negocio y ofrecer sus productos en un mayor número de establecimientos, por lo que ahora solicita un crédito por $ 1,200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que requiere en la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a retornar esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte en el desarrollo y éxito de este negocio, y mejorar así la calidad de vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Armandina

texts.en:
Mrs. Armandina is married and has two children who go to school. Her husband is a blue-collar worker and his salary is quite low and it’s not enough to cover all of the needs of the family; due to this situation, Armandina decided to start her own business of selling snacks seven years ago. She refitted her own home, and little by little the number of clients has increased.

In order to keep growing up until now, Armandina needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to be able to offer a bigger variety of products to her clients, she plans to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. Your help means a lot to this family, they are grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Armandina es casada y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja como obrero pero recibe un salario muy bajo y no alcanza a cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante esta situación Armandina decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de snack hace siete años, inició en un lugar que acondicionó en su propio hogar, poco a poco se han incrementado su número de clientes.

Ahora para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, Armandina requiere de un préstamo por $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mejora variedad a sus clientes, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú ayuda será de gran utilidad para esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucero Celeste

texts.en:
Lucero is married and has one young child. She lives in Santa Catarina in the State of Nuevo León. Her husband is a blue-collar worker and his salary is quite low. In order to help her husband and to improve the living conditions of her family, Lucero started her own business of footwear catalogue sales two years ago. Fortunately, she has done well, she started selling among the family and friends and now she has more clients and she has the opportunity to supply bigger orders.

Now, Lucero needs a loan of $250, that she will use to buy merchandise to supply the orders she already has, to offer a better service and to keep growing. You can be part of this business and improve the well-being of this family. Don’t hesitate and help her, Lucero and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucero es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, viene en la localidad de Santa Catarina en el estado de Nuevo León, su esposo trabaja como obrero y su salario es muy bajo, para poder ayudar a su esposo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia Lucero inició su propio negocio, desde hace dos años, con la venta de calzado por catálogo, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien, empezó vendiendo entre sus familiares y amigos, ahora ya cuenta con mas clientes y tiene la oportunidad de surtir grandes pedidos.

En estos momentos, Lucero necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, para ofrecer un mejor servicio y continuar creciendo. Tú puedes ser parte de este negocio y mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más y ayúdala, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Rosa Lilia

texts.en:
Rosa started her business of selling footwear two years ago. She is married and has two young children who go to elementary school. She started her business in the need for an extra income because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the family’s expenses and their children’s education. The love to her children and the faithful commitment to her husband are the reasons that push her to work harder.

Now, she needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to supply a big order that she already has, and to continue in the preference of her clients. She promises to repay it over a period of 3 to 6 months. Now is a good time help someone in need, help her!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace dos años Rosa inició su negocio con la venta de calzado, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos que asisten a la escuela primaria, empezó su negocio ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra porque el sueldo que su esposo obtiene como empleado en una empresa es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo son los motivos más grandes que la impulsan a trabajar arduamente.

Ahora ella necesita de un préstamo por $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir un pedido grande que tiene, y continuar con la preferencia de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. His carpenter's workshop is located on the grounds of his home. He has worked in this profession for more than 30 years now, which allowed him to pay for his daily needs and for the education of his children, who are now married and live on their own.

Albino manufactured and sells custom made furniture. Albino also repairs furniture in people's homes, an activity for which he has a group of customers that continuously recommends his services to other potential clients.

The credit that he obtained from the Fundación Paraguaya, he used to buy raw materials, first quality Cedar and Patagonian Rosewood which he uses to manufacture colonial furniture for some foreign customers that are very demanding.

He plans to participate in a bid to manufacture chairs for schools, and if he wins even part of this bid, he will need again more working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Albino tiene 52 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Su taller de carpintería lo tiene en el predio de su domicilio. Está dedicado al oficio hace más de 30 años al cual debe la educación de sus hijos, ahora ya casados y viviendo de forma independiente, y su sustento diario. Albino fabrica y vende muebles a pedido. Albino también realiza trabajos de reparación de muebles a domicilio, actividad para la cual posee una clientela que constantemente recomienda su trabajo a otros potenciales clientes.

El crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo utilizó para la compra de materia prima, maderas de primera calidad de la línea de Cedro y Curupay con lo que fabricó muebles coloniales, a unos clientes de origen extranjero muy exigentes.

Tiene proyectado presentarse a licitaciones para la fabricación de sillas para escuelas, y de adjudicarse alguna, nuevamente estaría con la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy a load of dressed wood

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.en:
Mario is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children. Mario is an electronic technician and owns a workshop to repair radios, televisions, and all types of electronic goods. In addition to his workshop, Mario owns a snack bar at his home, which he runs with the help of his wife who works there during the day.

Between both businesses, they can pay for their needs. They plan to expand the snack bar to offer other things like fast food, take-out and delivery service. Because the snack bar currently generates most of the family income, they invest most money in this part. The repair of radios and television has gone down lately.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Mario es técnico en electrónica y actualmente cuenta con un taller de reparación de radios, televisores y todo tipo de artefactos electrónicos. Además de su taller Mario tiene un copetín en su domicilio el cual maneja con la cooperación de su esposa quien se encarga de la atención en el día a día.

Con ambas actividades ellos pueden cubrir todas sus necesidades, inclusive tienen proyectado ir ampliando el copetín incorporando otros servicios como el de comida rápida, sobre pedido, como así también la de entrega a domicilio. Dado que el copetín en estos momentos es la actividad que genera mayores ingresos a la familia la mayor inversión se hace en ese sector, ya que el tema de reparación de radios y televisores decayó en estos últimos tiempos.

loans.use: To expand his bar

loans.name: María Sixta

texts.en:
María Sixta is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has been a dressmaker for more than 25 years. Her workshop is at her home, and she has fixed customers that constantly come to her with requests for clothing that is in fashion. Therefore, she has to stay up to date on the latest trends, because this allows her to understand what her customers' new requests are about.

María also makes company uniforms and some special orders like clothing for parties and special occasions. María is passing this knowledge and the arts to transform cloth into clothing on to her daughters and nieces, who once in a while help her out depending on her workload.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Sixta tiene 50 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Es modista desde hace más de 25 años, su taller lo tiene en su domicilio, y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes constantemente acuden a ella para solicitarle algún tipo de ropa que este a la moda. Según relata la señora este oficio, también requiere estar actualizada sobre las nuevas tendencias, esto le permite interpretar los nuevos gustos de su clientela.

María confecciona ropas para uniformes empresariales y algunos pedidos especiales como ropa para fiestas, y otras ocasiones. Esta sabiduría y el arte de transformar las telas la señora María están también pasando a sus hijas y sobrinas, quienes en algunas ocasiones la suelen ayudar según la cantidad de trabajo que posea.

loans.use: To buy 1 roll of cloth and 3 boxes of thread

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. She and her husband make and sell "Chipa" from their shop (a type of bread, typical from Paraguay). The location of the store is very good, en many people pass by in front of the store.

She learned her profession from her parents, and now she has been running her own business for more than 10 years. Together with her husband, they divide the tasks: Mrs. Andresa is the specialist in making the Chipas, and her husband sells them.

The store offers a very special view: when someone buys a Chipa, they can observe how it is made, because the store is spacey and, more importantly, clean.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Andresa tiene 34 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Ella y su marido elaboran y venden desde su local las chipas (una especie de pan, típico del país) que producen, ya que la ubicación de la misma es muy favorable ya que hay una muy buena circulación de gente frente a su local.

Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y hoy ella maneja su propio negocio al cual se dedica hace más de 10 años. Conjuntamente con su marido se dividen las actividades, la especialista en elaborar las chipas es la señora Andresa y su marido se encarga de las ventas.

El local tiene una vista muy particular, uno cuando compra la chipa puede estar observando el momento de la elaboración, ya que el local es amplio y aun más importante, es muy higiénico.

loans.use: To buy starch, cheese, butter, milk, and corn flour to make "Chipa" corn bread.

loans.name: Pablino

texts.en:
Pablino is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. In his youth, he learned his profession working in a car repair shop of his relatives. Nowadays, he owns his own garage, with all necessary tools. In addition he owns a business selling drinks, which he runs with his wife.

Pablino is from a modest family, and with a lot of effort he was able to make is dream of business ownership come true.

At this moment he owns all tools and equipment needed to perform any type of car repair. Pablino has practiced this profession for more than 20 years now, and counts with a large number of customers. One of the characteristics that differentiates his garage from others is that he can provide mobile car repairs.

He plans to enlarge his roof, because his workshop largely is lacking one.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Pablino tiene 33 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Durante su juventud se capacitó en el taller mecánico de unos parientes donde aprendió el oficio. Hoy día ya cuenta con su propio taller, con todas las herramientas necesarias, además posee un negocio de venta de bebidas, el cual maneja su esposa. Pablino es de un origen muy humilde que con gran esfuerzo su llego a poder concretar su sueño de tener su propio negocio.

Actualmente posee todas las herramientas y equipos necesarios para efectuar cualquier tipo de reparación mecánica. Pablino está dedicado al oficio hace más de 20 años y cuenta con un gran número de clientes. Una característica diferente que posee su taller con respecto a los otros, es que el realiza servicio de auxilio mecánico in situ.

Planea ampliar su galpón, ya que el espacio que tiene no cuenta en gran parte con techo.

loans.use: To buy lubricants and paint for cars

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. His specialty is the repair of the electric parts of all types of vehicles. He has owned his own repair shop for more than 15 years. Francisco has a lot of experience in this, which he obtained in practice by working in car repair workshops. In reality, he teaches, and several technical highschool students have done internships in his garage.

Francisco believes that, like other technical professions, he too needs to keep his knowledge up to date because every day new technology is developed for cars, and he has to be prepared to satisfy inquiries and needs of the customers.

He wants to add to his business the sale of car batteries, and for this he needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Su especialidad es la reparación de la parte eléctrica de todo tipo de vehículos. El posee su propio taller hace ya más de 15 años. Francisco tiene mucha experiencia en este oficio y gran parte de la misma la adquirio en forma práctica en los talleres donde fue empleado. Actualmente es un capacitador, ya que varios alumnos bachilleres técnicos han hecho pasantías en su taller.

Francisco, también cree que como otros oficios técnicos, también el de él requiere estar actualizado ya que día a día surgen novedades en cuanto al funcionamiento de los automóviles y uno tiene que estar preparado para satisfacer las consultas y necesidades de los clientes.

Tiene previsto incorporar en su negocio, la venta de baterías para automóviles y para esto necesitaría un crédito.

loans.use: To purchase car batteries to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomás is 45 years, married, and father of 2 children. He is a craftsman who works and sculpts leather. His business is located close to the Cathedral of Caacupé and his specialty is to cover bull horn cups and thermos bottles with sculpted leather. He has been doing this for more than 25 years now, and he learned the art from his parents: before he had his own workshop, he worked with his father and learned to prepare and sculpt leather.

He exhibits his products in numerous arts and crafts expositions, where his work is much appreciated, especially the thermos bottle covers and leather handbags.

One of his future projects is to buy another industrial machine. With this he will expand his toolset and machines that he owns. He sometimes loans the machine to his colleagues, which creates timing conflicts that makes it impossible for him to produce in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Tomás tiene 45 años está casado, tiene 2 hijos. Su oficio es el arte de trabajar y tallar cuero. Su negocio está ubicado cerca de la Basílica de Caacupé y su especialidad es la de forrar las guampas y termos con cuero tallado. Está dedicado a la actividad hace más de 25 años y el conocimiento lo heredó de sus padres ya que antes de tener su propio taller y negocio trabajó con su papá, donde aprendió a confeccionar y tallar el cuero.

Exhibió sus productos en numerosas exposiciones artesanales, donde fue muy apreciado su trabajo, en especial por los forrados de termos, como así también las carteras de cuero.

Dentro de sus proyectos actuales, está la compra (en el futuro) de una máquina industrial. Con esto ampliaría la variedad de herramientas y maquinarias que posee, ya que en algunos casos esa máquina la presta de sus colegas, lo cual crea contratiempos imposibilita la producción de mayores cantidades.

loans.use: To buy leather

loans.name: Edilia

texts.en:
Edilia is 32 years old, she is married and has 1 child. Her business is 4 years old and she sells all kind of clothing, from men's socks to lady's cowboy boots.

She invested a previous loan in the purchase of winter clothing, which enabled her to realize several orders of fixed customers. With the income of her business, she can pay for the family expenses as well as for her studies: she is studying Administration.

In the beginning, it was hard for her to start her business as she didn't have the capital necessary. She could make her first investments thanks to her first loan. Her business is growing, and she is thinking about opening another subsidiary. In this enterprise, Edilia is helped by her sister, also a student, who is doing a market study and who will be responsible to run the new store. In order to succeed with this, Edilia want to re-activate her credit line with Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Edilia tiene 32 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 4 años donde vende todo tipo de ropa desde medias para caballeros hasta camperas para damas. La inversión del préstamo, lo destinó a la compra de ropas de invierno, lo cual posibilito la realización de varios pedidos de clientes habituales. Los ingresos que le genera este negocio, permite cubrir los gastos propios de su familia además de los gastos de su estudio, ya que está cursando la carrera de Administración

Al inicio fue muy duro y difícil para ella poder iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con el capital necesario, y las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias al préstamo al cual accedió. Su negocio está creciendo y ya tiene pensado más adelante abrir otra sucursal. En este emprendimiento Edilia cuenta con el apoyo y acompañamiento de su hermana, también estudiante, quien está llevando adelante los estudios de mercado y quien sería la responsable de atender el nuevo negocio. Para concretar este proyecto tiene pensado activar nuevamente su línea de crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy ladies' lingerie and men's clothing

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
The quilt group of Miss Thu was set up in January 2006 with the support of Vietnam-Quilts (www.vietnam-quilts.org). She is the leader group. The group has 21 members who were jobless before and they don’t have any land for cultivation. They gather to make the quilts by hand at Miss Thu’s house. Average income is $40 per member/month from the quilt-making business, which has helped to improve their living situation.

However, Miss Thu ‘s house is very small with not enough place for women to make the quilts have high quality so Miss Thu wants to borrow a loan of $700 so that she can expand her house and improve the working conditions. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Expand her quilt workshop

loans.name: Ca

texts.en: The quilt group was set up in June, 2006, and Miss Ca is the leader of the group. The group has 21 members who used to be jobless, and who don’t have any land for cultivation. They gather to make the quilts by hand at Miss Ca’s house. They then sell them to Vietnam-Quilts (www.vietnam-quilts.org). Average income is $40 per member/month from the quilt making business, which has helped to improve their living situation. However, Miss Ca ‘s house is very small, with not enough place for the women to make quilts of a high quality, so Miss Ca wants to borrow a loan of $400 so that she can extend the production space. She will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Develop the quilt-making workshop.

loans.name: Giao

texts.en: Giao is 37 years old. Her husband, a farmer, is 1 year older. She must support a daughter and a son whose ages are 9 and 14. In addition, she supports her elderly mother. Her son is attending third grade, and her daughter stopped going to school to help the family. Recently, because of spreading insects, their income from the rice field is low. Giao has decided to improve the family income by running a grocery store from their home. She has been running the store for 1 year. Now their income is $8 per person/month. She hopes to get a loan of $75 to supply her grocery store. Giao will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Supplying the grocery store.

loans.name: Najeeb Allah

texts.en: Najeeb Allah lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has 15 years experience making artificial flowers in his own shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials and enlarge his shop to find more clients. He wants to do a good business and make a good income to support his family and send his children to better educational centers to study so that they will have a good future. He is happy that this loan will help him to do that.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for his shop

loans.name: Habidam

texts.en: Habidam lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and he is the one responsible for supporting his family. He took his 4th cycle group loan and opened a vegetable cart and is making a good income and doing a good business. Now he wants to take anther loan to change his cart into a shop and buy extra vegetables to sell  so that he can attract more clients. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To buy extra vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai is 52. Her husband, a wounded soldier who cannot work as a laborer, is 56 years old. They have a son and a daughter aged 18 and 25, who left school to help with the family farming. They have 0.6 hectares of land for growing rice but their income from rice crops isn’t enough for them to support themselves due to poor soil and spreading insects. Mrs. Hai focuses on running a grocery store to improve the family income. Their income is $10 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to operate her grocery store. Mrs. Hai will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To operate the grocery store.

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
F. Begum of 36 years of age, (ID-11, G), wife of Mr. Azim Uddin, has been a member of Lily Mohila Somity for the last 10 years. She has 2 children – one boy, 15 and one girl, 10 years of age. Both the of them are in school.

Her husband is the only earning member in the family. His income is not sufficient to meet the expenses of both family and education. Therefore, she wanted to contribute financially to the family and purchase a milking cow to rear at home. She has been doing this for the last 8 years, by receiving training on Livestock and Animal Husbandry so she is able to provide primary treatment to her cow, if needed.

She gets 3 liters of milk in the morning and 2 liters at noon-time. She sells the whole morning production @ Tk. 35 = US$ 0.51 per liter. She also sells half of the noon-time milk and consumes the other part of the milk. She does not have to invest much for feeding the cow because the natural grass helps her. This activity brings additional income to her family and protein to her family members. She is interested in purchasing another cow of high breed to rear. Her estimated cost for a new cow is US$ 800/-.

loans.use: Purchase of a high breed cow

loans.name: Rumsi

texts.en: Rumsi is a 27-year-old mother, and is married with one boy who is still in elementary school. Rumsi and her husband work together on running their business by selling vegetables and various snacks at their small kiosk.  In a day, they can earn about $5. Rumsi needs a loan of $100 and with this loan she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her child's education and to give him a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Anih

texts.en:
Anih is a 40-year-old mother, and is married with three children. Two of them are girls while the other is a boy. Her husband Usin is a vegetable seller. To supplement her husband's income, Anih sells Indonesian salad called "gado-gado" and coconut milk rice. From this business, she can earn about $40 in a week.

Anih needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Loan, 34, is married to Toan, 36 years old. They have a daughter and a son aged 7 and 15, wH. are students at high school and primary school. Mrs. Loan is a tailor in her village. She hopes to get a loan of $75 from the Kiva program so that she can update her knowledge of new mode style by catalogue, and purchase materials for making clothes in order to get more customers. Her family income is currently $7 per person/month. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To operate the small tailor shop.

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
N. Begum, 42 years of age (ID-1517-M) and wife of Mr. Seraj Miah, is a member of Rukpali Mohila Somity. She has 3 children; Ripon is 21, Swapan is 18 and Lima is 7 years old. The younger 2 are in school.

Her husband was the only earning member in the family. She wanted to be a source of income in the family so she purchased 300 layers and boilers and establish a small poultry firm. Her children also sometimes assist her in selling eggs in the local markets. She has 4 years experience in this line. Five years ago she obtained training in poultry and is now able to provide primary treatment to layers and boilers when required.

The firm is on her own land and it's in an advantageous situation with fresh air and sufficient light. Her small enterprise supplements income for the family as well as providing nutrition to the family diet. She intends to extend her firm by purchasing more layers and boilers and preparing the shed. Her estimated need is US $1,175.

loans.use: Purchase layers and boilers; prepare shed

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti A. is a 35 year old mother and is married with two children, all of whom are boys.  Her husband, Anda, is a fisherman who earns about $4 a day. To supplement her husband's income, Siti A. sells household goods such as rice, vegetables, kerosene and cigarettes.  From this business, she can earn about $100 in a day as an income.  Siti A. needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
A. Begum, 35 years of age (ID-1299-M), has been a member of Shugandha Mohila Somity since October 2003 and is married to Mr. Amzad Hossain. She has 2 children – one 10 and the other 8 years of age. Both children are in school. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the family expenses, so both of them decided to do a brick business. She purchases bricks at a comparatively low cost from the brick-field, which is far away, stocks them in their fallow land, and sells the them when the price is little higher.

The bricks have high demand in the area for construction work, since Gazipur is a newly declared district headquarters and it is a developing area. She is interested in doing a larger scale business to increase her income. She needs US $900 to expand her bricks business.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani A. is a 21 year old mother and is married with one child, who is a girl attending elementary school. Her husband A. is a fish seller, earning about $3 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Ani A. sells various fried snacks and blended ice.  From this business, she can earn about $10 a day as income.  Ani A. needs a loan of $75. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her child's education and to give her a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani L.is a 28 year oL. mother and is married with two children. The elder is a boy and the younger is a girl.  Her husband Madisa is a fisherman, earning about $5 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Ani L.selL. various fried snacks and cooked instant noodles at her smaL. kiosk.  From this business, she can earn about $15 in a day as an income.  Ani L.needs a loan of $75. With this loan she can buy more goods to seL., thus more or less doubL. her income. She realL. wants to have more income for her children's education, to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Saodah

texts.en: Saodah is a 43 year old mother and is married with one boy who attends high school.  To supplement her husband's income, Saodah sells cigarettes, spices and coconut milk rice at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $15 in a day as an income.  Saodah needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her child's education to give him a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Marmah

texts.en: Marmah is a 20 year old mother and is married with one boy aged 2.5 years. Her husband Abunawan is a fisherman, earning $3 a day. To supplement her husband's income, Marmah sells cigarettes, vegetables, kerosene, and rice at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $10 in a day as an income.  Marmah needs a loan of $75. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income so that she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Siti
