texts.en: Siti is a 23 year old mother and is married with one girl who attends elementary school. Her husband Andi is a fisherman, earning about $2.50 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Siti makes and sells fisherman's nets. She can make one fisherman's net in a day.  Siti needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more materials, thus her working capital will get bigger and will enable her to double her income eventually. She really wants to have more income so that she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Surni

texts.en: Surni is a 35 year old mother and is married with four children. Two of them are boys and two are girls. Her husband, Pardi is a fish seller, earning about $4 in a day.    To supplement her husband's income, Surni sells vegetables, instant noodles, and Indonesian salad called "gado-gado" at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $30 in a day as an income.  Surni needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Sarmunah

texts.en: Sarmunah is a 45 year old mother and is married with one boy aged around 15 years. Her husband, Amat does not have a fixed job, so he does odd jobs such as farming labor.  To supplement her husband's income, Sarmunah sells fried snacks, various other snacks and cooked instant noodles at her small bamboo kiosk.  From this business, she can earn about $10 in a day as an income.  Sarmunah needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her child's education to give him a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Wani

texts.en: Wani is a 28 year old mother and is married with one girl aged 5 years. Her husband Darman is a fisherman, earning about $5 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Wani makes and sells various cooked foods. From this business, she can earn about $2 in a day. Wani needs a loan of $125. With this loan she can buy more materials, thus her working capital gets bigger and more or less enables her to double her income eventually. She really wants to have more income so that she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Sunayah

texts.en: Sunayah is a 35 year old mother and is married with three children. Two of them are girls and the third child is a boy. Her husband, Sueb raises fish and sells them at 5 cent/kg every three months. To supplement her husband's income, Sunayah sells household goods such as vegetables, rice, snacks, kerosene and various beverages at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $30 in a day as an income.  Sunayah needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her children's education to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 37 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  She works selling clothes and earns approximately $10/day, while her husband earns $3/day working as a taxi driver.  keo S. will use this loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She hopes to save a lot of money to expand her business, and so that she can send her children to school until they get jobs.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her business

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn N. is a 50 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 3 children.  She sells fruits and vegetables and can earn $3/day in this business.  Two of her children work to support the family, one as a garment factory worker and the other as a moto taxi driver.  Yorn N. will use this loan to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business and also to help her son buy a motorbike for his business.  In the future, Yorn N. would like to sell a wider variety of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Mrs. Pum N. is 33 years old and sells fruit at the market.  She earns $2.50/day while her husband earns $6/day working in construction.  Pum N. and her husband have three children, one of whom works in construction with his father.  They will use this loan to buy more fruit to sell and help the father buy a motorbike for transportation purposes.  In the future, Pum N. wants to buy a stand in the market.  She would also like for her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell at the market

payments.comment: Congratulations to Pum Neary for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Chim Vuth

texts.en: Mr. Chim Vuth R. is 35 years old and works as a construction foreman in Phnom Penh.  He earns $5/day at this job. One of his three children supplements the family income by working as a barber.  Chim Vuth also helps support his two brothers that live with his family.  He will use this loan for his construction business--buying tools and helping to pay the wages of his employees until project fees are collected.  He would like to earn enough from his business to send all three of his children to state schools.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and pay his workers' advanced wages

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok P. is 40 years old and the mother of four young children.  She earns approximately $5/day in her business of making wrapping paper for packaging.  Her husband is a carpenter and earns $3/day. Together they can send two of their children to school.  This loan will be used to buy paper for Sok P. to use in her business.  In the future, Sok P. would like to buy a stall in the market to sell shoes.  Her goal is to send her children to school until they can find jobs.

loans.use: to buy paper for her wrapping business

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, with her husband and child.  She works at her small laundry shop and earns about $2/day while her husband earns about $3/day operating a mototaxi.  She will use this loan to repair her home so that it will not leak.  In the future, she wants to buy a stand in the market to sell vegetables.  Her goal is for her children to graduate from university.

loans.use: to repair her house for the rainy season

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon S. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their three children.  Phon owns a barber shop and earns $5/day while his wife earns $3/day as a garment factory worker.  One of their children works at a local hotel and the other two children are students.  This loan will be used to repair and expand Phon's barber shop.  In the future, he hopes to grow his business into a hairdressing shop.  If successful, he will send his children to university and build a new house.

loans.use: to repair and expand his barber shop

loans.name: Torng

texts.en: Mr. Torng M. is 37 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife.  He is a government officer and along with his wife, a fish seller.  Combined, they earn approximately $8/day.  The loan will be used to purchase more fish in an effort to expand their business. In the future, Mr. M. would like to buy and sell land as well as build a proper home.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for his family business

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Mrs. Tim S. is a 64 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her three children.  She makes and sells traditional Khmer cake at her bakery. She earns $5/day in this business.  One of her children works at a garment factory and helps her mother support the family.  This loan will be used to buy baking tools and materials for additional cakes.  In the future, she would like to remain in the cake business.  She hopes that she can support her children in their schooling so that they eventually learn specialized skills to obtain a good job.

loans.use: to purchase tools for her business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum K. is 52 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their three children.  Chum K. grows and sells water convolvulus in the market, earning $5/day.  Her husband works as a motor taxi driver, earning $3/day.  She will use this loan to buy some tools for planting crops and also to repair her husband's motorbike.  In the future, she would like to buy more land to raise crops on.

loans.use: to buy tools for planting crops

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn S. M. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife and their four children.  His wife is a small grocer and earns about $2/day.  Khorn raises animals, especially pigs, and earns an average of $5/day.  This loan will be used to buy two new pigs that will be raised and eventually sold at the market.  In the future, Khorn S. M. would like to grow his business so that he can afford to send all four of his children to high school.

loans.use: to buy two pigs

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. Chen B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their three young children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She makes and sells Khmer cake and earns $10/day in revenue.  Her husband is a construction foreman and earns $5/day.  This loan will be used to buy land.  In the future, Mrs. Chen B. would like to open a grocery store and send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy land

payments.comment: Congratulations to Chen Bunh for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is 48 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her two children.  She makes and sells Khmer noodles and earns $2.50/day in profit.  Her two children work at the garment factory to help support the family.  The loan will be used for her and her husband to purchase pigs that they will raise and eventually sell at the market.  Meas would also like to purchase a motorbike so that she can bring her items to the market easily.  In the future, she would like to repair her house if possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a motorbike to transport animals and noodles to the market

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim S. is a 38 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 2 children and her parents.  Mrs. Sim sells fried banana cake, and also grows crops on her small plantation.  This loan will be used to buy a water pump for her plantation.  The pump will help her to grow more crops, and also for her to get more from her existing crops.  In the future, she would like to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for her small plantation

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch M. is 35 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and child.  Touch M. works as a farmer, raising animals and planting vegetables.  Her husband works as a carpenter and earns about $4/day.  This loan will be used to purchase carpenter's tools and some feed for their animals.  In the future, Touch M. would like to buy a small car so that she can transport a variety of vegetables to the market.  She would also like to repair her house so that it doesn't leak during the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase carpenter's tools and some animal feed

payments.comment: Touch Mom paid back the Kiva loan early! Congratulations!

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um C. is a 49 year old widow that lives in Phnom Penh with her daughter.  She works as a grocer, and her daughter sells clothes in the market, earning $6/day.  This loan will be used to purchase some grocery products for her shop.  In the future, she would like to make her business bigger.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
L. Begum, 24 (ID 997-G), is married to Masud Miah. She has a son (Asik) who is 5 years old. She is a member of Shapla Mohila Somity in Gazipur area. She belongs to a poor family and has to depend on her husband’s income, which is not sufficient for meeting the expenses of her family. So she is passing her days in hardship.

L. wished that she could contribute financially to her husband’s earnings so she established a grocery shop 5 years ago; she also received training on income generation activities and is running her shop successfully, adding some income to the family. She has also goodwill in the area. She wants to increase the goods she sells in the shop, like rice, dal, onions, bread, biscuits, etc. but cannot do it because of fund constraints. She is in need of US $450 for enlarging her shop.

loans.use: Purchase of consumable goods and enlarge shop

loans.name: Gulendem

texts.en:
Gulendem was born in 1950 in  the Salyan region, Yenikand village.  This very kind woman is a mother of 6 children.  
She is a very hardworking person.  All day she works in order to improve her business and family's living condition. She breeds sheep. 
Gulendem has 15 years of experience in this business. 
Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy 5 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheep

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en:
Nurana is a mother of 2 children. She lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. 
This 28-year-old young mother of 2 children has a plot of land, where she plants vegetables.
 Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer and seed for  improving her land, to get rich harvest.
Shehas run this business for  3 years.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Srey Moch

texts.en: Srey Moch is married with two children, a daughter and a son. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor when she was 15 years old. She later trained her husband to weave as well. She is currently producing silk products and selling groceries. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA before. The loans have low interest compared to local money lenders and are easier to repay. Before borrowing loans from MAXIMA, her family had two looms. After receiving the loans, she has been able to purchase more looms and is hiring four women in the village to produce silk products. The loans will be used to buy silk materials, sewing thread, and also to rennovate the house and construct a bathroom. The loans are helping Mrs. Moch's family to improve their living conditions and she is glad to be able to employ other women in the village.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay for house rennovations

payments.comment: Srey Moch has repaid her loan ahead of schedule.  She will be requesting a new loan for $1,000

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap S. has been married for 28 years and has six children. She learned to weave silk from her mother when she was 25 years old. Her husband, Mr. KUM Sambath, is a mason--he learned construction from the previous generation in the same village. One of the children is working as a security guard in Phnom Penh. Three other children are producing silks in their mother 's house. Another child looks after cows for the family amd the yougest son is studying at school in the village. Sopheap would like a loan of $800 to expand her family's existing silk production by purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, which costs about $325. She will use the rest of the loan to repare the house. Assessing her hard-working family's business activities, we are sure that she has the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread and to rennovate the house

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sopheap SORN has pay off her loan early before contract and she also asking a new loan for expanding her business of weaving silk.

Thank you so much.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C. is widowed with five children. She is currently living with her son and two married children in the same house. Mrs. C. learned to weave from her neighbor 5 years ago and currently weaves silk products at home with her two daughters. She has continued training her daughters and grandchildren to weave the silk. The family is pursuing a silk-production business. Mrs. C. has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for  to buy silk materials and sewing thread for the looms of herself and her daughters. With these loans and increased business, her family's situation has improved. With her expanded business, she will not only repay this new loan but also build another loom for her daughter, who just got married. She is committed to transfering her knowledge to her family's younger generation to continue the business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Leng Chhem has enough money to pay off her loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Nasy

texts.en: Nasy S. has been married 16 years and has six children. She has only one loom at home and is weaving by herself. She has been a weaver since she was 16 years old, and learned this skill from her neighbor. Sometimes, her daughters help her to weave after they come home from school. Her children are still young and all of them are in school. After school, they help their parents look after the cows and weave the silk. Her husband, Mr. HAM Hoeurn, purchases and sells cows in nearby villages. He learned this business from friends in the same village over the last 6 years. Since the family started borrowing loans from MAXIMA, the family business has become more profitable and has enabled them to send all of the children to school.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and supplies for cows

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Mrs. Nasy Sok paid off her loan. Thank you so much for lending to Nasy Sok.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
27-year-old Samira lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is married and has a child.
Samira breeds calves. She supports her family  working in this business.
Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy a cow. She plans to breed cows in order to get  more milk and to improve her business and income.
She has run this business for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en: Soeut S. is married for more than 10 years and has five children--two daughters and three sons. Three of the children are in school and the other two are still very young. Mrs. S. learned to weave from her neighbor when she was 17 years old. She has two looms, one for herself and another one for her daughters and her husband to use. Mrs. S. trained her husband to weave, which every day while his daughters are in school. The children assist their parents at home with small tasks related to silk production. In addition, the family also employs a few young people in the village in embroidering and preparing the thread on the loom for weaving. The family believes this business will help their children gain real skills for the future. After having only one loom for years, a loan from MAXIMA helped Soeut build another loom for her husband. She would like a loan of $600 to buy silk materials and sewing thread. The business is doing well and they are confident they will be able to quickly repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Soeut SROAP has enough money to pay off his loan.
Thank you.

loans.name: Gulnisa

texts.en:
Gulnisa was born in 1960 in the Salyan region , Yenikand village. She has 3 children.
One day  she bought a pregnant cow and so she started her own business. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 pregnant cows.
She has been in this business for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy 2 pregnant cows

loans.name: Atlaz

texts.en:
Atlaz is an  Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kurdmakhmudlu village. 
Atlaz is 58 years old, married, has 2 children.
She entered into this business 6 years ago.
She needs a loan of $725 to buy 15 sheep in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Gonchegul

texts.en:
Gonchegul wants to improve her sheep breeding.
She has been in this business for 4 years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region,  Gayidish village, on the front line. She is married and has 2 children.
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 15 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Sayid

texts.en:
Sayid is 33 years old,  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region,  settled in the  Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has a child.
4 years ago he decided to be taxi driver. He has a lot of clients.
He is trying to improve his business by providing better service to his clients.
Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ralah

texts.en: Ralah lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and lives with her children and her mother. She is a tailor and she has good work experience. She wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines and also open a new shop with new tailoring designs. She hopes to have good relations with people and to make a good monthly income and help her mother and her children. She is very happy that, with this loan, she can support her family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.en:
"I am constructing additional rooms for my home which is already incredibly small with many of us living there. I would love to be able to finish the rooms but it is still missing the floor, the doors and the windows before we can live there." He is asking for a loan of $1200,00 in order to finish the construction.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

“Estoy haciendo unos cuartos enseguida de mi casa ya que es muy pequeña y somos muchos los que vivimos ahí, me gustaría poder terminar los cuartos me falta poner el piso, las puertas y ventanas para poder habitarlos”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: Build floors, windows and doors of two additional rooms

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.en:
Sandra Patricia lives in the municipality of Santa Catarina in the state of Nuevo León. She has two daughters who are in primary school. She has never received economic help her daughters' father. She has had to work very hard to have enough income to give them the care and attention they need. For this reason, she began selling cosmetics to friends nine years ago. However, thanks to the fact that she likes sales and has an easy time talking to people, she now has many clients.

Now Sandra needs a loan of $550.00, which will be used to buy merchandise to fill the many orders she has from her clients. She is committed to paying back the loan during a period of 6 to 12 months. You can help improve the well-being of this family. They are very thankful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra Patricia vive en el municipio de Santa Catarina en el estado de Nuevo León, tiene dos hijas que asisten a la escuela primaria, nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja para darle lo necesario a sus pequeñas, por que ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para obtener un ingreso que le permita salir adelante con ellas y darles los cuidados y atenciones que requieren, por lo que desde hace nueve años inició con la venta de cosméticos entre sus conocidos, pero gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su facilidad de palabra ahora cuenta con muchos clientes.

Ahora Sandra necesita de un préstamo por $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir numerosos pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, ellas agradecen mucho tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Mrs. Irma is married and lives in the town of Santa Catarina in the state of Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a lathe operator in a local business, however, to improve their economic situation, 11 years ago, Irma decided to open her own business, offering her services as a stylist. Her skills have made it possible to maintain her business for so long.

Now, she needs a $550 loan to buy beauty products for her salon, as well as equipment to provide better service for her clients. She is committed to paying back the loan in 6-12 months. You can be a part of helping this business develop. Decide to take part, she thanks you sincerely.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irma es casada y vive en el municipio de Santa Catarina del estado de Nuevo León, su esposo se desempeña como tornero en una empresa de su localidad, sin embargo, para mejorar la situación económica en la que estaban, desde hace 11 años Irma decidió abrir su propio negocio, ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista. El buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido estar en el negocio por tanto tiempo.

En estos momentos Irma necesita un crédito por $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de productos de belleza que ofrece en su estética, así como equipo que necesita para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte del desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a apoyarla, ella te agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Ricarda

texts.en:
Maria Ricarda is a hard-working, honest, responsible woman. She is currently separated from her partner and has a small child under her care. She doesn't receive support from anyone else in order to get what is necessary for her child, so for the past year she has worked in shoe sales, an occupation which has alloed her to be with her child, since there is no one else to care for him. It has not been easy for Maria and she has had to work a lot, but the love for her childis her greatest reason for going out and making the effort more every day.

At this time, Maria needs a loan of $925 which will go to the purchase of merchandise to be able to offer her customers greater variety, and in this manner, to make her business grow. She promises to return this amount in a period of 6 to 12 months. This family needs you and hopes for your help. Go ahead and support them - she will thank you greatly.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria Ricarda es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, actualmente está separada de su pareja y tiene un pequeño hijo a su cargo, no cuanta con la ayuda de nadie para obtener lo necesario para su hijo por lo que desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de calzado, oficio que le ha permitido estar al cuidado de su pequeño, ya que no tiene quien lo cuide. No ha sido fácil para Maria y ha tenido que trabajar mucho, pero el amor hacia su hijo es su gran motivo para salir y esforzarse más cada día.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y de esta manera hacer creer su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Esta familia te necesita y espera de tu ayuda, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla, ella te lo agradece mucho.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en:
Ramón lives in Santa Catarina. He is married with four children, and has always like being a businessman. For 15 years, he has worked selling fruits and vegetables, starting with very little merchandise. Little by little, he made his business grow, and now he goes out to sell in small places located on the outskirts of the city where he has been able to gain many customers.

Ramón is a very responsible, honest man, and now requires a loan of $1,100 which he will use to purchase merchandise to continue growing his business. He is committed to returning this amount in a period of 6 to 12 months. This is important for the growth of this business, and will help improve the life of this family. You can help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catarina es donde vive Ramón, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, siempre le ha gustado ser comerciante y desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, comenzó con muy poca mercancía pero poco a poco hizo creer su negocio, ahora sale a vender a las localidades pequeñas que se ubican en la afueras de la ciudad donde ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

Ramón es un hombre muy responsable y honesto, ahora requiere de un préstamo de $1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, ayuda a mejorar la vida de esta familia, tú puedes hacerlo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Isaías Domingo

texts.en:
Isaías is originally from Mérida, Yucatán. He is married and has an 11 year old son. Besides having a job at a company, Isaías was not earning enough money to support his family, which is why three years ago he decided to start his own business. He opened a grocery store with the help of a loan from one of his friends. Little by little, his business began to take off and thrive due to his hard work.

Now he needs a $275 loan to buy merchandise to provide a greater variety of products and a better service for his clients. He will return the loan within 5 to 10 months. You can help improve this family's life and contribute to the development of this business. Please support them!

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Isaías es originario de Mérida, Yucatán, es casado y tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad. A pesar de que Isaías estaba empleado en una empresa, no obtenía los recursos que necesitaba su familia, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace tres años y abrió un estanquillo con la ayuda económica de uno de sus amigo, poco a poco su negocio se dio a conocer y comenzó a prosperar gracias al buen trabajo y el esfuerzo diario de Isaías.

Ahora él necesita de un préstamo de $275 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir al desarrollo de este negocio, ¡Apóyalos!

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladis is originally from Chipas and in search of better opportunities, she moved with her family to the city of Mérida, Yucatán. She is married and has two children aged 21 and 23. For nine years, Gladis has been selling fresh chicken in her own home. Once she managed to save a little bit of capital, she started to sell hamburgers and hot dogs, a business that has gone really well for her and has gained her many customers.

At this time, Gladis would like to continue growing her business and needs a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase a grill that she needs to make her products. With this, she will be able to increase her production, and the quality of the foods she prepares. She will return this quantity within a period of 6 to 12 months. Thanks to you, this business will be able to grow. Gladis and her family sincerely thank you for your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Gladis es originaria D. Chiapas y en busca D. mejores oportunidades se mudó con su familia a la ciudad D. Mérida, Yucatán, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos D. 21 y 23 años D. edad. Hace nueve años Gladis se dedicaba a la venta pollo fresco en su propio domicilio, una vez que logró juntar un poco D. capital comenzó a vender hamburguesas y hot dogs, negocio en el que le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Gladis desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y necesita D. un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra D. una plancha que requiere para la elaboración D. sus productos, con esto podrá incrementar su producción y la calidad D. los alimentos que prepara, ella devolverá esta cantidad en un lapso D. 6 a 12 meses. Gracias a ti este negocio podrá creer, Gladis y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase work equipment

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.en:
Filiberto is very hard-working. He is 46, and is married with 3 children--a 26-year-old son and two daughters ages 18 and 21. Filiberto learned masonry from his father when he was very young and worked to support his family. He has been working on his own for the last 15 years. He is known for good craftsmanship and has many customers. Filiberto is now seeking a $375 loan in order to buy the materials he needs to complete a work order. He promises to repay the loan in 4-8 months. Filiberto truly wants to serve his clients, and with your help he can. Thank you for your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Filiberto es muy trabajador, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 26 años y dos hijas de 18 y 21 años. Desde pequeño Filiberto conoce el oficio de albañil, que aprendió de su padre, y para ayudar a su familia tuvo que practicar desde temprana edad. Hace 15 años se dedica a esta labor de manera independiente, hace trabajos de muy buena calidad, por lo que ahora cuenta con muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Filiberto tiene proyectos a realizar pero necesita capital para invertir por lo que solicita un préstamo de $375 dólares que destinará a la compra del material que requiere para hacer su trabajo, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Filiberto desea ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, y con tu ayuda esto puede ser posible, muchas gracias por ayudar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anselma Concepción

texts.en:
Honesty and responsibility are two of Anselma's qualities. She's married, has a 15-year-old daughter, and two sons who are 18 and 23. To help her husband with the home's expenses, three years ago, Anselma decided to start her own business with selling clothes. She has the help of her three children with this, and fortunately, it has gone very well and she has seen her business prosper.

Now, Anselma would like to offer good service to her customers and for this, she needs a credit of $275, which she will use to purchase merchandise to be able to have more product variety. She promises to return this amount in a period of 4 to 8 months. Contribute to the growth of this business and be an important part of this family. They will thank you.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Honestidad y responsabilidad son dos de las cualidades que posee Anselma, ella es casada, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad y dos hijos de 18 y 23 años. Para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, desde hace tres años Anselma decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, en el que recibe la ayuda de sus tres hijos, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien y ha visto prosperar su negocio.

Ahora, Anselma desea ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y para esto necesita un crédito por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder tener más variedad de productos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y se parte importante de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
"I opened my business one year ago and it is the support of my family as well as all those that I attend to. Although the space I have in my shop is quite small i would like to purchase more merchandise and furniture to accomodate it.

I have many plans for the future, including enlarging my business and selling a bit of everything in order to increase my sales. I am asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase merchandise and furniture.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

"Abri mi negocio desde hace 1 año y es el sustento de mi familia así es que todos lo atendemos, aunque es muy pequeño el espacio que tengo en mi negocio me gustaria comprar más mercancía y un mueble para acomodarla. Tengo muchos planes, en un futuro me gustaría ampliar mi negocio y así vender un poco de todo para aumentar mis ventas". Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar mercancia y un mueble.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise and purchase furniture

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
"I established my business over a year ago, but I have not been able to buy much merchandise because I don't have enough money to do so. Hence my store does not have much variety of products to offer, resulting in sales going down. I would like to buy more merchandise, to have a little bit of everything so I can increase the sales. I would like to take a $800 loan to provide a greater variety of products in my store."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo mi negocio desde hace 1 año pero por falta de dinero no he podido comprar más mercancía tengo muy pocas cosas y por lo mismo han bajado mis ventas, quisiera comprar más mercancia, tener un poco de todo y así aumentar mis ventas”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para comprar más mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Mrs. Valentina is 64 years old and married. Her husband is retired. To get extra income, which would allow her to improve the living conditions of her family, she started her own business selling tacos three years ago, with the help of one of her daughters. Little by little, she has managed to move the business forward, and thanks to the quality of the products she makes, she now has many customers.

Valentina's dream is to expand her business and be able to open other locations. She is requesting a loan of $250 which will be used for the purchase of equipment which is needed to offer better service, such as remodeling the location. She is committed to returning this amount in a period of 3 to 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and decide to help her. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Valentina tiene 64 años de edad, es casada. Su esposo es jubilado y para obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, desde hace tres años, con ayuda de una de sus hijas inició su propio negocio con la venta de tacos, poco a poco ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio, gracias a la calidad de los productos que elabora ahora tiene muchos clientes.

El sueño de Valentina es ampliar su negocio y poder abrir otros locales, ahora solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de equipo que necesita para ofrecer un mejor servicio, así como la remodelación del local, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a ayudarla, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Remodeling and purchase of equipment

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Mrs. Benita is 56 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and she started this business 10 years ago with a stand in the municipal market.

Although her business has grown, one of her children is still studying and this takes a larger portion of her income. With her business, she has enabled her other children to study as well, and they are now working.

This is not the only work she does. She also does door to door sales of clothing. She selects the place where she sells based on the different harvest times of the agrarian production in the country.

She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise, especially since there is more demand for seasonal clothing. She innovates her business buying merchandise that in fashion. This way she can ensure that her son can finish highschool and enroll in university.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Benita tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; su marido es carpintero y ella empezó con este trabajo hace 10 años atrás con un puesto de venta en el Mercado Municipal.

Su negocio fue creciendo, uno de sus hijos estudia todavía y le absorbe gran parte de sus ingresos, así también con su trabajo ya ha hecho estudiar a sus otros hijos que ya son todos profesionales.

Ella no sólo se dedica a esta actividad, sino que también se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas. Elige la zona de venta de acuerdo a las diferentes temporadas de cosechas de producción agraria del país.

Planea utilizar el crédito para comprar más mercaderías puesto que por ahora hay muchos pedidos de ropas de temporada, así también tiene que innovar sus negocio, comprando las mercaderías que están de moda de manera a asegurar la terminación de los estudios secundarios del hijo y por que no incursionar en la universidad.

loans.use: To buy winter clothing

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun C. is 48 years old and a widow.  Her and her four children live in Khampong Cham province, Cambodia. In order to supplement the family's income and the childrens’ education, C. owns a grocery store and has been engaged in this business for several years since her husband passed away.  In this business, she can makes around $22/day in revenue. Therefore, two of her  daughters help in providing for the household by working at the local garment factory.  The other two children attend school. In order to satisfy and facilitate her clients' needs, Noeun C. is asking for $1000 to purchase an electric generator and some grocery products for her inventory. Eventually, she hopes to send her children to university with the help of her sustainable business.

loans.use: to purchase an electric generator and some grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Fakhria

texts.en:
Fakhria lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is divorced and she lives with her mother. She is a tailor like her mother. Her mother is not working now; only her daughter is working to support herself and her mother.

Fakhria works at home and all the clients come to their house. She took her 2nd cycle group loan and bought new machines and some extra materials. Now she wants to take anther loan to rent a shop in Kabul to attract more clients and expand her business to make a better life for herself and also for her mother. She is happy with this loan and she would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: Rent a shop for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: Sobirjon has been trading sweets for seven years. His wife helps him, and he sells his goods at Khujand's central market. Sobir started his business from a small table, and has recently expanded his place to two big tables. He requested his last loan to sell a greater assortment of candies. Now his plans are to install some shelves in his work place so that he can add washing goods to his business. Previously, Sobir worked as a barman in a restaurant.  Sobir has three children and one grandson. His eldest son is in Russia, and he would like to save for his son's wedding.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en: Narzullo S. has been trading for 7 years. He sold washing goods for two years, and then he decided to sell stationery as he liked it better. He purchases his goods in central Khujand's market. He will use his loan to buy more inventory. Narzullo is from a big family, and he has five little brothers. His parents are still alive, and he helps all of them.  Recently he helped to arrange the wedding for his middle brother. Narzullo has three daughters, and his wife also trades in the local market. They live in a small flat.  He plans to construct a house and then move there.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Abdul Bashir

texts.en: A. Bashir lives in district 17 of Kabu,l Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is married and he has a dress shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take a individual loan to buy new clothing designs  from other countries to increase his business. He also wants to enlarge his shop to attract more clients and earn more money to make a better business and support his family. He is happy and he would like to thank AFSG for helping him solve his problems.

loans.use: To buy new designs of clothes

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en: Shohista A. has been trading for seven years. In the beginning, she started her business with selling candies, and then she added dried fruit.  She works with her sister, and they have two big tables. When one of them goes to get more goods, the other works for both. Now their main target is to cover their working place with glass. It would be easer to work in the winter and keep their goods. Shohista has 3 children, and as her husband is in Russia now, she has to take care of her children herself.  Another of her plans is to purchase an auto sewing machine for her eldest daughter, who would like to be a sewer.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Khabiba

texts.en: Previously, Khabiba worked in kindergarten, but the salary was not very high so she had to go into trading. Now she has been working at the market for 10 years. She trades sweets and she uses her loans for buying inventory. The profit she spends on her children, and they live in the same house with her mother-in law who is 84 years old. Her husband is in prison and she visits him every month. Khabiba has three children, and her eldest son would like to be an architect. She would like to use her next loan to install extra shelves.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en: Khosiyat K. has been in trade since 1990. She started her business by selling the material for national dresses, but this kind of business required an assistant. At first, her children helped her, but then they entered high school. Therefore, she turned to an easier business. Previously, Khosiyat worked at the middle school for 24 years, and it is very important for her to educate her children. Her husband is a dentist, but unfortunately in Tajikistan it is still not a profitable job, so Khosiyat educated her children herself. Now Khosiyat has 8 grandchildren, and they are used to their granny buying them different kinds of sweets and toys.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Ghoas Ali

texts.en: Ghoas A. lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an educated man and worked a lot in Afghan ministries but he is tired of working in government places. He wanted to start a new business and he faced economic problems. He took his 5th cycle group loan and opened a tinsmith shop and makes a good monthly income and a successful business. Now he wants to take anther loan to buy new kinds of bags and some extra materials to find more clients and expand his business. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of  bags and some extra materials

loans.name: Gulchekhra

texts.en: Gulchekhra M. has no education, and was a housewife for many years. In 1994, she started her business with selling perfume.  Her last loan was used for adding other kinds of goods. When she goes to buy more goods, her children sell at her workplace. Her husband is unemployed, but he helps her with the housework. Now they are reconstructing their house. Her current loan request will be used to install shelves, as she has expanded the assortment of her goods, and she needs to make her workplace more functional.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira S. started her business with selling men's clothes. Then step-by-step she expanded her trading areas and added national dress materials (delaine). Today she has three trading areas and her current request is for a fourth area. Shoira buys the goods herself, and goes to China, Uzbekistan and Istaravshan. Her daughter always helps her. Shoira says that due to her business, she was able to reconstruct her house, and purchase another flat and vehicle for her husband. Now she would like to save money to purchase a car for herself. Her other plan is to pay for hairdressing courses for her younger daughter.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Mohammad Sharif

texts.en: Mohammad Sharif lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an uneducated man. He is married and he was out of the country for a long time. He came back a year ago and lives with his own family. He has a workshop and he wants to take a group loan to enlarge his shop and buy new car repair kits. He wants to expand his business with this loan and make a better life for his family and also for himself. He is happy with this loan program in Afghanistan because people can solve their problems. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new car repair kits and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Anna Aya

texts.en:
Anna is a 29 year old mother of two—a boy of 9 and a girl of 6. For 13 years she has operated her business as a tailor in Myanga market in the Bungoma District of Western Kenya. With 5 sewing machines and one employee, her business is comprised of a diversity of activities. They include buying clothes second hand, repairing them and then reselling; tailoring dresses and suits for individual clients; selling pre-made uniforms to primary schools; as well as training young women how to be tailors.

Anna is currently training 5 young women in the skill of tailoring. Charging her students 7,000 Kenyan Schillings per year, they work at the 3 extra sewing machines not being used by Anna or her employee. This is of great benefit to the community, as Anna is able to provide young women with the skills they will need to attain employment and open their own tailoring centers. Anna herself was trained at Naitiri Youth Polytechnic, but not all women have the opportunity to attend established institutions.

Anna gives the clothes that she repairs to her husband to sell at the market. The clothing includes Vitenge dresses and Kaunda suits, the traditional clothing in the area. Her greatest specialty that separates her from other tailors, however, is her production of ready made uniforms for primary schools. Whereas other tailors lack the ability to prepare ready made school uniforms, Anna has already established relationships with multiple primary schools that she sells to. Along with being another example of how Anna provides for her community, it also represents a consistent and stable demand for her products.

According to Anna, the greatest challenge to her business has been a lack of capital to meet demand. With her new loan, she will purchase the necessary cloths and threads to expand the capacity of her tailoring shop. With this increased capacity, she hopes to grow profits and continue to pay for her family's basic necessities, including food and children’s school fees.

While primary education is supposedly free in Kenya, there are still many other expenses that families face, including uniforms, books, tests, school upkeep, etc. Moreover, the steep costs of high school education must be completely paid by families—which makes secondary education a product of tremendous sacrifice, and in some cases an impossibility. Anna hopes that her business will ensure that her children can attain an education that will help them in the future.

loans.use: To purchase material and thread to increase production

loans.name: Rita Nanjala

texts.en:
Rita is a 43 year old mother of 10 who sells tomatoes, onions, and fish at a roadside stand in Myanga, Bungoma Distrcit. Her small business has been operating since 1986, the predominant activity being buying tomatoes in bulk from Chwele and then reselling them to vendors and individual families in Myanga.

On a market day, which occurs twice a week, Rita sells about 4 crates of tomatoes at a profit of 300 Kenya Schillings each (about 4.6 US Dollars). Vendors place their orders beforehand, and then Rita buys from her supplier accordingly. On non-market days Rita sells mostly retail, and can make a profit of about 100 Kenya Schillings from all of her products.

One challenge that her business currently faces is that on market days, she has no tomatoes left over after selling to vendors. Consequently, she cannot meet the demand from individual families who wish to make purchases in smaller quantities. Rita hopes to address this obstacle with a Kiva loan, which she would invest in increasing her stock of tomatoes, as well as onions and fish.

Rita is confident that there would be demand to meet the increased stock from her loan. Her increased capacity would grow her profits, and help her face the challenge of raising 10 children. Her husband is retired from his job as a water engineer, so much of the burden falls on her. Of her 10 children, 5 are currently in primary school, and the other 5 dropped out from secondary school because of a lack of resources to pay for school fees.

While primary education is supposedly free in Kenya, there are still many other expenses that families face, including uniforms, books, tests, school upkeep, etc. Moreover, the steep costs of high school education must be completely paid by families—which makes secondary education a product of tremendous sacrifice, and in some cases an impossibility. Rita hopes that the 5 children currently in primary school will be able to achieve the level of education her other children could not.

loans.use: Invest in the stock of her tomatoes

loans.name: Dallower

texts.en: Dallower lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is the only support of his family because his father died and he is the worker in his house. He was a small boy when he  started working. He has a retail shop and also sells car repair kits. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take a group loan to buy new car repair kits and also retail items like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, baskets, bags of crisps and other materials to make a good business and make a better future for himself and also for his family.

loans.use: Buy inventory for his general store and car repair kits

loans.name: Iskandarov

texts.en: M. is married and has four children. Formerly, he was a teacher of Russian language, but from 1995 until now he has been a food seller. He had a very good knowledge about trading from his brother who was a trader. M. was given a loan of $888 by MLF «HUMO». He has increased the range of his products and lowered prices. With a loan of $1000, he plans to further increase the range of goods and buy larger quantities, thus reducing transportation expenses and lowering prices. For the poor population of Khuroson low prices are very important for purchasing goods.

loans.use: Selling food

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat K. worked at a government shop for 20 years and then turned to a private business. She has been in business for 15 years.  To buy goods she goes to China and Uzbekistan. Her husband is a musician, but when Inobat goes to buy goods he helps her. Their eldest son helps at holidays, and studies at university. Inobat also has three daughters, and one of them trades at the same market. From the beginning they purchased trading areas in the same place. She always uses her loans for buying inventory. Now their main plan is to install heating equipment in one of the rooms in their house. They have gas heating but during the winter there is no gas or electricity - it’s the main problem of Tajikistan.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Ragabov

texts.en: Rajabov Z. is 22 years old, and is a student of Tax and Law University. Not married, he lives with parents. Z. is the owner of a small food stall and has been working there by himself for 18 months. The loan will be used to purchase tables, chairs, and umbrellas, and  Z. would also like to increase the assortment of goods and national foods. This will help to improve the district's infrastructure because the food stall is located near the central district market and people from remote villages can rest and eat cheap national food after market day. Z. is planning to pay the loan back in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, and umbrellas, and increase the assortment of goods and national dishes

loans.name: Govkhar

texts.en:
Govkhar is a very active and responsible woman. 4 years ago she decided to start this business .
She is 52, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. She is married and has 2 children.
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy foodstuffs. 
She wants to increase her foodstuffs to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy foodsuffs

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a clothing and garment salesman who has more than thirty years of experience as a retailer. He not only sells to individuals, but is also a distributor to other salespeople in the area.  Most of his clients buy on credit because of their lack of liquidity. Ramon is a very good collector because of his experience. He works diligently from 8 am until 7 pm. Although he is 65 years old, he plans on working for much longer. He feels the need to help his four sons establish themselves and start businesses of their own. He will invest the money in wholesale purchases of new products.

Ricardo’s first loan was a success by all measures. He repaid on time and his business grew as well. He now works closely with one of his sons who has become involved in his trade. He feels proud that he not only has a flourishing business but also that his family is taking part in it. He is optimistic about his second loan with Kiva and Mifex.

loans.use: to invest in inventory

loans.name: Deisy

texts.en:
Deisy has seven years of experience selling vegetables. She started selling them during the holidays when her town held festivals. When those were not going on, Deisy ran a shop out of her home. When customers started coming, she realized that they were also in need of household items and she started building an inventory that looked something like a small market.

Deisy moved to a part of Guayaquil named Malvinas five years ago when she bought her house. It is there that she works hard every day from 6:30am until 11pm. This is actually her second loan with Kiva and Mifex. Her first loan was used to invest in vegetables and other products. She can now better attend to the needs of her customers by keeping more products in stock and offering the best vegetables she can find. The first loan was so successful that she was able to purchase a new refrigerator with a glass door with her profits. She now wants to use her second loan to buy products that she can display and sell, such as yogurt, milk and beverages.

Deisy is a 26 year old single mother of three. Two of her children are studying in school. Her husband left her when her children were just infants, so she has had to rely on her family to support her. Her wish is to continue building the business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy refrigerated products to sell

loans.name: Nerida

texts.en: Nerida works selling cosmetics and clothes to people in their homes. She travels door-to-door offering her products to acquaintances and friends. She began doing this after saving about $100 from a job she had as a maid. She is still in need of investment capital so that she may purchase more products at wholesale prices. She hopes that she can explore the potential of new products and accesories. She is only 22 years old and has two children. They live in a home made out of wood, which she hopes to improve with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to invest in new products

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat R. started her business with selling children's shoes, and then she added clothes. Farogat says that at the beginning she did not think that her business would increase so quickly.  First she purchased only one trading area, and now she needs another one. At this new one, she plans to sell new seasonal women's shoes. Farogat has 3 children. Her husband and eldest son are in Russia.  Her daughter helps her, when she has to go to buy goods. Other days her daughter sews national dresses.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos has a store where he sells clothes and cosmetics. He started this business with $300 he saved from a previous job. He invested in clothing and sold his products door-to-door while saving up to construct a store in his home. He hopes to use the loan as investment capital to purchase clothes and cosmetics at more affordable prices. He lives with his wife and two children in a wooden house that is in the process of being rebuilt with cement. He is optimistic about the future and his possibilities of continuing growth.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics at more affordable prices

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Since 1998, Dilorom A. has been engaged in trading.  When Dilorom began her trading she sold children's clothes, and then turned to national dress material. She buys goods from China and Uzbekistan. Dilorom used her last loan for expanding her assortment of material. Now she needs to expand her business. Dilorom is a widow but she was able to pay for her son's education, and he is studying at Polytechnic University. When he graduates he will work on the railway. Dilorom does not want him to go to Russia. Now her plan is to save money for his wedding.  Therefore, she needs a loan to buy more inventory to sell.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Monserrate

texts.en:
Ms. Monserrate left Ecuador for Venezuela several years ago in search of better employment and new opportunities. In Venezuela, she has learned how to make purses out of leather and other materials. She returned to Ecuador a few years ago to restart her life in her native country. She used $400 of her savings and the skills she learned abroad to establish a new business making purses.

P. is requesting the loan so she may scale up her business and setup a workshop. She wants to invest in raw materials and make purses with new designs that she has created. The loan will help her make more profit and take care of herself and her son, who is currently in school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for production

loans.name: Germania

texts.en:
Germania started her business out of a need to earn more income for her family. She started selling makeup and other cosmetics to the teachers at her son’s school. Before she knew it, she had a full-fledged business selling cosmetics and other accessories to women. She is now seeking a loan that will help her buy her products at larger quantities so she may make more profit.

Germania is 46 and has three children. She lives in a home made out of wood and bamboo. She is hoping that with the extra profit she can fix the roof and walls.

loans.use: to buy her products at larger quantities

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana started her shrimp selling business with only $100 in capital that her brother lent her. She used the money to invest in shrimp and she slowly started to build a reputation as a vendor in the area.

Juana’s business has developed very well over the past few years. She hopes that she will be able to invest in different types of seafood that she can sell. Increasing her current offerings and diversifying her product line can have a significant impact on Juana’s business.

Juana is 49 years old and she has two children, who are in school. Her home is very humble and she hopes that she is able to save and fix it up.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and other seafood prodcuts more often

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma has a business of selling household products. She works from her home and sells products door-to-door. She started her business with $150 she saved from her previous job as a domestic worker.

At first, she would only offer her products to her neighbors. Slowly, she ventured into new markets. She is now fairly popular in other areas that are not near her home. She is requesting the loan so that she may increase her inventory and offer her clients new products.

Irma has one son who is in school, whom she supports fully. She and her family live in house made of wood. Her neighbors confirm that Irma and her family are positive influences in the community.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha has a small store where she sells various items including school and office supplies, toys for children and snacks. She is hoping that she can receive a loan in order to buy even more products. She particularly wants to focus on items that are attractive to children as her store has become popular with youth.

Martha is 35 years old and has three children, who are studying. Her home is made out of wood and bamboo and needs some work. She hopes she can save to improve her house and for the future of her children.

loans.use: to invest in toys and other products

loans.name: Maryer

texts.en: C. sells peeled garlic to stores in her area. She started this business with her sister as a secondary source of income. The business has grown steadily and they make enough to support their family. They purchase garlic from rural farmers, peel and package it, and sell it to small stores around their neighborhood. C. is 41 years old and has three children, who are all in school. She has a small and humble house and a stable household. She hopes to save money to make improvements to her floor.

loans.use: to buy garlic at larger quantities

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes has a small business selling women’s accessories and shoes. She started with $100 of her savings and the support of her husband. She offers her products to locals and also sells door-to-door. She has started to explore the possibilities of selling new products such as toys and electronics. She is requesting a loan in order to continue testing the market and investing in the most popular products. She has four children, who are all studying. They live together in a house of wood that is slowly being converted to cement.

loans.use: to buy new products to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has a business selling clothes to people in their homes. She travels door-to-door offering her products to acquaintances and friends. She is in need of investment capital so she may purchase more products at wholesale prices. The effect on her business will be immediate, as she will be able to dramatically increase her profits and gain popularity in the sector. She is 43 years old and has three children. They live in a home made out of wood, which she hopes to improve with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to increase her product line

loans.name: Mukhabbat

texts.en: Mukhabbat A. has three children, and her eldest daughter and son help her. Two of her sons study at universities. One of them will be an economist and the other would like to be a taxman. Her husband is in Russia. There are also two pensioners, parents of her husband, who live with them. When Mukhabat began her business it was only a small table, but now she has three tables. Mukhabat has a lot of constant clients because the assortment of her materials is very big. Now, as it is the beginning of the summer season, she would like to renew the assortment of her goods.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak lost her husband three years ago. They started their business together and used to work together. Muborak was a teacher of middle school and her husband was an architect. Their salaries were too small and they decided to turn to private activity. Now her children help her, and her eldest son is in Russia. Last time he came back he purchased a microbus and rented it.  His will use his profits towards a photo saloon. Muborak also has four grandchildren, and as she sells children's clothes, her grandchildren always have the best things.
Muborak now needs a loan to purchase the new season's goods .

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP)  from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
He is married and has 3 children.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 cows.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Mrs. Robina U. is 50 years old, and is married with six (6) children. She lives in a semi-urban area in Ubiaja, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

Mrs. Robina is a dedicated client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of drinks. She is requesting the above amount to help in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is a 42 year old woman who is married with five (5) children. She became a LAPO client in 2001 (7 years ago). She started the above businesses in 1995 in a semi urban area of Ubiaja of the Edo State of Nigeria.

She sells Farley used cloths to the community, and she is requesting $400 for business growth.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sales

loans.name: Turadj

texts.en:
Turadj is a mother of 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
She has 5 years of experience in this business.
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 10 sheep in order to improve her business to meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: A young woman, Mrs. Martina O. is 45 years old, and is married with six (6) children.  She lives in a semi-urban area in Ubiaja in the Edo State of Nigeria. A dedicated client of LAPO, Mrs. Martina specializes in local soap making.  She is requesting the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for soap making

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: She is a 58 years old woman, Mrs. Janet O., married with six (6) children living in the semi-urban area in Ubiaja, Edo State of Nigeria. She learnt her trade business for 6 years before she started her business in the year 2002. She is eager to access the above amount to acquire more goods for sales.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 65 year old woman with eight (8) children.  She specializes in the sale of foodstuffs to the public. She started her business 2 years ago. According to her she needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: LAPO has blessed me and my family says Mrs. Comfort  Udebulu. A 64 years woman with nine (9) children, specializes in the sale of bags of cement to the public. She started her business 6 years ago. According to her she needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement for sale

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en: Zahara lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her husband, whom she married last year. She doesn’t have children yet.  She is a tailor and she took her 2nd cycle group loan and bought new sewing machines and some extra materials. Now she wants to take anther loan to rent a shop in a busy place in Kabul so that she can attract more clients and help her husband to make a butter future for themselves. This is one of her fondest wishes.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Ebalu

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guard my capital to ensure the continuity of my business." All these are words of Mrs. F. Ebalu, a female entrepreneur married with five (5) children. She is requesting $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for food

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: I  Mrs. Josephine A. is a business woman, with the help of LAPO loan i can take care of my family. I have learned how to use capital to ensure the continuity of the business I run.  Also she is married with five (5) children. She is requesting for $350 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more plastic rubber for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy Abharo hails from the Edo State of Nigeria. She is married, with eight children, and is happy to be a LAPO client. She says that LAPO has brought rain to her family. She is asking for $250 to expand her business of selling garri.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Mrs. Caroline O. is married with eight children, and hails from Ubiaji, Edo State of Nigeria.  She started her business of selling bags of garri in her community years ago to help take care of her family.  She is requesting a loan of $250 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 45 years old, and he has a wife and three children. The two girls are 18 and 20 years of age, and both attend high school. The youngest one is 5 years old and in primary one .

Paul has been involved in the business of servicing cars for the last 25 years. He has a lot of experience, and he wants to get big contracts to service vehicles for organizations. He would like to get a loan of US $600 to buy lubricants and fluids like oil, grease, coolants, and others.

loans.use: Buy motor vehicle lubricants to service cars

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Rain has light to my business and Family sayd Mrs. Christian O.. A 35 years old, a trader, and married with four children. She joined LAPO in 2000. She provides the community with food for a large number of people in the urban centre in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is a dynamic leader in one of LAPO's groups of beneficaries. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of garri.

loans.use: To buy bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Paullina

texts.en: Mrs. Paullina D. is 40 years old, and is married, with four children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells local drinks to people in her community.  She is requesting a loan of $550 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of local gin to expand her business

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Mrs. Philo A. is 46 years old, and is married with seven (7) children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria. She sells women's wraps to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of $650 for business expansion.

loans.use: Sales of women's wraps

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: A great seed seller is Rosemary Okoje. She is 40 years old, and is married with eight children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells seed yams to the people in her community.  She is requesting a loan of $550 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more seed yams to sell

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: Mrs. Fidelia U. is 25 years old, and is married with six (6) children.  She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells plastic coolers and wrappers to the people in her community.  She is requesting a loan of $650 for business expansion.

loans.use:
To buy more plastic coolers &
 wrappers to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Mr. Isaac A. is 38 years old, and is married with three (3) children.  He hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria.  He sells palm nuts to the people in his community.  He is requesting a loan if $550 for business growth.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts to sell

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Mr. Ezekiel O. is 28 years old.  He started benefing from LAPO with his first loan in 1992.  He is currently paying a loan of $346. He plans to increase his stock of building materials if granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. Agnes O. is 59 years old, and a LAPO group leader.  She started her business in 1981 and was a LAPO client in 2001.  She is a popular seller in her quarters of Nigeria.  She plans to improve her business if granted her loan request of $650.

loans.use:
To buy more bags of rice and gallons 
of ground nut oil

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Mr. Joel I., a LAPO Client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loans, and the poor in Nigeria. Especially the impact of LAPO loans in his life and his family's life for the past 8 years.  He is bent on loyalty to LAPO, and ensures that repayment is 100%.  He is requesting a loan of $800 to increase his goods.

loans.use:
To buy more building materials & 
molding blocks

loans.name: Evang. Peace Oyakhil

texts.en: Mr. Evang. Peace Oyakhilomen I., a LAPO client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loans, and the poor in Nigeria.  He is from Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria, and is married with one child.  He is bent on loyalty to LAPO and ensures that repayment is 100%.  He is requesting a loan of $550 to increase his goods.

loans.use:
To buy more materials for the production 
of aluminum.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience I. is one of LAPO's group leaders.  She is 40 years old, and a trained seller of wood.  She is energetic, zealous and optimistic in all her dealings.  She is requesting a loan of $650 to improve her business

loans.use: To buy more wood to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: According to Mrs. Lucy O., she started this business 14 years ago, and her family has benefited from it greatly.  Although she is 54 years old, her business acumen paves the way for her.  She is requesting a loan of $650 for the growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy more plywood to sell.

loans.name: Isaac Sam

texts.en: A married man who has worked so hard for his family. Mr. Isaac Sam O. started his business 10 years ago, and he is benefiting greatly from LAPO.  Although he is 48 years old, his business acumen paves the way for him.  He is requesting a loan of $650 for the growth of his business.

loans.use: To buy more products for processing

loans.name: Eremen

texts.en: A 33 years young dynamic woman, Mrs. Eremen R. speaks with zealousness when talking about the impact of LAPO loans on her business.  She is married with five (5) children, and says that ‘money is business’.  She knows this from the changes she experienced when she got her first loan from LAPO.  She is now requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use:
To buy more crates of drinks &
provisions to sell.

loans.name: Akhigbe

texts.en: A young dynamic Mrs. Akhigbe B. speaks with zealousness when talking about the impact of LAPO loan on her business. According to her, ‘money is business.’ She knew this from the changes she had when she got her first loan from LAPO. She disclosed her desired to have the above amount for her business

loans.use:
To buy more drink & plastic
coolers to sell

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Mr. Lucky O., a 37 years old dynamic client of LAPO. He has proved his worth of experience in his line of business. He is maintaining his repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. He needs this money ($400) to keep his business booming.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for sale

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Mr. Raphael N., a 46 year old dynamic client of LAPO. He is married with four children and has proved his worth of experience in his line of business. He is maintaining his repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. He needs this money ($500) to keep his business booming.

loans.use: To buy more gas cookers for sale

loans.name: Odigie
