Knowing that timely and full financing of this event can negatively affect her business, she is attracting new funds for her business, and increasing the turnover constantly. With profits, she purchases necessary materials for the business.

loans.use: Growth of the scope of goods

loans.name: Parda

texts.en: S. Parda has been working in entrepreneurship activity already for 10 years. He sells poisons – specific and rare kinds of poisons, besides industrial poisons.  Some kinds of poisons he produces himself. He has technical secondary education.  There are 5 children in his family, four of them at present live with him and as it is expected from a father – he should create good conditions for his children to obtain education, and also develop their private life and create conditions for independent lives – to build separate dwelling and so on.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en:
S. Ruzigul has been engaged in her business for 10 years. She started her present business with very small assets – little more than 1000 somoni, which she constantly develops, though she could not do in such ways as she like. The gained experience showed that to have real increase of income level, it is necessary to increase her scope of goods.

With 6 children she had not any possibility to get a higher education – she tries to avoid that situation for her own children. At present, five of them have their own families and live independently.

All her efforts and deposits are directed to her junior daughter, who lives with them. Now, she finished secondary school and plans to enter higher education. And then she also must leave her parents' house, which is their nearest goal, as it is connected with big expenditures.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Davlatbibi

texts.en:
For more than 8 years, S. Davlatbibi has been engaged in trade. During this time she reached a good level in her activity and she takes a firm place amongst entrepreneurs of a similar level. In spite of the fact that she does not have higher education – her experience gained through her trade, allows her to know all answers to all changes in the market.

Business also allows her to provide for her family, which consists of 4 persons – her husband and three children. Her junior daughter is left in the home – she studies in a specialized school to clothing. After study her mother intends to provide her with a job in order to be financial independent from her new family and earn her way. Her main goal is to create conditions to obtain higher education for daughter.

loans.use: Increase of goods assortment

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
This young man is  23 years old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He is single.
He has run this business for 4 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 cows to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old. She operates a retail shop in the suburbs of Kampala, the capital city of Uganda. She is married with three children. Her first child is a 21-year-old girl studying nursing. Her second child is a 19-year-old boy in high school, and her third child is a 16-year-old boy, also in high school.

Rose wants a loan of US $1200 to increase the stock of her business. The business supports the family and pays for school fees, food, medication, and other expenses.

The stock in the business is small due to low capital. Rose wants to increase the stock so that she can turn the shop into a wholesale grocery in one year's time. She developed her business skills through the trainings organized by SAO MFI.

Her daily sales are US $35 per day, and she wants to increase her turnover to US $80 per day in order to increase the profitability of her grocery store. The loan will help her to realize her dreams and the untapped potential within her.

loans.use: Increase grocery stock

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy T. N. is the 37 year-old mother of three children who are in school. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a small grocery stand at her house and typically makes around $2.50/day, while her husband makes an average of about $7/day in revenue from selling cabinets at the nearby market. Mrs. T. N. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase more grocery products for her inventory to satisfy her clients' needs. The rest of the loan she will use to repair her house which normally leaks during the rainy season. In the future, Mrs. T. N. wants her current stand to become a big store with many kinds of products that meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: Mrs. Tek nim would like to purchase some grocery products for her inventory and to repair her house to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.name: Bunyad

texts.en:
Bunyad has run this business for 5 years.
This man is an  Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. 
This 32-year-old man works very hard every day to increase his income.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.en: U. Rasuljohn helped his parents after finishing secondary school. 10 years ago he began to work in entrepreneurship. As he is not burden to his big family – he has only one son, who studies in 6th form – all his benefit he keeps, to continue his son’s education, and his future house. With the loan he supports and develops his business – keeping it on competitive ability level.

loans.use: To provide continuous purchase of goods

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a widow and a mother of one child. Her husband died leaving nothing behind and she was the only one left to take care of her son and her self. Motivated by the activities of other GHAPE members in her community, she joined the organization and received her first loan of $40 in 2005. From her previous loans, she has been providing ready food to manual laborers and hawkers in her community and equally to school children. The profit she got from the business was used in meeting up with the demands of her child in school and equally for medication when he fell sick. 

Rachael has successfully received and repaid loans for the past two years and given a loan of $500, she plans to buy four bags of Koki beans and seven tins of palm oil for increased production.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: sale of accra beans, Koki, Koki beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Khumara

texts.en:
Khumara is 33 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the  Fizuli region , Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.  She is married and has a child. She has been in this business for 5 years. She sells agricultural produce in her own car. 
 Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy spare parts for her car. This business allows her family to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
Vali has 4 years  of experience in this business . He is 51 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan ,Fizuli region, settled in Makhmudlu village,. He is married and  has 3 children.
Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow.
He plans to produce milk, cheese and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en:
Natavan is 30, a mother of 2 children,  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Dilagar village.
She is a very active and responsible woman.5 years ago she decided to start this business.Now she needs a loan of $950 to expand the area of her store.

loans.use: To expand the area of her store

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina wants to increase her earnings by offering new products.
She breeds calves and  cows and now she plans to increase the number of dairy cows , which will enable her to sell more milk.
Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy a milk cow.
Zamina is 38, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. She is married andhas 3 children.
She has been in this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is married and a mother of 2 children.  She is anInternally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village.
She breads cattle, then sells them. 
This 29-year-old woman has a lot of clients.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy 3 cows to improve her business.
She has 5 years of experience in the sale of animals.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen was born in 1937. She is a widow with five children. She says that the most traumatizing thing that has ever happened to her was the dead of her child and later the dead of her husband. These two deaths in her family were so painful to the extent that she herself developed sickness for some time before recovering. She has taken GHAPE loan before and paid back. She says that her business is good and some customers buy in large quantities now, that is why she wants to get this loan which will enable her expand her business and the poultry farm she has been running for some years now. She has been in this business now for many years and everybody in her neighbourhood knows her and she is of great help to them and other widows suffering with children that their husbands have left them with. She says that the conditions given by GHAPE for the repayment of the loans are very encouraging because interest rate is low. The profit will help her open workshops for those her children who learned a trade and complete education for those still schooling.


First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Trading/Poultry

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda was born in 1967 and is married to Mr. Chah Joseph Ntong. She has six children. The most painful thing she has had to bear in her life was the loss of her child and her father, and the biggest challenge she has faced has been to pick up the pieces of her life and move on again after these bad incidents.

She has taken GHAPE loans six times and paid them back. What she loves most about GHAPE is its policy of transparency, the fact that it gives everybody equal opportunity to grow out of poverty and the fact that GHAPE gives loans on a very low interest rate. She intends to rent a new farm, employ more task laborers and buy chemicals that will improve her harvest. She also plans to expand her palm oil business. This will benefit the community because she will employ members of her community and be able to provide vegetables and other farm products for their local market. She will also hire a sales person to help her with the palm oil business.

Her greatest dream is to settle her children to start off on their own with the profit from her business. She plans to repay her loan during the term. She expects that her first loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Matilda wants to buy palm oil to trade and farming supplies.

loans.name: Comfort Bih

texts.en:
Comfort was born in 1968.  She is married with five children. The most challenging thing she has faced in her life is taking care of her sick child who was initiated into a spiritual colt. What has wounded her so much in her life is maltreatment from her in-laws. With all this depression, she almost gave up when her pig, which was her only source of income at that time, gave birth and ate up all her piglets. This affected her because she had spent money on crossing the pig and on pig feed which she was expecting to recover after selling the piglets. She has taken GHAPE loan three times before and paid back. She intends to do poultry farming now (buying day-old chicks and raring them) and petit business.  She feels that this business will be a success because they have been trained by GHAPE on how to succeed on these aspects. She will be able to supply fowls and eggs to those operating restaurant businesses in her community. She says that this loan will help her expand her business and the profit will enable her to construct a house in her compound. This will really make her happy. 


First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Poultry farming and Roasting of Maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a buffing machine for vehicles

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline was born in 1965. She is happily married with four children. She likes business, but it was difficult for her to raise her take-off capital and her husband was unable to give it to her. She became more frustrated when her sister died and left behind children. It was not easy to provide food for her own children and those of her sister. She joined GHAPE in 2001 and received a loan of $30 and started her firewood business and gave part of the money to the children to trade. With the training received from GHAPE, she was able to sell the firewood and repay her loan. After this experience she decided to take another loan of $80 to continue the same business. She was now buying in greater quantity. She has taken loans up to $280. This business has made people call her “Mami Firewood.” The people in the community are happy with her business because she is the only one doing this business and she supplies them with local fuel for cooking and at a cheaper cost.

With this loan of $1000, she plans to continue her firewood business, which she will be buying in bulk and supplying to other people who have also entered into this business. She also intends to buy food items like rice, corn, groundnut, koki beans, Egusi, maggi and salt which she can retail alongside the firewood in her community.

She promised to repay her loan during the term, and repayment will begin on the fourth month from the date she receives her loan.

loans.use: Pauline, also known as "Mami Firewood" would like to buy more firewood and food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Bih Regina

texts.en:
Regina was born in 1949. She is married to a polygamist and she has eight children. She has been taking and repaying GHAPE loans but the greatest challenge she has faced was the fact that she spent her fifth Empowerment Credit at the hospital when she was sick and had to work so hard after she left the hospital to pay it back. The most painful incident in her life is when she lost her daughter and had to go through a very hard time trying to bring up her deceased daughter’s child who was still a little baby when her daughter died. She also lost another child and five of her sisters in a space of two years, leaving her with more than enough stress to bear.

She knows that her business will be a success because she has been doing this business for a long time alongside other business like renting out her house to tenants, poultry farming, selling wood, etc, and this has been a great success. This is beneficial to her community in that she provides cooked food to her neighbourhood everyday. At times when there is a funeral, she is paid to provide food for the programme. She also provides housing to others and wood which is the principal fuel of her community to her neighbours. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Regina would like to buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Vodou

texts.en:
Vodou K. is married and the mother of three. In addition to her own children, she is the guardian of two others from her deceased sister. Her husband works primarily as a specialty fisherman, a job that brings in very little income due to a drought in their area. Despite being illiterate, Ms. K. is a very courageous woman who works constantly selling grocery items. This is a business that had benefited from an initial $300 loan, which she repaid without a problem. Her goal is to improve her business and to respond to the strong customer demands challenging her, and so she is requesting a new loan of $600 to acquire more grocery items to sell. Financing this project will allow her to ramp up her ability to supply foodstuffs and to increase her income, for the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Mariée et mère de 3 enfants, Madame K. Vodou a à sa charge en plus de ses propres enfants deux autres enfants de sa sœur décédée. L’activité principale de son mari est la pêche artisanale dont les revenus sont faibles dus à une sécheresse dans leur zone. Malgré le statut d’analphabète de Madame K., elle est une femme très courageuse qui travaille sans relâche. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des denrées alimentaires. Pour cela, elle bénéficia d’un premier crédit de $300 qu’elle solda sans difficulté. Dans le but d’améliorer son activité et répondre à la forte demande qui se présente à elle, elle sollicite de nouveau un crédit de $600 afin de s’approvisionner plus en denrées alimentaires. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra de rehausser sa capacité de fourniture et d’augmenter son revenu afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquiring foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ndumi

texts.en:
Ndumi M. is a 43-year-old lady, and married with three children. She lives in Kitengela township near Athi - River one of the peri-urban towns of Nairobi. Ndumi also takes care of her younger sister aged 30 years who is HIV positive and is on anti-retroviral treatment. Ndumi also takes care of another sister who is asthmatic, and therefore cannot work effectively. Ndumi is also responsible for the upkeep of her sisters’ children. True to her Christian calling, Ndumi devotes some of her free time visiting people who are HIV positive and the disadvantaged people in Kitengela Township. During such visits, she takes to them foodstuff and clothes. 

Ndumi started her tailoring business in the year 1997. This was after she finished her tailoring course, which was conducted by the Singer company. Before that, she used to sell vegetables while at the same time making mandazi (a doughnut-like bun). Her mandazi’s were well sought after because they were delicious and she cooked them in a clean environment. Through the sale of mandazi and vegetables she managed to raise Ksh 32,000 (USD 490). 

With this money Ndumi bought a sewing machine and various types of tailoring materials. She then rented a stall in Kitengela where she is operating today. Due to the growing number of school-going children as a result of the government’s offer of free P]primary education, Ndumi is always busy trying to keep up with the high demand of school uniforms.            

Ndumi is therefore kindly requesting for a loan of USD 775. Given this loan in kind in the form of cloth materials for her tailoring stall, Ndumi will be able to add on to her stock of school uniforms, sweaters, ties, socks, and badges of different primary schools that have given her a two year contract to supply school uniforms. Ndumi intends to repay the loan within 8-12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing fabric

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Kayi M. was born in 1961 in Aklakou, which is still her home. She is married, the mother of six, and mainly cooks and sells meals in a traditional restaurant, something she has been doing for over 20 years. With her income, she manages to see to the schooling of her children. Nicknamed « Mother AKOUMETO », she is known by all the kids, and she enjoys a good reputation because of her generosity. Each day, she strives to meet customer expectations. Corn, oil, condiments, firewood, and fish are what is necessary for her to make meals. Towards this end, she is requesting a loan of $800 to acquire the basic ingredients. Meeting these needs will lead to a loyal customer base for her and to an improvement standard of living for her and her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1961 à Aklakou où elle vit encore, Madame Kayi M. est mariée et mère de six enfants. Plus de vingt ans déjà, elle a pour activité la préparation et la vente de repas dans un restaurant traditionnel. De ces revenus, Madame M. arrive à s’occuper de ses enfants en scolarité. Surnommée « Maman AKOUMETO » et connue par tous les enfants, sa générosité lui offre une bonne réputation à AKLAKOU. Chaque jour elle fait des efforts pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Le maïs, l’huile, les condiments, le bois de chauffe, les poissons sont les nécessaires pour la préparation de ses repas. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour faire l’approvisionnement de ses matières premières. La satisfaction de ces besoins amènera Madame Kayi M. à fidéliser sa clientèle et à améliorer son cadre de vie ainsi que celle de ses enfants.

loans.use: Acquiring basic ingredients to make and sell meals

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul was born in 1939. He is a monogamist and has eight children. What stands out as a challenge in Paul’s life now, is the sickness of his son who is a university student. What has wounded his heart so much in all his life was the death of his son who had just graduated from the higher teachers training college and was about to start work. Paul has been a beneficiary from GHAPE for six years, faithfully paying back his loans.

He wants this loan now to improve his pig farm. He believes this will be a success because he already has the technical know-how to handle the business. This has been his business for all these years. He provides the waste from the pigs to his community to use as manure. He also sells pork meat to his community. The profit from this business will improve his life and he will construct a house for himself. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Paul would like to buy piglets for his pig farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a charming 31 year old lady, has two children and is separated from her husband. She lives in the town of Ruai in the outskirts of Nairobi. By natural instinct Susan started braiding her sister’s hair when they were growing up. As time went by she became an expert in plaiting and braiding hair. A close friend of hers who was operating a salon suggested she learn how to apply chemical to clients’ hair and also how to style hair. Her friend taught her the skills free of charge over a period of two years. Susan saved Ksh 5,000 (USD 76) while she was a member of a merry-go-round group in her village. From this money, she rented a stall for Ksh 2,000 (USD 30) in the year 2005. With the balance she bought a mirror for the stall and then started plaiting clients’ hair since she did not have enough money to purchase salon equipment. Her friend Catherine Wambura then gave her a blow-dryer free of charge in order to support herself. Clients flocked her stall and by the end of the year 2005, from her small savings and proceedings from her business, Susan managed to buy a dryer. Today her salon is one of the most frequently visited salons in Ruai. Due to the growing number of customers and the desire to give them first class service, Susan is requesting for a loan of USD 475 in kind, which will enable her to purchase a blow-dryer, hair dryer, steamer, and various chemicals. This will greatly help to support her business since she could not steam clients’ hair before due to lack of a steaming machine. This equipment will greatly boost her business. She intends to pay her loan within a period of 8-12 months.

loans.use: To purchase  a blow drier, Hair drier, Steamer ane Hair relaxing chemicals

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Born in 1979, Komlan H. is married and the father of two. He works primarily as an engine mechanic of motorbikes. He also takes care of his apprentice younger brother and his wife, who is paralyzed due to a long illness. This situation used to compel him at times to turn to loan sharks, who made his situation worse. He has since benefited from a $350 loan, which he repaid without a problem because the interest rates on it were sharply lower than what the loan sharks were charging.

Mr. H. is requesting a new loan of $800 to set up a new, bigger, and better-equipped workshop. This loan will be very useful for opening his workshop and will have a very positive impact on his income, which will be reflected in his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Né en 1979, Monsieur H. Komlan est marié et père de deux enfants. Son activité principale est la mécanique des engins à deux roues. Il a également à sa charge son petit frère en apprentissage et sa femme paralysée suite à une longue maladie. Cette situation l’obligea à avoir recours de temps à autre aux usuriers qui l’ont ruiné d’avantage. Il bénéficia ainsi d’un crédit de $350 qu’il remboursa sans aucune difficulté puisque le taux d’intérêt était nettement inférieur à celui des usuriers.

Il sollicite de nouveau ce crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir mettre en place un nouvel atelier plus grand et plus équipé. Ce crédit lui sera très utile pour l’ouverture de son atelier et aura un impact très positif sur son revenu, ce qui se répercutera sur les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Opening a better-equipped shop

loans.name: Afi Ayoko

texts.en:
Born in 1980, Afi Ayoko K. is married and the mother of two. In addition, she also takes care of another child from her sister, who was killed in an accident. Her husband works primarily as a specialty fisherman. Because of very difficult conditions at home, she has been compelled to work to help cover household expenses. That is why she started selling basic food items. Given the flood of customer demands, she tried turning to loan sharks for help. But they made her situation worse with their exorbitant interest rates. And so she is requesting a loan of $800 as capital to stock and to transport food items, in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1980 Madame K. Afi Ayoko est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a à sa charge, en plus de ses propres enfants, un (01) autre enfant de sa sœur décédée suite à un accident. L’activité principale de son mari est la pêche artisanale. Les conditions de vie étant très difficile dans le ménage, madame KAOWO a été contrainte de se lancer dans une activité génératrice de revenu afin de pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. C’est ainsi qu’elle entreprit la vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Vu la demande de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’affluer, elle tenta de faire recours aux usuriers, ce qui l’a ruinée d’avantage car le taux était exorbitant. Elle sollicite donc aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir constituer un fonds de commerce pour l’approvisionnement, le transport et le stockage de ses produits pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, transporting, stocking, and selling basic food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock items for his general shop

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha A. was born in 1969 in Anfoin and currently resides in Aklakou Fonkomé with his wife and three children. To deal with the needs of his family, he managed to open a cafeteria, where he offers quality service to his ever-growing customer base. And importantly, with this source of revenue, he is able to feed his family. Famous for the quality and flavor of his coffee, he has achieved all this through personal effort. Living adjacent to the bus station in Aklakou, Mr. A. had been quick to realize that bus drivers need coffee even very late at night. With much effort, he gathered a meager sum and then timidly began his business. Today, after six years of experience, he would like to be able to handle rush hour demands, a challenge he faces daily. To do so, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a stove, coffee cups, and other necessities to meet the expectations of his customers. The more his revenues increase, the more his family's living conditions will improve.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Né à Anfoin en 1969, Monsieur A. Alpha réside actuellement à Aklakou Fonkomé avec sa femme et ses trois enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il parvient à ouvrir un cafétéria où il offre un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus importante. C’est d’ailleurs à partir de ce revenu que Monsieur Alpha A. nourrit sa famille. Réputé pour le goût et la qualité de son café, il y est arrivé à partir d’un effort personnel. Domicilié à coté de la gare routière d’Aklakou, Monsieur Alpha a vite compris que les transporteurs ont besoin du café même à des heures tardives. Alors il a réuni difficilement quelques maigres moyens et a commencé timidement. Aujourd’hui, après dix ans d’expérience, il souhaite être totalement à la hauteur de la forte demande qui se présente à lui quotidiennement. Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter une cuisinière, des tasses et autres nécessaires pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Plus les revenus augmentent plus il améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying a stove, cups, and other necessities for meeting customer expectations

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat N. is a 35-year-old man, married, and has one child. He lives in Kiserian, a town situated on the outskirts of Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. N. started selling snacks in 1998. He borrowed Ksh 12,000 (USD 185) from his mother as his initial capital. Due to his determination he has been able to pay back the money lent to him by his mother, and he has also educated his sister in-law up to “O” level. He went a step further by taking her to a computer college. Josephat’s decision for business expansion was influenced by his wife who works with a leading communications provider company in Kenya, Safaricom. 

After much discussion with his wife, they resolved to open a cyber café. They have already purchased a photocopier machine and in order to expand their business, they would like to purchase a computer. They have already rented a small stall and the sister in-law is doing photocopying work while they wait for the purchase of the computer. Josephat N. is therefore requesting for a loan of USD 475. Given this loan in kind, which is repayable within 8-12 months, Josephat N. will purchase a computer so as to support his business in the fast growing town and hopes to record higher income and provide better services to the people of Kiserian.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Stéphane

texts.en:
Born in Aklakou in 1980, Stéphane G. is married and the father of two. This responsibility obliged him to take on income-producing work. He opted to sell lamp fuel. Known by his customers for his generosity and effort, Mr. G. has been working in this type of business for over ten years. He has now mastered the intricacies of his business, which has earned him the nickname « PAPA BOUDE ».

He is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase his inventory in order to meet the demand, which is growing constantly. Mr. G. will then be able to achieve some improvement in living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Monsieur G. Stéphane, né en 1980 à Aklakou est marié et père de deux enfants. Cette responsabilité l’oblige à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a opté pour la vente du pétrole lampant. Reconnu par ses clients pour sa générosité et son effort, G. Stéphane exerce ce type de commerce il y a plus de dix ans déjà. Aujourd’hui, il a la maîtrise des rouages de cette activité, ce qui lui fait porter le surnom de « PAPA BOUDE ».

Il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1000 pour augmenter son stock afin de satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse d’accroître. Par là Monsieur G. Stéphane pourra atteindre une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increasing his inventory of lamp fuel

loans.name: Améle

texts.en:
Améle A. was born in 1964 in Aklakou, where she still resides. She is married and the mother of six. Her husband, a farmer by profession, does not completely cover all household expenses. To address the situation with regard to the needs at home, she started selling cold water. She was successful in saving a little money and invested it in selling smoked and fried fish. Today, she has good experience from 15 years in the fish business. Warmly accommodating and innately moral, Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more fish to meet customer demands. The success of this project will help her family to fully thrive where health, nourishment, schooling, and clothing are concerned.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Madame A. Améle est née en 1964 à Aklakou où elle réside toujours. Mariée et mère de six enfants, la profession d’agriculteur de son mari n’assume pas la totalité des charges du foyer. Pour pouvoir contenir la situation familiale en matière de besoins, Madame A. a commencé par vendre de l’eau fraîche. Elle réussit à épargner un peu d’argent et a investi dans la vente de poissons fumés et fris. Aujourd’hui elle a une bonne expérience dans le commerce de poissons après quinze ans de service. Dotée d’une bonne moralité et d’un accueil ouvert, Madame A. Amélé sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter plus de poissons pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet aidera Madame A. à atteindre l’épanouissement total de sa famille en matière de santé, de nourriture, de besoins scolaires et vestimentaires.

loans.use: Buying, smoking, and selling fish

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
Ayoko K. was born in 1959 in Aklakou, where she currently lives. She is married and the mother of four. Selling porridge and cakes is her main business. Today, she has over 15 years of experience that has earned her a good reputation. Nicknamed « Mother Vivi Vi », she is loved by all. Her request is for a loan of $600 to buy sugar, corn, firewood, flour, and oil in order to produce more porridge. In this way, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1959 à Aklakou où elle vit actuellement, Madame K. est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. La vente de bouillie et de gâteaux est sa principale activité. Aujourd’hui, elle a une quinzaine d’année d’expérience qui lui confère une bonne réputation. Surnommée « Maman VIVI VI » Madame Ayoko est aimée par tous. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour s’acheter du sucre, du mais, du bois, de la farine de blé, de l’huile afin de produire davantage de la bouillie. Par ceci, elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter son épargne.

loans.use: Acquiring corn, sugar, and other ingredients for making porridge

loans.name: Margarito

texts.en:
“I need to extend my house, since it is quite small. Now, there are four of us, all brothers, living here. To tell you the truth it’s very uncomfortable due to the limited space we have. We only have two rooms, one bathroom and the kitchen”. I’m requesting for a loan of $1000 for the construction of an additional bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito ampliar un poco mi vivienda ya que es muy pequeña, ahora vivimos 3 hermanos y yo pero la verdad ya resulta muy incomodo debido al poco espacio que tenemos para dormir solo tenemos 2 habitaciones, un baño y la cocina”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom for my house.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.en:
Cécile Y. was born in Aklakou in 1972. She is married and the mother of three. She is also the guardian of a boy in an apprenticeship who was left by her younger sister. Ms. Y. takes care of all these people by the fruits of her labor: cooking and selling rice, which has been her work for 9 years now. The stability of this business brings her a certain assurance which dispels all her worries. With pride in her business, she is requesting a loan of $600 in order to acquire rice, oil, and other necessities. She could thus meet the demands of her customers, and her family would then thrive.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née à Aklakou en 1972, Madame Y. Cécile est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi à sa charge un garçon en apprentissage, laissé par sa petite sœur. Madame Y. nourrit ce petit monde à partir du fruit de son travail : la préparation et la vente du riz. Cette activité, elle l’exerce depuis neuf ans déjà. La stabilité de ce commerce lui confère une assurance qui la met totalement à l’aise. Fière de ce commerce, Cécile sollicite un prêt de $600 afin de s’approvisionner en riz, en huile et autres nécessaires pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Par ce travail, elle pourra arriver à l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquiring rice, oil, and other necessities to meet customer demands

loans.name: Cécile

texts.en:
Cécile A. was born in Aklakou in 1968 and is married and the mother of four. She came to selling fish by doing volunteer work for fishermen. Each evening, she used to go and gather the fish that the fishermen had left. She would smoke them. Little by little, she developed an interest in selling smoked fish. And then she invested her small income in a carton of frozen fish. Once smoked, the fish were offered in front of her home. Today, she is a great merchant, renowned by local consumers. And so, the demand has gotten very good, but she lacks enough money to grown her business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase her production and to meet customer expectations. That is how she will succeed in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Madame A. Cécile est née en 1968 à Aklakou. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle est arrivée aujourd’hui à la vente de poissons à partir de son activité de bénévolat auprès des pêcheurs. Chaque soir, Cécile A. passait collecter les poissons restants auprès des pêcheurs, qu’elle fumait. A petit coup, elle a senti le goût de vendre les poissons fumés. Elle a alors investi son petit revenu dans l’achat de poissons en carton au frigot. Après fumage, elle les expose à la devanture de son domicile. Aujourd’hui, elle est devenu grande commerçante, bien reconnue par les consommateurs locaux. Du coup, la demande est devenue très forte mais elle ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour élargir son commerce. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 pour augmenter sa production et satisfaire sa clientèle. Aussi, réussira-t-elle à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, smoking, and selling fish

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akouavi was born in 1969 in Aklakou, where she still lives. She is married and mother of three children. She is able to provide for the needs of her children thanks to the earnings she gets from the sale of beauty products. Her nickname is "Mother CHOUCHOU" and her smile and welcoming ways make her a friend of everyone. With 15 years experience in this business, she has mastered all parts of this activity. She is asking for a loan of $800 to increase the range of the products she sells and meet the demands of the marketplace. In doing so, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akouavi est née en 1969 à Aklakou où elle vit encore. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle réussit à prendre en charge ses enfants à partir du revenu tiré de la vente des produits de beauté. Surnommée « Maman CHOUCHOU », son sourire et son accueil font d’elle une bonne femme aimée de tous. Dotée d’une expérience d’une quinzaine d’années dans ce commerce, elle maîtrise tous les rouages de cette activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter la gamme de ses produits et faire face aux demandes sur le marché. Par là elle réussira à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Increase the range of beauty products

loans.name: Essénam

texts.en:
Born in Aklakou in 1986, Mrs K. Essénam is a young married woman and mother of one child. With her high school education, she sells generic medicines. Her husband is a driver of a motorcycle taxi and doesn't earn a salary big enough to cover the needs of the family. After overcoming many difficulties in the early years of her business, she now understands it well and is nicknamed "The Pharmacist". She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy medicines in bulk and resell them on the retail market. She is looking to improve her array of products and therefore increase her revenues. This will allow Mrs Essénam to meet the many needs of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Aklakou en 1986, Madame K. Essénam est une jeune femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Instruite de niveau secondaire, elle fait le commerce des médicaments génériques. Son époux, conducteur de taxi moto ne dispose pas d’un grand revenu pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Elle a commencé avec beaucoup de difficultés mais après quelques années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle fut surnommé « Da Pharmato » et connaît aujourd’hui tous les rouages de son métier. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $1200 pour acheter en gros des médicaments et les revendre en détail afin d’augmenter son étalage et donc accroître ses revenus. Ceci permettra à Madame Essénam de satisfaire les nombreux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy medicines in bulk and sell them retail

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Ana Lucrecia T. C. is 39 years old with four children: she is a single mother, originally from Yepocapa Chimaltenanango. Only her father is still living, and he has helped her a lot. Her house is in the first canton. She belongs to the female order of “La Benedicion”. She’s known as Lucky, and she thanks God for giving her her life, family and especially her children, despite living in a time of some much strife, problems, jealousies etc.

She has to work incredibly hard, to allow one of her three sons to study, because she doesn’t receive the least help from the fathers of her children. Unfortunately her first husband abandoned her leaving her with two children, and then she got together again with another partner, but he also lied and left her as well with two children, and neither of these two men provide any financial support. Despite these huge failures, she says ‘I have managed to better myself little by little, because I have made huge efforts in order that my children have bread to eat. I also am extremely grateful to my father, he is very angry and bothered by my affairs, but at the same time my father is my right hand and it’s him who has most helped me.'

Lucky’s business is on one side of the Catholic Church of San Pedro Yepocapa. It’s a Restaurant. She gets up at 3 am to prepare from the house, and to transport things to the site she has in the centre, which she opens at 4am. Working together with her father, the two of them serve customers, because the inhabitants of Yepocapa are very early risers: they getup early to work in the countryside or to travel outside Yepocapa, and go to the café to drink a mug of atol, coffee and bread or other snacks. From daybreak, they serve full breakfasts, then they prepare for tea-breaks – they sell to teachers, children and bus attendants. Later they prepare lunches for their customers, and she finally closes by 3 or 4 in the afternoon. The truth is that she works too many hours but as she says she is working for a very important cause, to allow all four of her children the opportunity to study and obtain satisfaction in this way.

She is another of the very grateful clients of Friendship Bridge, for giving her the opportunity to join a Co-operative bank, she has already had both good and bad experiences when she had wanted to obtain a loan like that given to her by the institution, but other organisations have always refused her credit, because of negative information given to them by other people. Now she is a Friendship Bridge client and up until now has been a model participant, paying her instalments punctually and doing very well within the group.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Lucrecia T. C., tiene 39 años, con cuatro hijos, madre soltera, originaria de Yepocapa Chimaltenanango, sólo vive su Papa quien la ha apoyado bastante, su hogar está ubicado en el primer cantón. Pertenece al grupo mujeres la Bendición, lleva su primer ciclo.

La llamamos Lucky, le agradece a Dios por darle la vida, su familia y en especial a sus hijos a pesar de vivir en tanta tormenta, problemas, fracasos, burlas, envidias, etc.

Ella tiene que trabajar demasiado para darle estudio a uno de sus tres hijos, porque no tiene ni el mínimo apoyo de los papás de sus hijos, lamentablemente tuvo la primera experiencia de sus primer esposo, en al cual la abandonó con sus dos hijos, luego se unió nuevamente pero con otra pareja y resulta que le mintió y la dejó también con dos hijos, y ninguno de estos dos señores la apoyan económicamente, a pesar de este fracaso grande dice, he logrado salir adelante poco a poco, porque me he esforzado mucho para que mis hijos tengan un pan de que comer, como también le agradezco grandemente a mi padre , el es muy enojado y está molesto con mi caso, pero al mismo tiempo mi padre es mi brazo derecho y el que más me ha apoyado.

Lucky tiene su negocio también a un costado de la Iglesia Católica de San Pedro Yepocapa, es un Comedor en donde ella se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para preparar sus cosas desde su casa, y trasladarlo al local que tiene en el centro, el local lo abre a las cuatro de la mañana , trabajan juntamente con su papá, los dos se están ahí en su negocio, sirviéndoles a sus clientelas, porque la gente de Yepocapa es muy madrugadora temprano se levantan para ir a trabajar al campo o de viaje fuera de Yepocapa, y pasan con ellos a tomar una tasa de atol, café y pan o chuchitos, amaneciendo, sirve desayunos completos, luego se prepara para la refacción, les sirve o vende refacción a los maestros, niños y ayudantes de camionetas, posteriormente a preparar los almuerzos de su clientela, en fin ella cierra su puesto entre 3 y 4 de la tarde. La verdad es que trabaja demasiadas horas, pero como ella lo dice tiene una gran causa por la que ella trabaja, para darles sus estudios a los cuatro y así de esa forma sentirse satisfecha.

Ella es otra de las clientas muy agradecidas a Puente de Amistad, por darle el espacio de pertenecer a un Banco Comunal, ya que ha tenido la grata y mal experiencias en donde ella había deseado tanto adquirir un préstamo como la que le dio la institución, pero en otras instituciones siempre le desaprobaban su crédito, había una razón y era la información negativa hacia su persona de parte de otras personas. Actualmente es clienta de Puente de Amistad y hasta la fecha ha respondido de la mejor manera posible participa, paga puntual sus cuotas va muy bien en el grupo.

loans.use: Selling fast food

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.en:
”Thanks to God and to a lot of years of hard work I have my own house. I’m in the need to build an additional bedroom because my children are growing, and this type of social housing is quite small”. I’m requesting a loan of $1000 for the construction of a bedroom for my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo mi casa gracias a dios y a muchos años de trabajo, pero debido a que mis hijos están creciendo me veo en la necesidad de construir un cuarto más; ya que las casas de interés social son muy reducidas” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construction of an additional bedroom for my house

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.en:
Rosa Marina M. was born on 14 September 1965 in San Juan Comalapa, in the Department of Chimaltenango. Rosa recounts that like all the community, she suffered as a child as well as in part of her adolescence, because her parents had few economic resources. In 1982 her family was severely affected by the armed conflict, and one of the hardest moments was the loss of her husband as of twelve years ago. Because of this, she was extremely upset and the difficult situation meant she was solely responsible for providing an income to maintain her family. It was this situation that obliged her to fight for her children.

Now, she is a traditional artisan, and one of her dreams is to achieve economic stability: for this reason she wants to continue fighting to have the opportunity to deliver her products directly to a market, whether it be in Guatemala or even better overseas. She understands that currently the Guatemalan market and that of her own home town has some disadvantages: there is too much competition and this means that the products she makes have to be delivered at a lower price than she considers ideal. Thanks to Friendship Bridge, she has seized the opportunity to participate in the second cycle with the Women’s group EBEN-EZER, she feels a lot of gratitude towards this groups, because if it had not been for this organisation, she wouldn’t have had the opportunity and she considers them like part of her family who have offered her a lot of support.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En el año 1965 un 14 de septiembre, Nace la señora Rosa Marina ,M. en el municipio de san Juan Comalapa del Departemanto de Chimaltenango doña Rosa cuenta que ella pues como toda persona sufre de niña ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos, cuenta que tanto en su niñez y parte de su juventud sufrió. En el año de 1982 la familia de ella les afecto demasiado el conflicto armado, y uno de los fracasos mas fuertes fue la perdida de su esposo desde hace 12 años, y para ella ha sido muy doloroso ya que además de la difícil situación en la que se vive ella se hace cargo de gastos mantenimiento de la familia, fue la misma situación que la obligo a ella a luchar por sus hijos.

Ella se dedica actualmente a la artesanía típica y uno de sus mayores sueños es alcanzar una estabilidad económica por lo que quiere seguir luchando por tener la oportunidad de entregar sus productos a un mercado directamente, ya sea aquí en Guatemala o mucho mejor en el Mercado Extranjero, ella manifiesta que actualmente el mercado de Guatemala y en su propio municipio, tiene algunas desventajas ya que existe demasiada competencia y eso hace que el producto que ella tiene sea entregado mas barato del precio a la que ella considera mejor. Agrádese a Puente de Amistad la oportunidad que se le brinda ya que ella lleva el segundo ciclo con el Grupo mujeres EBEN-EZER y al mismo tiempo se siente agradecida con su grupo ya que de no ser por el grupo ella no tuviera esta oportunidad y considera parte de su familia que le han brindado mucho apoyo.

loans.use: Sale of typical artisanal products

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Married and the mother of six children, Mrs T. Pauline was born in 1972 and is also responible for the education of her younger brother. The main activity of her husband is farming. Her main activity is selling food in isolated areas where access to public transit is difficult. She is asking for a loan of $600 in order to buy foodstuffs in large quantities and to cover her costs of transportation. The financing of this project will allow her to increase her revenues and better deal with the health, education and nutrition problems faced by her household.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six enfants, Madame T. Pauline est née en 1972 et a à sa charge son petit frère scolarisé. L’activité principale de son mari est l’agriculture. Son activité à elle consiste à acheter des denrées alimentaires et à les revendre dans des zones enclavées où l’accès au véhicule de transport en commun est difficile. Elle sollicite un montant de $600 afin de pouvoir acheter ses denrées en quantité considérable et couvrir ainsi les frais de transport. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter son revenu et de mieux faire face aux problèmes de son foyer tels que la santé, l’éducation et l’alimentation.

loans.use: buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Kankovi

texts.en:
Born in Aklakou in 1959, Mrs A. Kankovi is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She was forced to leave school at a very early age because of a lack of support and is now starting to produce and sell cakes. To do this she is using the funds earned from selling chilled water, something she did previously. Her production capacity in the beginning was limited to a few bowls of flour and two litres of vegetable oil. She is seeing the demand for her cakes increase and wants to expand her business by buying bags of wheat flour, drums of vegetable oil and firewood. To do this she is asking for a loan of $700 to increase her production and revenue, thus improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Aklakou en 1959, Madame A. Kankovi est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Son mari est conducteur de taxi. Ayant abandonné très tôt ses études par manque de soutien, elle commença à produire et à vendre des gâteaux grâce aux revenus qu’elle a tiré de la vente de l’eau fraîche, activité qu’elle menait auparavant. Sa capacité de production au départ était limitée à quelques bols de farine et à deux litres d’huile végétale. Ayant constaté que la demande augmente, elle désire agrandir son activité : acheter des sacs de farines de blé, des bidons d’huile végétale, des bois de chauffe. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit de $700 pour augmenter sa production et tirer plus de revenu. Ainsi elle pourra alors améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Production and sale of cakes

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Aklakou, Mrs A. Kayi is married and the mother of four children. She is also responsible for two grand-children. Her daily activity is the sale of peanuts and also cereals. Nicknamed "Mother AZITO", Mrs Kayi started her business from her small peanut field. With 12 years of experience in this area, "Mother AZITO" knows her business well. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to be able to buy peanuts from other growers and resell them. The profits will allow her to provide for the numerous and increasing needs of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1971 à Aklakou, Madame A. Kayi est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle compte aujourd’hui à sa charge, outre ses enfants, deux petits fils. La vente de céréales et surtout d’arachide est son activité quotidienne. Surnommé « Maman AZITO », Mme Kayi a commencé son commerce à partir de son petit champ d’arachide. Douze ans déjà dans cette activité « Maman AZITO » cerne tous les rouages du commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir aller dans les zones de production d’arachide, en acheter et venir les revendre. Les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux nombreux besoins qui ne cessent de s’alourdir dans la famille.

loans.use: puchase, storage and resale of peanuts

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria was born on 25 October 1953 in the town of San Juan Comalapa in the Department of Chimaltenango, she’s now 53 years old. She considers herself as a spirited, fighting woman. She’s been a widow for almost 24 years: in the time of the armed conflict she found herself solely responsible for her three children. And from this time she has fought to continue her children’s advancement through the production of artisanal products. She says that for her and her family it has been a great help to receive the support of Friendship Bridge from the first cycle in the in June. In this time she has devoted herself to making only hupiles (traditional embroidered textile blouses) and now that the first cycle has already passed she has managed to begin her business selling dumplings in the market.

Maria’s dream is to one day export her artisanal products and with her new business she hopes one day to have orders not only for dumplings but also other snacks that she will prepare in bulk, so she will be known as a person who can prepare snacks for any activity.

Thanks to Friendship Bridge she has been given the opportunity and the knowledge to allow her to keep dreaming with her business.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Maria nace un 25 de octubre de 1953 en el municipio de san Juan Comalapa del Departamento de Chimaltenango, actualmente tiene 53 años de edad, se considera una mujer luchadora, es una mujer viuda desde casi 24 años, en tiempos del conflicto armado ella quedo bajo su responsabilidad tres hijos. Y desde ese tiempo hasta aquí pues ella lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, comenta que para ella ha sido de gran ayuda y su familia ya que en el primer ciclo en el mes de junio, ella empezó con el apoyo de Puente de Amistad y ella en ese tiempo se dedicaba solamente a la elaboración de güipiles ahora ya transcurrido el primer ciclo ella logro empezar con su negocio de venta de chuchitos en todo el Mercado.

Doña Maria, sus grandes sueños quiere algún día exportar sus productos de artesanía y con su nuevo negocio piensa algún día tener pedidos no solamente de chuchitos sino también de mas refacciones y que ella prepara en cantidad y que sea reconocida como una persona que prepara refacciones para cualquier actividad.

Agradece a Puente de Amistad la oportunidad que se le ha dado y los conocimientos que ha podido adquirir para soñar con su negocio.

loans.use: Selling typical artisanal products

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Born in Aklakou in 1977, where she currently lives, Mrs. Reine T. is married and has two children. A fashion designer by profession, but with no means to open a workshop, she entered the small catering business. Today, she maintains a significant clientele, but her means are not up to meeting their demand.

For this reason she is asking for a loan of $1000 to satisfy this ever-increasing demand. With this loan, she will be able to buy bags of maize, firewood, oil, and other necessities for her restaurant. Thus she will be able to generate more revenue and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Aklakou en 1977 où elle réside actuellement, Madame Reine T. est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Couturière de profession et ne disposant pas de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier, elle s’est lancée dans la mini restauration. Aujourd’hui elle détient une clientèle assez importante mais les moyens dont elle dispose ne sont pas à la hauteur de la demande.

A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse de s’augmenter. Avec ce crédit, elle pourra s’acheter des sacs de mais, du bois de chauffe, de l’huile et les nécessaires pour son restaurant. Ainsi elle pourra tirer plus de revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, firewood, oil, and necessities for her restaurant

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is 39 years old. She is a single mother with two small children and lives in the town of Cadereyta, in the state of Nuevo León. With the objective of helping her children to get ahead in life, she began her own business selling slightly used clothes five years ago. This job also allows her to give her children the time and attention they need. She began with very little capital, but with the sales experience she has acquired she has been able to grow her business. She now offers her products in several street markets and has also incorporated perfume sales.

In order to offer her customers wider variety and increase her sales, Olga is requesting a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to pay back the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can be an important part of the well being of this family. Your help will be of great use to this business. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga Lidia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos pequeños y viven en la localidad de Cadereyta del estado de Nuevo León. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos emprendió su propio negocio vendiendo ropa semi nueva hace cinco años, este oficio también le permite tener el tiempo y las atenciones que necesitan sus hijos, inició con muy poco capital pero con la experiencia que ha adquirido en las ventas ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, ahora ofrece sus productos en varios mercados ambulantes, y también ha incorporado la venta de perfumes.

Para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, Olga solicita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, mismos que se compromete a devolver en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el bienestar de esta familia, tú ayuda será de gran utilidad para este negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 38 years old and has two young daughters. Originally from Veracruz, she moved with her husband to the town of Cadereyta, in the state of Nuevo León, 21 years ago in search of better opportunities. As soon as they arrived there, Guadalupe began selling various foods and tacos in order to help with the household expenses. Her business is located in front of some factories. Most of her customers work in the factories and she has a steady demand for her products.

One of Guadalupe’s dreams is to open a small restaurant, for which she is saving money. She would like to improve her business and is requesting a loan of $550.00, which will be used to buy items necessary to the production of the foods she makes, such as frying pans, utensils, ingredients, etc. You can help improve this family’s life. Guadalupe needs your help and is sincerely grateful for your generosity and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad y dos pequeñas hijas, es originaria de Veracruz, se mudó junto con su esposo en busca de mejores oportunidades a la localidad de Cadereyta en el estado de Nuevo León hace 21 años, desde que llegaron Guadalupe empezó vendiendo comidas y tacos para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, ahora ubicó su negocio frente a unas fábricas, de donde son la mayor parte de sus clientes y tiene una demanda segura por sus productos.

Uno de los sueños de Guadalupe es poder abrir un pequeño restaurante, para lo que esta ahorrando, ahora desea mejorar su negocio y solicita un préstamo de $550 dólares que destinará la compra de artículos necesarios en la elaboración de sus comidas, como sartenes, utensilios, insumos, etc. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, Guadalupe necesita de tu ayuda y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad y confianza.

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment and supplies

loans.name: Soégnéaméto

texts.en:
At 58 years of age, Mrs. Soégnéaméto K. has seven (07) children. Widowed for almost six years, she alone has to meet the needs of her children, of whom four have abandoned their studies in order to be apprentices. To make ends meet, she buys coconuts on credit, and then transforms them to prepare coconut oil, which is highly appreciated and consumed throughout the area. Often the object of insults and humilation of her creditors, and in danger of using up her supply of coconuts at any point, she is resorting to this plan to obtain a loan of $650. This will help her acquire a coconut farm at low price and then let her exploit it to satisfy in a timely way the demands of her clientele, and especially to increase her income and alleviate her own pain and suffering and that of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 58 ans Madame K. Soégnéaméto est mère de sept (7) enfants. Veuve depuis bientôt six ans, elle fait face seule à tous les besoins de ses enfants dont quatre ont abandonné leurs études pour l’apprentissage. Pour joindre les deux bouts elle achète à crédit des noix de coco qu’elle transforme pour préparer l’huile de coco très apprécié et consommé dans tout le milieu. Souvent objet de tous les injures et humiliation de ses créanciers, et dans le souci de disposer à tout moment de noix, elle a recours à ce projet pour bénéficier d’un crédit de $650. Ceci l’aidera à acquérir une cocoterais à vil prix et de l’exploiter pour satisfaire à temps les demandes de ses clients et surtout pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et alléger les peines et souffrance dont sont victimes elle et sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire a coconut farm at low price and then to exploit it  in order to prepare oil

loans.name: Margarita Antonia

texts.en:
Margarita Antonia M. T. is from Santa Apolonia Chimaltenango and is 29 years old. She is a member of the Polancas community and her occupation is rearing and selling pigs and she also sells chopped vegetables in the Capital city. One of her dreams is to establish a pig farm and she already has sufficient space in which to house them: the only thing she lacks is the capital to establish her business. Margarita is a spirited, fighting woman and she has managed to advance with her 5 children despite the fact that her husband abandoned her.

She regrets that she is unable to provide her children with an education because of the cost of uniforms, equipment and other payments required by the schools. Her two eldest children of 13 and 14 are struggling with her in working to provide food for their little brothers and to support them in their studies for the next year. For the same reason she wants to save money this year and establish her business so that in years to come she will be able to better provide for her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Margarita Antonia M. T. es del Municipio de Santa Apolonia Chimaltenango tiene 29 años de edad pertenece a la comunidad las Polancas, su ocupación es crianza y venta de marranos y también se dedica a la venta de verduras picados en la ciudad capital, uno de sus sueños es establecer una granja de marranos ya que cuenta con suficiente espacio donde mantenerlos lo único que le falta es capital para implementar su negocio. Doña margarita es una mujer luchadora ya que ha podido sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos a pesar del abandono de su esposo ella ha luchado en su negocio.

Lo que lamenta es no poder darles estudio a sus hijos por los uniformes, útiles y otros gastos que piden en las escuelas ella no tiene la capacidad de cubrir los gastos, sus dos hijos mayores de 13 y 14 están luchando con ella en trabajar para darles de comer a sus hermanitos y apoyarlos en sus estudios para el próximo año por lo mismo ella quiere ahorrar en este año y poner o implementar su negocio para que el otro año pueda brindar mejoría a su familia.

loans.use: Pig rearing

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of three young men. Two of them are studying, which is why her husband’s low salary wasn’t enough to cover all the family’s expenses. In order to bring in some extra income, Rosa began selling shoes, cosmetics, and jewelry two years ago. Her liking for sales and her convincing words have helped her increase her number of customers and made her business grow.

In order to cover the demand from her customers and to offer them good service, Rosa needs a loan of $750.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to pay the loan back over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can help form a part of this business; your assistance is very useful to Rosa. She and her family appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hombres, dos de ellos están estudiando, por lo que el bajo salario que recibe su esposo resultaba insuficiente para cubrir todas las responsabilidades de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra Rosa inició con la venta de zapatos, cosméticos y joyería desde hace dos años, su gusto por las ventas y su facilidad de palabra la han ayudado a incrementar su numero de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, Rosa necesita de un crédito por $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, mismo que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte de este negocio, tu ayuda es de gran utilidad para Rosa, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Adévi

texts.en:
A young woman of 22 years, Miss Adévi N. is a student in her second-to-last year of high school. Brilliant at school and very entrepreneurial in her own small business, she comes from a very poor family where hunger and misery are daily occurrences. Determined to go far with her studies, Miss N. hast taken charge at school as well as at home. Her very elderly parents no longer have the energy necessary to support her. She learned from her mother the business of preparing coconut oil, which she has mastered perfectly. The sole source of income for her family, coconut oil is highly consumed throughout the area and needs financial means to render it profitable, especially during June and July, when market demand is significant. At the beginning of her summer vacation and hence the time of intense coconut oil-preparing activity, Miss N. wants to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $550 to buy a coconut farm at a good price, which she will exploit when the time comes. This will avoid the usual material-related shortages that take place after this time.

By putting her time to good use in producing enough oil, thanks to this loan, Miss N. will be able to ensure her return to school next year and will allow her parents to survive.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune fille de 22 ans, Mlle N. Adévi est élève en classe de première. Brillante à l’école et très entreprenante dans son petit commerce, elle est issue d’une famille très pauvre où la faim et la misère sont au quotidien. Déterminée à aller loin dans ses études, Mlle N. depuis trois ans se prend en charge aussi bien à l’école qu’à la maison. Ses parents très vieux n’ont plus l’énergie nécessaire pour la supporter. Elle a appris auprès de sa mère, l’activité de préparation d’huile de coco qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement. Seule source de revenu de sa famille, l’huile de coco est très consommée dans la préfecture et nécessite des moyens financiers pour la rentabiliser surtout à partir des mois de juin et juillet où la demande devient très importante sur le marché. A l’orée des grandes vacances et donc de la période d’intense activité de préparation d’huile de coco, Mlle N. a voulu miser gros afin d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter d’ores et déjà une cocoterais à un bon prix, qu’elle exploitera au moment venu ; ceci pour éviter les tracasseries habituelles liées à la rareté de cette matière première après cette période.

En mettant son temps à profit à produire suffisamment d’huile grâce à ce crédit, Mlle N. pourra assurer la rentrée prochaine des classes et toute l’année scolaire et permettre à ses parents de survivre.

loans.use: To buy a coconut farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
At 47 years of age, Mrs. Kayi G. is the mother of seven children who have been fatherless since 1998. Facing the needs of the household alone, she devoted herself to a small business of fried fish, which she buys on credit at the market to re-sell around the village which she crosses throughout the day. The meagre income barely suffices to cover the daily expenses of her family, who live in increasing misery. Having successfully gained many clients, Mrs. G. needs financial support to buy and fry fish herself to re-sell; this will increase her profit and hence her income. She is asking for a sum of $600 to provide herself with a can of oil, firewood, and a box of fresh fish in order to increase her income and alleviate the suffering of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 47 ans Mme G. Kayi est mère de sept enfants orphelins de père depuis 1998. Seul à supporter les charges de la famille, elle s’est consacré au petit commerce de poissons fris qu’elle prend à crédit les jours du marché pour revendre dans les quartiers du village qu’elle sillonne en longueur de journée. Les revenus très maigres suffisent à peine à couvrir les charges journalières de cette famille qui vit dans une misère accrue. Ayant réussi à avoir beaucoup de clients, Mme G. a besoin des moyens financiers pour acheter et frire elle-même les poissons et les revendre ; ce qui augmentera son bénéfice, donc son revenu. Elle sollicite un montant de $600 pour s’approvisionner en bidon d’huile, en bois de chauffe et en carton de poissons frais afin d’augmenter ces revenus et alléger les souffrances de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, fry, and re-sell fish

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.en:
Martha is married, is 55 years old, and has two children who are studying. Her husband is a seasonal worker in the United States. In order to bring in some extra money to help take care of and educate her children, Martha decided to begin her own business selling cosmetics and shoes two years ago. Things have gone well for her and she wants to increase the types of products she offers to include the sale embroidered table cloths and flower and fruit arrangements, which she makes herself.

Martha’s dream is to establish her business in a well-appointed shop. She wants to make her business grow. In order to buy more merchandise and the materials she needs to make her products, she is requesting a loan of $650.00, which she will pay back over a period of 6 to 12 months. The well being of this family is in your hands. Have no more doubts, decide to help Martha.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martha es casada, tiene 55 años de edad y dos hijos que están estudiando. Su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos de manera temporal, para obtener un ingreso extra para el sustento y educación de sus hijos Martha decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y zapatos desde hace dos años, le ha ido bien y quiere incrementar los productos que ofrece incorporando la venta de manteles bordados y arreglos florales y frutales, que ella misma elabora.

La ilusión de Martha es establecer su negocio en un local bien acondicionado. Ahora quiere hacer crecer su negocio, para comprar más mercancía y los materiales que necesita para elaborar sus productos solicita un préstamo por $ 650 dólares, mismos que regresará en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Martha.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: José Margarito

texts.en:
Forty-eight years ago, José Margarito’s father began the bread store where José learned this occupation. In search of better opportunities for his family, José left the city of Guanajuato for Monterrey 35 years ago. He worked in various jobs, but none of them paid well enough to cover the needs of his family. For this reason he decided to open a bread store and dedicated all of his time to it. Fortunately, demand for his products is good.

José is married and has three married sons, and a 16 year old daughter. Everyone helps out with the business. Family unity and José's daily hard work have made this business prosper. Now he needs a loan of $750.00, which he will use to buy ingredients to expand production and also to expand the physical area of front of the store. José needs your help to continue growing. Your support will be of great assistance. He and his family thank you sincerely .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 48 años, el padre de José Margarito inició con el negocio de la panadería, donde él aprendió este oficio, en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, José salió de la ciudad de Guanajuato a Monterrey desde hace 35 años, trabajó en varios empleos pero ninguno le daba a ganar un sueldo que cubriera las necesidades de su familia, así que decidió abrir una panadería y dedicarse a tiempo completo, afortunadamente la demanda por sus productos es buena.

José es casado y tiene tres hijos ya casados y una hija de 16 años, todos ellos ayudan eventualmente en el negocio, la unión familiar y el esfuerzo diario de José han hecho prosperar su negocio. Ahora necesita de un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción y ampliar su área de entrega. José necesita de tu ayuda para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad, él y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 34 years old, she is married and is the mother of four sons, who are 16, 12, 10, and 1 years old. Her husband works as a sales person at a business, however, his salary is not enough to cover all the needs of the family. In order to have some extra income, Dorotea decided to begin her own business selling tamales. She really enjoys cooking, and thanks to the high quality of her products, she has attracted many customers who put in orders for banquets and special events.

In order to fill all the orders she has from her customers, Dorotea needs a loan of $375.00. She will use it to buy ingredients to expand her production and to provide good service to her customers. She will pay back the loan over a period of 4 to 8 months. The well being of this family is in your hands. Have no more doubts, decide to help Dorotea.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Dorotea tiene 34 años, es casada y madre de cuatro varones, de 16, 12, 10 y un pequeño de 1 año de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como agente de ventas en una empresa, sin embargo, su salario es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia y para obtener un ingreso extra Dorotea decidió iniciar su propio negocio vendiendo tamales, a ella le gusta mucho la cocina y gracias la buena calidad de los productos que prepara ha logrado tener muchos clientes que le solicitan pedidos para banquetes y eventos especiales.

Para surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, Dorotea necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción y dar un buen servicio a su clientela, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses.
