En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Dorotea.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Agbessi

texts.en:
At 37 years of age, Mrs. Agbessi G. is married and has four (4) children, none of whom are in school. Her farmer husband, out of work due to the poor quality of his soil, is another person whose care she is in charge of. To survive, Mrs. G. started a small business of fried fish which she sells throughout the village and neighbouring markets. Having become the real head of the family, she does her job with passion and self-sacrifice, and generates income to meet the basic needs of her family. Mrs. G. wants to make her business more profitable by extending to other areas where she is asked for.

She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy with cash (and hence very cheaply) oil, firewood, and fresh fish in large quantities in order to meet the market demand. This loan will contribute to improving the living conditions of Mrs. G. and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 37 ans Mme G. Agbessi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants tous non scolarisés. Son mari cultivateur sans activités à cause de la pauvreté de ses sols, consiste une autre charge pour elle. Pour survivre, Mme G. s’est adonné au petit commerce de poissons fris qu’elle revend dans les quartiers et dans les marchés environnants. Devenu véritable chef de famille, elle exerce avec passion et abnégation ce métier d’où elle tire tout le revenu pour subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de la famille. Mme G. veut rentabiliser d’avantage son activité en conquérant d’autres localités où elle est sollicitée. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter comptant et donc très moins cher, l’huile, le bois de chauffe et les poissons frais en grande quantité afin de couvrir la demande sur le marché. Ce crédit contribuera à améliorer les conditions de vie de Mme G. et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, fry, and re-sell fish

loans.name: Sanjuana

texts.en:
Sanjuana is from Tampico, Tamaulipas. She is 47 years old, is very hard working and responsible, is married, and has two grown children who are 22 and 24 years old, and one 13 year-old daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver and does not have a fixed income, which makes it difficult to cover the debts of the household. Because of this need, Sanjuana decided to open her own seamstress shop, an occupation which she had learned at a technical school. She began with her friends, sewing by hand. Soon she was able to buy a sewing machine. The dedication she has for her job has allowed her to do high quality sewing work.

She now needs a loan of $650.00, which will be used to buy materials she needs in order to increase her production and to make her business grow. She promises to pay back the loan over a period of 5 to 10 months. You can be an important part Sanjuana’s and her family’s life. They thank you very much for your collaboration with them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sanjuana es originaria de Tampico, Tamaulipas, tiene 47 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y responsable, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 22 y 24 años y una hija de 13. Su esposo es taxista y no tiene un salario fijo, por lo que se dificultaba el cubrir las deudas de su hogar, ante esta necesidad Sanjuana decidió abrir su propio taller de costura, oficio que había aprendido en una escuela técnica, empezó con sus amigos y haciendo costuras a mano, pero pronto pudo adquirir su maquina de coser, la dedicación que tiene en su labor le ha permitido realizar trabajos de alta costura y confección.

Ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 650 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos, para incrementar su producción y hacer crecer su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de Sanjuana y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu colaboración.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Juanita Elida

texts.en:
Juanita is an enterprising woman with a huge desire to overcome. She is married and has two children, one who is 14 years old, and another who is one month old. Juanita used to work as a secretary in an accounting office, but because of personnel reductions she had to leave. Due to the need to find a job that would give her an income with which to help her husband, and allow her time to take care of her child, she began selling clothes to her acquaintances and family three years ago. As demand grew, she began to proviD. more products.

When her baby was born, Juanita had many expenses. In order to continue working, she needs a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy more merchandise. Her mother currently helps her tend to the business and cover the demands from her customers. She promises to pay back the loan during a period of 4 to 8 months. Juanita needs your help to continue working. Thank you for your support of those who most need it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos D. superación, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, uno D. 14 años D. edad y un pequeño D. apenas un mes D. nacido. Antes Juanita trabajaba D. secretaria en un despacho contable, pero por recorte D. personal salió, ante la necesidad D. obtener un empleo que le permitiera obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo, así como el tiempo para cuidar a su hijo, hace trece años empezó a vender ropa entre sus conocidos y familiares, y al ver la creciente demanda empezó a surtir más productos.

Al nacer su bebé Juanita tuvo muchos gastos y para continuar trabajando necesita D. un crédito D. $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra D. mercancía, ahora cuenta con la ayuda D. su madre para atender el negocio y poder cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en un lapso D. 4 a 8 meses. Juanita necesita D. tu ayuda para continuar trabajando, gracias por apoyar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Adjo Georgette

texts.en:
Miss S. Adjo Georgette was born in 1979 in Lomé. She is single. She is a master hairdresser with a dozen apprentices. She supports her parents, brothers and sisters. After graduating first of her class, Georgette opened up a shop under a shed by the side of a road where she brilliantly practices her job. Despite the number of her apprentices, Miss S. is not anymore able to satisfy her customers because of lack of adequate equipment and the tightness of her shop. To establish her customer loyalty and to increase their number, she imperatively needs to open up another shop and to equip it by buying hairdryers, shampoos and others modern products. To do so requires financial means that she does not have. Therefore, she is soliciting a $1200 loan that she will pay back with her income which will triple with the acquisition of the projected equipment.

Translated from [French] by [Bijou Kuzimbu], Kiva Volunteer.

Mlle S. Adjo Georgette est née en 1979 à Lomé. Célibataire, elle est maîtresse coiffeuse ayant sous sa responsabilité une dizaine d’apprenties et à sa charge ses parents et ses jeunes frère et sœurs. Sortie première de sa promotion, Mlle S. a ouvert son atelier sous un hangar au bord de la route où elle exerce avec brio son métier. Très appréciée et sollicitée, Mlle S. malgré le nombre pléthorique de ses apprenties n’arrive plus à satisfaire toutes ses clientes faute de moyens matériels plus adapté et de l’exiguïté de l’atelier. Aujourd’hui pour fidéliser sa clientèle et en augmenter, elle a besoin impérativement d’ouvrir un autre atelier, l’équiper en achetant des séchoirs, des laves têtes et d’autres produits plus modernes. Cela nécessite des moyens financiers dont elle ne dispose pas, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qu’elle pourra rembourser à partir de ses recettes qui auront à tripler avec les aménagements et l’acquisition des matériels prévus.

loans.use:
Open a shop and equip it 
(Ouvrir un atelier et l'équiper)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Gisela Guadalupe

texts.en:
Gisela is an enterprising young woman. She is married and has a 3 year-old daughter. Her desire to get ahead and to offer the best to her daughter have motivated her to begin her own business, even though she also works as a cash register attendant for a business. For the last year and a half, she has been selling gifts from her stall at a market in Sabinas Hildalgo, in the state of Nuevo León, which is where she is from. Fortunately, her business has been growing little by little.

Now Gisela needs a loan $325.00, which she will use to buy the merchandise she needs to cover the growing demand from her customers. She offers to pay back the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. Gisela wants her business to grow. She is thankful for your generosity and support, as it will be a great help to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gisela es una joven emprendedora, esta casada y tiene una pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Los deseos de salir adelante y ofrecerle lo mejor a su hija la han motivado a iniciar su propio negocio, a pesar de que trabaja como cajera, los fines de semana atiende su local donde vende novedades y regalos en un mercado desde hace un año y medio, afortunadamente su negocio ha estado creciendo poco a poco en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo en el estado de Nuevo León de donde es originaria.

Ahora Gisela necesita de un préstamo por $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía con la que podrá cubrir la creciente demanda de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Gisela desea que su negocio pueda crecer, agradece tu generosidad y apoyo, será de gran utilidad para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Married and mother of three children, 36-year-old Ms K. Akouvi specializes in the production of manioc flour, “Gari", which is the basic food in her community. Famous for the quality of her products, Ms K. has succeeded in having a very important part of the local Gari’s consumer market and is often solicited outside of her community. The demand is continually growing but unfortunately she is not able to satisfy it because of lack of funds. Today, she is more determined to face the challenge and expand her reputation in the zone. She is requesting a $750 loan to buy a crop of manioc, which will help her to make flour especially at this time of the beginning of rain season where the prices are very low. This project will give her financial independence and allow her affirm her position in her community.

Translated from [French] by [Bijou Kuzimbu], Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Mme K. Akouvi est âgée de 36 ans et spécialisée dans la fabrication de la farine de manioc « Gari » base de l’alimentation dans son milieu. Réputée pour la qualité de sa production, Mme K. a réussi à se tailler une part très importante du marché de consommation locale du Gari et est souvent sollicitée en dehors de sa zone. Une demande sans cesse croissante qu’elle n’arrive malheureusement pas à satisfaire faute de fonds de commerce. Aujourd’hui, elle est plus que déterminée à relever ce défi en accentuant sa notoriété dans la zone. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $750 pour acheter une récolte de manioc, qui doit lui servir à fabriquer la farine surtout ce moment de début de pluies où les prix sont très bas. Ce projet va lui conférer une autonomie financière et lui permettra de s’affirmer dans son milieu.

loans.use:
Purchase of manioc for flour production
(Acheter du manioc pour la fabrication de la farine)

loans.name: Missiagbéto

texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Afgnam where he still lives, M K. Missiagbeto is married and has four children. His main activity is a trade of spare parts. M K. supports his family with the income from that activity. With savings from breeding hens, M K. opened up a store to serve rolling equipment owners. Today, new demands are increasing because of the new types of engines in the Togolese market. To stock up with new spare parts, M K. is requesting a $1200 loan in order to be able to satisfy his customers. The product of his trade will bring an improvement in his family standard of living.

Translated from [French] by [Bijou Kuzimbu], Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962 à AFAGNAN où il réside encore, Monsieur K. Missiagbéto est un homme marié et père de quatre enfants. Son activité principale reste le commerce des pièces détachées. C’est à partir des revenus tirés de cette activité que Monsieur K. prend en charge sa famille. Arrivé à ce stade à partir de sa petite économie d’élevage de pondeuses, Monsieur K. a ouvert sa boutique pour satisfaire les propriétaires des matériels roulants. Aujourd’hui de nouvelles demandes affluent à partir des nouveaux engins sur le marché togolais. Pour s’approvisionner des nouvelles pièces de rechange, Monsieur K. sollicite ce crédit de $1200 afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Le fruit de ce commerce apportera à sa famille l’amélioration des conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts (Achat et revente des pièces de rechange)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is 42 and has five children. She has struggled - she has suffered from partial blindness, which has affected her entire life. Her children’s health and the death of her brother, who was very supportive, have caused more frustration in her life. These difficulties led her to seek assistance from GHAPE.

Victorine opened a restaurant with the help of GHAPE. Her family supports her business. This makes the work easier for her. She solves the problem of hunger in her community by supplying food to her neighbours every morning for breakfast. She employs youths to work on her vegetable farm. The profit from this business will allow her to pay school fees for her children and other family needs.

loans.use: Cooked food and Vegetable Business;  Farm

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 and the mother of eight children. She had difficulty paying her children’s school fees before she started her business. Lydia has been deeply affected by the death of her mother, father, and sister, and by the sickness of her son.

Lydia's business has benefited from one GHAPE loan already, and she paid back that loan on time. With this new loan, she will finish her house and rent it to tenants, from whom she can collect fees. She also serves the community through her food shop; she supplies doughnuts or fries that she cooks every day. She says, with this new profit, she will increase her business.

loans.use: Trading and a preparing a house to rent

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is 32 years old. She is married to Mr. T. George and has one child. She would like more children, but has had trouble having children. The family has also had to overcome the death of Victorine's brother-in-law. Victorine has benefited from GHAPE loans two times before, and has paid them back in full. She would like this loan to improve her pig farm and her fresh ground nut business.  She knows she will be able to repay this third loan because she has experience in her businesses and she knows there is a ready market. Victorine's farm is also good for the community because it provides employment to those who take care of the pigs. She will save the profit from her businesses and reinvest it so she will have her own capital, and not have to borrow again.

She plans to repay her loan in 18 months.

loans.use: Pig Farming and Fresh Ground Nuts

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 55. She is a widow with three children. Her greatest current challenge is paying her children's school fees, and also the poor health of one of her children. 

She has benefited from GHAPE loans in the past and has successfully paid them back. She says, thanks to the low interest rates, she has always paid back the loans with little stress. She believes her business is sound: she takes the manure from her pigs and uses it on her farm, sells her farm products and pigs and gets much money. She helps her community by making available these products and the manure for them to buy and improve their own farms. She intends to use the profit from her farm for the education of her children and expansion of her farm. She intends to take bigger loans in the future to grow her farm and build a good house for herself.

loans.use: Mixed Farming

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in 1949. He is married to one wife and has four children. The challenges he has faced in his life are, joblessness for three years, not being able to pay his children’s school fees and to provide a living space for his family. The most painful situation was watching his children miss their education for three long years. 
He has taken GHAPE loan and paid back and is requesting for this one now. Bali, where his business is located is one of the main suppliers of corn in the NW province of Cameroon, whose staple meal is corn fufu having a corn mill here is big business because he will grind corn through out the day since every body consumes it. He plans to provide corn flour to restaurants, provide animal feed to farmers and salaries to those who will work with him in the corn mill. 
He will use the profit to complete his business house where he will be collecting rents and taking care of his family. This will really change his life and make him very happy.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is married and has three children, who are 8, 10, and 13 years old. Her husband works in a business, but the salary he receives is not enough to cover the family’s expenses for their household and for the education of their children. Faced with the need to have extra income, Araceli began her own business selling chemical products one year ago. She started out by selling popular cleaning products, and little by little, she incorporated other products, as well. She sells her products from her house, in the town of Monclava, in CoahuiL..

Araceli works hard every day so that she can offer a better life to her children. Now she needs a loan of $200.00, which she will use to buy merchandise so she can offer a wider variety of products and thereby increase her sales. She promises to pay back the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. Your help will be of great assistance in the development of this business. Araceli and her family thank you sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli es casada y tiene tres hijos D. 8, 10 y 13 años D. edad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para solventar todos los gastos D. su hogar y L. educación D. sus hijos. Ante L. necesidad D. obtener un ingreso extra Araceli inició su negocio vendiendo productos químicos hace un año, empezó comercializando sólo dos productos D. limpieza, los D. mayor demanda, y poco a poco fue incorporando L. venta D. otros productos, realiza sus ventas en su propio domicilio en L. localidad D. Monclava, CoahuiL. .

Araceli es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día por ofrecerle a sus hijos un mayor bienestar, ahora elL. necesita un préstamo D. $ 200 dólares que utilizará en L. compra D. mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas, elL. se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso D. 3 a 6 mese. Tu ayuda será D. gran utilidad para el desarrollo D. este negocio, Araceli y su familia te agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 54. She is the only wife to Mr. Nche Thomas and has seven children. Her greatest challenge in life was when she was paralyzed for one entire year. She is still recovering. With the profit from her business, she will be able to purchase medication to speed up her recovery and improve her health. Patricia has benefited from GHAPE loans in the past and has paid them back. She feels paying another will not be difficult. She wants this loan to expand her provision store, to farm cassava, to pig farm, and to expand the business with her daughter. She feels she will be successful because the business has a good location and her daughter will help out when Patricia is not available.

loans.use: Buying and selling of food stuffs

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.en:
Cristobalina is a single mother with four children. She is from the town of Monclava, in Coahuila. She has had to work hard to provide for her children by herself, since she has never been able to count on their father for support. Since she worked so much, she used to be unable to spend much time with her children. This is why she decided to open her own grocery store two years ago. This job allows her to have more time for her children and to be able to provide for them.

Now Cristobalina needs a loan of $275.00, which she will use to buy merchandise so that she can have her business more well-stocked, and to offer better service to her customers. She promises to pay back the loan over a period of 5 to 10 months. Contribute to the development and growth of this business. Cristobalina and her family thank you for your generosity and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristobalina es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, es originaria de la localidad de Monclava, Coahuila. Ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, porque nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja, pero pasaba muy poco tiempo con ellos así que hace dos años decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, esta labor le permitiría tener más tiempo disponible para sus hijos y obtener los recursos que necesitan.

En estos momentos, Cristobalina necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Contribuye al desarrollo y crecimiento de este negocio, ella y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y confianza.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine was born in 1948. She is married with nine children. Her toughest challenges have been in her home, and the sickness of one of her children who is suffering from sickle cell anemia. She has benefited from a GHAPE loan in the past, which she paid back. Given a loan of $1,000, she would like to invest in her farm business, selling wood and other food products. She believes it is going to be a success because she already has experience in these areas and just needs capital to expand. She will also be selling prepared food to her community at a reduced cost. This will enable even the very poor to afford a meal per day.  She will use the profit from this business to send her last son to high school, build her house, and settle her other children in businesses.

loans.use: Farming/Selling of Firewood and Other Food Stuffs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and has four children, who are 5, 14, 18, and 21 years old. The family has gone through serious economic problems because the salary her husband earns is too little for them to be able get out of their debts. Two years ago, Elvira began to make and sell flour tortillas to her neighbors and acquaintances. Since it is a food that is eaten a lot in the north of Mexico, she has had good demand and has managed to attract many customers.

Elvira now needs a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy ingredients she needs to increase her production, and to cover the orders from her customers. She promises to return the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can help improve the quality of life for this family by contributing to the growth of this business. Thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, 5, 14, 18 y 21 años de edad. Su familia pasaba por serios problemas económicos porque el salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo y para poder salir de sus deudas Elvira comenzó a hacer y vender tortilla de harina entre sus vecinos y conocidos desde hace dos años, como es un alimento muy consumido en el norte de México, ha tenido una buena demanda y ha logrado tener muchos clientes.

En estos momentos, Elvira necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para incrementar su producción y poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Emmerencia

texts.en:
She was born in 1964. She is the only wife to Mr. Ngwa Michael and has five children. The most difficult trial she has faced is paying her children’s school fees and managing her house since her husband is not financially viable. The most painful things are that, there were times she could not afford just $10 to help her husband pay school fees for her child and when her mother was very sick and she had no money to take care of her treatment. 

She is a borrower in GHAPE. She believes that she will succeed because there are not many provision stores in her quarter nor women selling vegetable at the local square. Her community will be buying from her. Secondly, people will no longer have to pay taxis to the main market  for these small items. the profit will be used to expand her business and sponsor her children’s education. 
Her repayment will begin on the fourth month from the day her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Buying and selling of Vegetables and other provision

loans.name: Gloria Dalia

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is 2 years old and her sons are 7 and 10 years old. Her husband is a salesman. She began her business to help her husband with the household expenses, since his income wasn’t enough to support the family. Through a friend, she started in the business of selling cosmetics from the catalog of a brand that is very well-known in Mexico. Little by little, she built up a clientele base, and now she has a consistent group of regular customers who always go to her to buy her products. These products offer very good commissions, which is what attracted her to begin selling them.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of $200.00, in order to buy more products. She wants to buy them in a large quantity so that she can receive a better price, sell more, and earn larger commissions for her sales, and in this way help her family to get ahead. She offers to pay back the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support you give them, so she can continue with her business and make it grow, so that they can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria esta casada y tiene tres hijos dos hombres y una mujer, la menor tiene 2 años de edad y los hombrecitos tienen 10 y 7 años respectivamente, su esposo es comerciante. Ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que los ingresos de su esposo eran insuficientes para mantenerlos a todos y por medio de una amiga ella entro en el negocio de la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de una marca muy conocida en México, así poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes y ahora ya tiene una cartera fija que siempre acuden a ella para comprar sus productos. Estos productos ofrecen muy buenas comisiones que fue el atractivo de ella para empezar su venta.

Gloria esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 200 para poder comprar más productos y en cantidad para así poder obtener un mejor precio, vender más y obtener mejores comisiones por sus ventas y así sacar adelante a su familia, ofreciendo pagar este crédito en un período de 3 a 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le des para continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nicoline

texts.en:
Nicoline was born on the 20th of January 1976. She is a single mother of three children after divorcing her husband. She has faced some challenges in her life such as; stubborn children, no land to cultivate food for her family and the stigma from the society for being a single mother. What has wounded her so much is losing her husband through divorce, losing her property to arm robbers and lots of disappointments from men. Now she is left alone to take care of her three children.
Nicoline has taken GHAPE loans in the past and has repaid them. She want this new loan now to increase her business. She knows that she capable of paying back the loan because she has been paying back before and besides, this is the business she loves doing. She will help her community by providing lunch everyday and by also providing food for funerals and other occasions. She says that the profit will be used for her children’s education and to also to take of her family.
  
First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Selling of Koki

loans.name: Nkematoh

texts.en:
E. was born on the 5th of June 1962. He is married to one wife and has five children. The greatest challenge he has faced in life, is the loss of his parents at early age. Since then, he has virtually been struggling for survival and be a real man to his family. The death of his parents has created a wound in his heart which hurts each time he thinks about it.

He has taken loans from GHAPE and repaid. He intends to use this new loan now to improve on his farm. GHAPE has taught them latest ways of raring pigs and fowls that can easily give much profit. He will help his community by providing fowls and pigs during ceremonies and the droppings from pigs and fowls for manure for their gardens. The profit will help him increase his business and sponsor his children in school so that they can help him when he is old


First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Pig rearing and fowls

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia was born in 1947. She is a widow with five children. What stands out as a challenge for her right now is the poor health of her daughter and grandson. She has also had to overcome the deaths of her son and her son-in-law.

She has received GHAPE Empowerment Credit eight times previously and has repaid each loan. She needs this new loan to repair a house which she rents to tenants. She knows her business will succeed because she already has prospective tenants and the house is at the centre of a very busy town. She will use the money from her business to buy medication for her children and pay school fees for them.

loans.use: For house repairs to prepare the house for tenants

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is married and has seven children. She has been a vegetable farmer with a small farm for many years. Initially, she had trouble growing her farm.  With the advent of GHAPE in her community, she immediately joined the organization, received training on management and marketing techniques and later received her first loan of $40 in 2001. Since then, she has proven her credibility to manage and repay loans worth $880. 

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and with manure collected from her pig farm, grow cabbages, tomatoes and pepper on a very large scale. Since this activity will be labor intensive, some youths will have the opportunity to get jobs on her farm.

loans.use: Growing of Vegetables

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 63 years old and has seven children. The loss of his first wife and two sons, who assisted him in taking care of the younger children, brought hardship to his life. He decided to join GHAPE in 1999. He received his first loan of $30, which he invested in the production of window frames, iron doors and the sale of palm wine. His community has benefited substantially from his iron door business in particular; robbery is very rampant and with the availability of iron doors, thieves find it difficult to break into houses. He also supplies palm wine for celebrations and to small retailers.

Given a loan of $1200, he plans to buy a filling machine, iron rods and expand the size of his raffia palm bush for increased production of palm wine.

loans.use: Buying of welding materials and sale of palm wine.

loans.name: Ngum Linda

texts.en:
Born in 1982, Linda is already a widow with two children to look after. Realizing the many needs of her children and herself, she is looking to expand her business. Motivated by other GHAPE members in her community, she became a member this year, in 2007. 

Given a loan of $75, she plans to buy rice, groundnuts, beans and onions to sell in her community. There is a ready market in her community for the food she will prepare. The money she generates from the business will be used to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase raw food products to sell in her community

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Sarah is a widow and has five children. She found things very difficult when her husband and son died in a motor accident. Unable to take care of the other children, she joined GHAPE in the year 2004 and received her first loan of $40 which she used in retailing fruits and vegetables. Her business site is situated near a daily market and so shop-keepers, hawkers and other buyers provide her with an encouraging sale all the time.

Given a loan of $800, she plans to buy pineapples, oranges, coconuts and vegetables for retail. She plans to repay the loan during the term, and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement

loans.use: Sale of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has five children. She was robbed of her business capital and things became so difficult for her. In an attempt to rescue the situation, she joined GHAPE and received her first loan of $40 in the year 2006. Her activity has undoubtedly increased the amount of foodstuff in her local market as there is an ever increasing demand.

Increasing her business capital by $300, she hopes to buy maize, tapioca, and onions. In this way, she can meet up the demand of most of her customers. The profit she gets from the business will be used to renovate her home and improve on the living conditions of her family.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the day of disbursement.

loans.use: Sale of foodstuff and vegetables.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a widow and has three children. The death of her husband brought a lot of stress on her as she was left alone to take care of her children and her self. This made her to look for assistance and GHAPE came to her aid when she joined the organization in the year 2001 and received her first loan of $30 and started her mobile Koki restaurant. Since then, she has received loans worth $610 and her community has been benefiting from her activities as she supplies food to hawkers and school children during break time.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to buy 500kg of Koki beans, 100 liters of palm oil and cocoyam seeds. The profit she gets from the loan will be used to repair her broken roof.

She plans to repay the loan in 24months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Sale of Koki and growing of cash crops

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a single 30-year-old woman. She is a mother of two young children. She lives in the San Isidro neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She has a business of selling chicken. She cooks them at her premises located on the main street of the city. She serves the hot freshly cooked chicken in plastic containers with manioc for the enjoyment of her clients. The loan will be use to have the capital in order to buy more chicken and to offer a larger menu with empanadas and breaded veal cutlets. The profits will help to support the family and to pay her children’s education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una señora soltera con 30 años de edad, tiene su vivienda en el barrio San Isidro de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, y es madre de 2 hijos ambos menores de edad. Blanca se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos los cuales cocina al espiedo en su local comercial ubicado en la principal arteria de la ciudad. Ella entrega el pollo en envases de plástico a los clientes, recién cocinados y calentitos, acompañados de mandioca también servida caliente para un consumo placentero. El destino del crédito sería capitalizarse para la compra de pollos y a la vez ampliar su local con minutas como empanadas y milanesas. La utilidad generada será utilizada para la subsistencia de la familia y gastos de educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Rogers is the oldest of three brothers. He spent most of his life working and studying in Asunción. He worked with his uncle in an electric motor rewind repair shop where he learned the electro mechanic profession. After some time, he decided to return to his hometown and he set up a workshop in his house. He has already hired other two persons and they all repair electrical engines. Besides he collects copper wire and he sells them again, since according to him these sell at a considerable price on the market. He wants to use the loan to buy supplies for the repair of the engines that are the base of his small-scale enterprise. The profits will be use to support his family and to employ more people.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Roger es el mayor de cuatro hermanos. La mayor parte de su vida la pasó en Asunción, trabajando y estudiando. Trabajó con un tío suyo en un taller de rebobinados de motores eléctricos donde aprendió la profesión de electromecánico. Después de un tiempo decidió regresar a su ciudad natal y monto un taller en su casa en el cual ya emplea a otras dos personas. En su local tiene varios motores eléctricos que los repara por encargo. Aparte junta los hilos de cobre y los vuelve a vender, ya que según él estos se venden a un precio considerable en el mercado. El quiere destinar el crédito para la compra de insumos para la reparación de los motores que son la base de su pequeña empresa. La utilidad generada será utilizada para subsistencia de la familia y generar más recursos para emplear a más gente.

loans.use: Buy copper wire

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 35-year-old is married woman. She has three young children. She lives in the Azucena neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She buys food in the Brazilian city of Foz de Yguazú, and then she markets it to businesses in the city of Coronel Oviedo. Among her products we can name chacinados (varieties of sausage), chicken and oil which she delivers to her clients’ premises in a motorcycle.

The loan will be used as capital to buy enough basic products since her clients are quite demanding and they don’t like delays with their orders. The profits will help to support her family and to pay for the schooling of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia es una señora casada con 35 años de edad, y tiene su vivienda en el barrio Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo. Es madre de 3 hijos, todos menores de edad, y se dedica a la compra de artículos comestibles en la ciudad brasileña de Foz de Yguazú, para luego comercializarlos en los negocios de la ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo. Entres sus productos podemos citar los chacinados y pollos en general, ademas de aceites, que los transporta en motocicleta hasta el local de sus clientes. El destino del crédito sería capitalizarse para la compra de sus artículos de primera necesidad, ya que su clientela es exigente y no aceptan demoras en sus pedidos. La utilidad generada será utilizada para subsistencia de la familia y costear el estudio de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a retired professor in the city of Coronel Oviedo, since she is still young, she decided to open a business of selling food and drinks at her own home. She is married and has an under age daughter. Her husband works in a cotton fluff remover company nearby their house. For this project Blanca has refrigerators and display cabinets. The loan will be use to buy merchandise to sell it at her shop. The profits will help to support the family and to pay her daughter’s school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una docente jubilada de la ciudad de Cnel. Oviedo, como es joven aún y ya se jubiló del magisterio, decidió abrir un negocio de comestibles y bebidas en su domicilio. Ella es casada y tiene una hija menor de edad. Su marido trabaja en una desmotadora de algodon cerca de su domicilio. Para este emprendimiento Blanca cuenta con heladeras y vitrinas, que le son de mucha practicidad en sus queaceres diarios. El destino del crédito sería la compra de mercaderías para venta en su local. La utilidad generada será utilizada para substistencia de la familia y costear los estudios de su hija.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab H.,  a 47 year old mother of 6 children, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a farm on a small piece of land growing rice crops and different kinds of vegetables. She typically makes around $5/day in revenue, while her husband and three of her children make a meager salary from working in a small hotel. 
In order to increase the family's savings, Chab H. is asking for a $1200 loan to purchase more seeds to plant on her farm. Another part of money is to buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation from and to work. 
For the coming year, H. plans to increase the  variety of crops as much as she can so that she will be able to send her children to a local university.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow in her farm.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang M. is 45 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children.  She and her husband run a small auto repair shop--mostly fixing motorbikes.  They will use this loan to purchase tools for their shop so they can service more complex problems.  In the future, Tang M. and her husband hope to open a second shop that sells rice and soup.  They hope to earn enough money to give their children a higher quality education.

loans.use: To purchase tools for auto repair shop

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. Chek M., 39 years mother of 3 children, lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells fish on the roadside of a village and typically makes about $10/day in revenue, while her husband is talent in fishery and normally catches many fishes a day for her to sell.
Chek M. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a boat with machine, fishing net, fishing rod, and other materials for her husband to run his fishery. 
In the future, she would like to save enough money to own a stand in a market as well as building a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a boat with machine, fishing net, fishing rod and other meterials for her husband's fishery.

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart to all lenders.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin T. and her husband are 44 years old and live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with their 5 children.  The couple works together, selling pickles at a local market.  They earn a combined $7/day in this venture, and their children work at a garment factory and a small nearby restaurant--contributing regularly to the family income.  Phin T. will use this loan to buy a trailer for her husband's motorbike.  With the trailer, they will be able to transport larger amounts of their product more cheaply.  In the future, Phin T. simply wants to sell more pickles, as she says, "there is a great demand for pickles and I want to satisfy my clients by making more pickles."

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport pickles to the market

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven V. is 48 years old and works at a water supply company in Phnom Penh.  His wife works at a nearby garment factory, and together, they have 1 young child that attends school.  Ven V. will use this loan to build a house which he will then rent out.  He hopes to save money so he can continue to invest in ventures like these that will provide his family with a more stable income.  With the extra income they earn, Ven V. would like to give his children a better education.

loans.use: To build a home for rent

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim S. is 48 years old, and she runs a small business of renting out rooms to garment factory workers.  She earns about $9/day in this business, and her husband contributes $2/day which he earns working as a motor taxi driver.  Chim S. and her husband support 6 children--4 of whom work at a garment factory.  She will use this loan to build a home with four or five new rooms for rent.  Over time, she hopes to save enough money to reinvest in her business and make it much larger.

loans.use: To build a small home for rental

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S. is a 60 year old widow living in Phnom Penh.  She supports 7 children by working in her small field growing a variety of crops.  From this, she can earn $2.50/day, and three of her children work in the garment factory and help support their family.  She will use this loan to purchase a cow to help her in the field.  In the future, Un S. hopes to save enough money to open a small grocery shop.  With the income she earns, she would like all of her children to finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to help her in her field.

payments.comment: Un Sarun has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Doum

texts.en:
Mrs. Doum S. is a 41 year old mother of 5 children who are students and lives with her husband (pictured here because S. is at home) in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking meals for her family. To supplement the family's income, S.'s husband, meanwhile, makes about $16/day in revenue by purchasing, feeding and selling cows to retail businesses. To help with this, S. is asking for $1000 loan to purchase more cows to invest in this business activity. 
For the coming years her husband plans to increase more cows in his livestock, so that two or three years ahead he will make additional income for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for a business.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa H. is a 31 year old widow that supports her 2 children.  She sells sugar cane juice and a limited number of grocery products at her road-side stand.  She earns about $5/day from this business.  This loan will be used for purchasing sugar cane, seeds, and beverages so she can expand her shop.  In the future, she would like to move up to Siem Reap to sell clothes in the market.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane, seeds for her field, and drinks for her small shop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 36 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  She works at a garment factory, earning $4/day, while her husband spends most of his time working in their field.  This loan will be used to purchase more seeds to grow in the field.  In the future, they hope to continue growing many kinds of vegetables to sell locally, and also to the larger markets in the city.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow in her field

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en:
Mrs Thoeung L. is a 59-year-old mother of 5 children who lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers, cultivating, plowing and growing crops in a field and making about $5/day from their plantation. Meanwhile, 2 of her children (pictured here because Thoeung L. was in the field) work at an airport as security guards and typically make a good income, which is a big help for their family's expense. The rest of their children are students at a nearby school.

Thoeung L. is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase a trailer so that she can transport her daily outputs to sell at a market. In the future, she hopes to own another piece of land to grow a great variety of crops in order to satisfy her clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport their products to a market.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Chorn T. is 32 years old and works as a tailor in Phnom Penh.  He can earn $10/day in his business, and his wife helps out at his shop.  They have one young child, and they are hoping to gain more income to support him through school.  This loan will be used to purchase more clothes for the business.  In the future, Chorn T. is confident that his business will continue to grow so that he can properly support his child.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for his tailoring business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Chorn Tivorn for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
C. Bosco has been an active member of Life in Africa since 2005. He currently works at the WE center as a gatekeeper and also participates in the paper bead production. Cieye also works with a Life in Africa partner (invisible children bracelets) as a sander. He is married and has 3 children.

He was forced to flee from northern Uganda to central Uganda due to Joseph Kony's rebel activities in his district. He lives with his family in the displaced persons camp known as Acholi Quarters. There, he earned some money working in the stone quarry. Since he came to Life in Africa, he has been able to provide much more for his family, and life has been much easier.

He is among the first LIA members who got a loan from Kiva, and he repaid it without any hardship! His loan request was for building a family house in Acholi Quarters on a plot the King of Buganda donated to the Acholi some years back. He did not actually use that loan to build a house in Acholi Quarters, but in his home district of Pader, since the situation in the north is not as alarming as it used to be. He felt he should own a house in his home district, though he will continue working in Kampala.

He built a three-room family house that is almost finished but is still lacking doors and windows. He is, therefore, seeking a loan amounting to 250,000 (US $150) so that he may own a house of his dreams. He will be able to repay this loan in 3 months with savings from his salaries that he earns from different sources.

Below is his budget:

-3 wooden doors @ 50,000/=……………150,000/=

-2 wooden windows @ 20,000/=…………40,000/=

-1 bag of cement @ 19,000/=………………19,000/=

-1 tin of paint @ 10,000/=……………………10,000/=

Labor @ 31,000/=…………………………………31,000/=

loans.use: Fixing doors and windows

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung Rorn, is 56 years old and is a mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells fish and typically makes in average about $5/day. Her husband, meanwhile, is a fisherman. He also raises pigs. 2 of this couple's children are construction workers and  three are students. Kung Rom hopes the loan will assist her to purchase fishing nets for her husband and oth 4 pigs to add  to her livestock. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to purchase a boat with a machine and fishing nets to facilitate her husband's fishery.

loans.use: To purchase 4 pigs and fishing nets for a business.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  Sorn works as a tailor, and earns about $7/day, while her husband earns $3/day running a small lottery business.  Sorn currently works for a wage, but she feels she has the skills to start her own business.  With this loan, she will buy clothes and a sewing machine to get her own tailoring business started.  In the future, she will use additional income to buy a larger shop, and possibly hire a few employees to help her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and a sewing machine to start her own tailoring business

payments.comment: Mrs. Sorn Sophea has been very successful with her tailoring business. She has repaid her loan early! Thank you for helping her grow her business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. is a 37 year old mother of 5 children who attend school. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells rice crops which she buys from the villagers to a market or wholesalers. This business activity can generate around $5/day in profit, while her husband typically makes around $5/day from working at construction. In order to maximize a size of business, Chan is asking for an $1100 loan to purchase more rice crops to restock and keep selling them. 
In the future, she hopes to save enough money  to reserve for her business cycle.

loans.use: To purchase rice crops from villagers and sell them to wholesalers or market.
